description:
I've debated whether this place is a 4 or 5, and if I'm honest if this were for food alone I would give it a 5. 

Let's start with the decor - this place is beautiful with its high ceilings, long sweeping bar, and gorgeous furnishings. Very different from most Indian restaurants you'll see any almost any city.

The main part, The Food - Dosa has arguably the best masala dosa in SF. Between this and the chana Bhatura I would eat here every day for the rest of my life. The veg sliders are also delicious, as are the lamb sliders (I am a carnivore, but vegetarians do well here) 

The service - I've had varied levels of service in my many visits, both with sitting at the bar to eat, and in their dining room. There was a issue with our dinner  one evening when our server was not seen for almost the entire meal, and our side plates not changed between courses (3 of us dining) in fairness although the server was inattentive when we spoke to the manager she did her best to sort it out. The service I've received has never been outstanding, which is why I'm only giving this place 4 stars, and why I probably wouldn't take out of town guests here.
author: Marie D.

description:
Dosas are not worth the money. They threw in a pound of red chilli powder in their prawn curry and yet charged $34 for it!

Never returning to this place again.
author: Dinesh G.

description:
Second time coming here for me and I'm definitely a bit disappointed. Having eaten dosas forever while growing up, it is kind of annoying to see each dosa plate cost nearly $20 and there is really nothing special about them. Having said that, the ambiance is great and the food tastes decent. 

We ordered and split three dosas: the rava dosa, the egg dosa, and the spicy aloo dosa. The texture of the dosas is pretty great but the taste varies. My favorite is the rava dosa because of the crispiness and they make it very crispy here. The egg dosa kind of felt like a normal dosa with just a small piece of egg in it - you really couldn't taste it that much when combined with the rest of the dosa. The spicy aloo dosa was also really good although I felt there was a bit too much aloo in the dosa and that it didn't mix well. It is spicy but it is manageable. The dipping sauces are great too - the coconut chutney is good and the sambaar is very tasty as well. They also give very crispy and tasty papads at the beginning of the meal. 

Overall, however, I think the place is overpriced for what the food is (the cost is mainly for the ambiance). The presentation is very standard and the taste of the food is nothing great. Good to go for a first time, especially if you haven't tried dosas before, but probably won't be coming back in the future.
author: Sampath D.

description:
SO DELICIOUS. Wow. Highly, highly recommend. I came here with a South Indian friend who lived in India for more than a decade and grew up with these foods locally, and even he approved! (Minus the price, haha.) The Goat Byriani was absolutely amazing, and the meat was so so tender. Very good, balanced spice too. It comes with a bread layered on top that isn't usual in India and caught us by surprise, but our waiter said it's too keep the Byriani warm. And the bread is delicious! We also shared poori (puffed bread) and a Masala Green Chile and Garlic dosa. We were so full after eating this! The flavors were out of this world and so authentic. 

We didn't have a reservation for Saturday night but managed to snag a high-top table nevertheless without a wait. They do seem to have reservations quite available so I'd recommend that. Parking can be a pain in the butt in the area but manageable (and street parking is free after 6pm!:) )

Please do yourself a favor and treat yourself to DOSA sometime!
author: Li W.

description:
Made the reservation through yelp last week for yesterday for 4 people. They called to confirm the reservation. When we came to the restaurant, there was no reservation. 

The food was pretty average as well. We had rava dosa, plain dosa and quinoa uttampam.

There are plenty restaurants with good ambience. Good service and food is equally important.
author: Surbhi K.

description:
I have been to this place a lot of times, and though most of those would have been 4 star plus, my current experience was'nt all that great

The Ambience was nice and trendy, we did'nt reserve a table in advance so got the communal tables near the bar( these tables don't have any space at all)

The service was a little late, although out server was nice 

The Food

1. Vada Pav - This used to be 7 star / 5 for me, in the past they served this with ghee and chat powder/ chutney on the side and the onions were caramelized, it didnt seem to be the case this time and hence rating this 4/5
2. Monsoon drink - This was the best item from all the food we ordered.5/5
3. Paneer Dosa - I didnt know they dont serve coconut chutney along with the tomato and mint chutney. They quality of the chutney was great, although I dint enjoy the dosa as much. 3/5
4. Chole Bhature - I didnt enjoy this at all, have had much better chole bhatures 

For the price, you would expect an amazing experience, but wasnt the case this time. My total bill was around $72 all inclusive, and the experience wasnt worth it
author: Amar P.

description:
This is the iconic South Indian restaurant in San Francisco.  A group of us had a fantastic dinner experience here one Saturday night. We shared a bunch of plates - lamb dosa, rava masala, uttapams, chicken curry, goat belly and tapioca kheer.  Everyone had a nice cup of chai with dinner as well. 

The goat belly (honey and pepper roasted) was definitely the best part of the meal.  It was a real treat and we got the last order that night.  Other items were also quite good - I would re-order that chicken curry and lamb DOSA any day.  

The ambiance inside the restaurant is nice. I particularly liked the high ceilings and the abundance of natural light.  Service was really good and the food came out really fast. Relatively inexpensive for a fine dining experience - including tax and tip, this was about $70 per person. Highly recommend this place for those looking for an Indian feast.  Definitely more fun with a group.
author: Andrew S.

description:
There's been an influx of new Indian restaurants in SF in the last 2 years, & I love that.  But DOSA has been here (first location is in the mission) for decades.  And this location, her younger, chic sister, is now 10 years old.

Time. Flies.

I remember when DOSA Fillmore first opened, back in 2008.  The aromas, the aesthetic, the fabulous food.  SF really needed "nice" Indian restaurants.  And DOSA Fillmore certainly delivered.

How can you come to a restaurant called DOSA, & not order dosa?!  Order dosa for chrisakes!  The curries are excellent.  Especially the lamb.  The appetizers, especially the poori, are delectable.  The kitchen really hits all the right notes w spices & flavors.

Flavors are amazing!

Classy & buzzy vibe.  Great for date night or w a group.  And cocktails?  Mixologists hard at work creating & delivering not your run-of-the-mill drinks.  

Still a winner.

And I still want those chandeliers!

4 stars
author: Veronica M.

description: Really enjoyed dosa on Fillmore. It felt like a modern spin on Indian food. The food was all delicious. Had the paper masala dosa, which was great. Mango lassi was really thick, maybe a little too thick, but really good. Rasmalai was great. Will definitely go back.
author: Neil S.

description:
For my family, dosas = comfort food. When you're hungry and just want something flavorful and filling, dosas are usually a go-to. So, when we walked in to Dosa on Fillmore, we had very high expectations.

Walking in through the large heavy door, you're instantly greeted by the heavenly aromas of South Indian cuisine in an open room, lit by elegant chandeliers. We came in at around 8:15pm on a Saturday evening without a reservation and opted to sit at the communal table to avoid the wait. Luckily, we got a spot at the end, so it wasn't too cramped for the four of us. Our server was friendly and attentive, despite being quite busy, and patiently answered all of our questions.

My family and I ordered the Idli Sambar, Chile Garlic Dosa, Rava Masala Dosa, Masala Dosa, and Spicy Mung Masala Dosa. The complimentary papadum was thin and crispy, although a couple of the pieces were slightly stale. The idli sambar was fantastic - the idlis were perfectly soft and not too grainy as some restaurants tend to make them, and the sambar was so flavorful, with just the right amount of spice. All of our dosas were pretty great - good texture, just the right amount of soft and crispy, and strong spices spread across the Chile Garlic and the Spicy Mung dosas. The only thing lacking was a little more flavor in the potato filling in each dosa - it could have used a tad more salt and masala. Otherwise, the dosas were filling and made for a great meal.

We left around 9, and the place seemed to still be bustling. I wish we'd tried the desserts - they sounded decadent - but we were already so full from the dosas. Next time I would probably try more of the shared plates for greater variety. The prices are on the higher end, but food, service, and ambience all make it worth it.
author: Apoorva A.

description:
Hard to find! But worth the search. When it comes to Indian cuisine this place nails it. The dosa as you can imagine is a house specialty and well worth it. Big enough for sharing, I recommend getting one dish per person and then sharing family style. Today we tried the summer thali (a sampler of about 10 different dishes), the paper masala dosa (basically potatoes and dosa), and South Indian moons which were little gluten-free pancakes each highlighting a different ingredient. So much fun. 

Food: GREAT!The taste was spicy without being overwhelming or too hot. The masala (potatoes) were among the best I've tried (and I've tried a lot). And even though I didn't don't love everything on the sampler platter I loved the chance to explore new flavors.

Allergy-friendly: Very allergy-friendly. The menu clearly marks which items are gluten, egg, dairy, and nut free. And it's GOOD

Service: seriously attentive people. Came around often without being bothersome. Filled up our water routinely without having to ask. And asked how things were going.

If you're looking for good Indian food in the Bay (near Japantown) come to Dosa!
author: Craig Y.

description:
This restaurant has a beautiful ambience but the food is just above average,nothing really extraordinary-Being a South Indian I can cook the same food.
The dishes are quite expensive and portion size is less for the price.
We had masala chai,chille masala dosa,five moon uttapam and idly fry,which was 55$ all included.
Service was quick and servers were friendly.
author: Ramya R.

description: I'd never had south indian cuisine or dosas before. But some Indian friends recommended this place and I'm always up for trying something new. We had kinda a large group so we were able to make a reservation ahead of time. Though we sat around for about 15 minutes after we arrived, while they were "setting up our table." We got a bunch of appetizers - samosas, idli fries, and the chutney sampler. The idli fries are bomb. They were like right out of the fryer hot. Not sure exactly what they were but they tasted like fries. And it comes with a unique dipping sauce. The chutney sampler came with 4 chutneys and we enjoyed them with a truly addictive (and complementary) papad (kinda like Indian chips). I could've just had a whole meal on this, as the chips were salty and flavorful and you can't have just one. Samosas were ok - nothing out of the ordinary.  Then the rest of us got some kind of dosa. I actually tried the uttapam sampler. Uttapam is like a thicker dosa. I couldn't tell you all the different types of the uttapam but I enjoyed all five of them. All were vegetarian though and some had cheese that I remember. I also tried some my bf's paper masala dosa. The dosa itself is huge and crepe-like and I like the spicy chutney and the dipping sauce. I think I also got to try the bhatura, which is like the puffed crepe or flat bread. I think I liked it more than the paper dos, bc it had a bit more of a sweet flavor. Everything I had was really good and thanks to our friends for showing this type of cuisine. I will definitely need to search out more southern Indian cuisines.
author: Alison W.

description:
3.5 stars. I really like the ambience and the service. The people who are seating people are a bit disorganized.

Out of the two floors, I prefer to sit downstairs where the ceiling is super high and the environment is more open. 

Food is a bit hit or miss. Some of the dishes are great like the avocado chaat with grapefruit. Some of dishes are misses (corn chaat where the corn is dry with little bits of corn silk still in the dish). Lamb slider was so so. The bread a bit dry and the spicy sauce for the lamb patty is overwhelming. 

Cocktails are in general awesome for an Indian restaurant.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Here's the breakdown:

1. The place is fancy, there are two floors. The first has the bar and sitting and the upstairs has only sitting and is much smaller. 

2. The food is pricey. Given it's pretty fancy, I can see why the food might be on the pricey side. However, for the taste, I didn't see the reason for the food to be as pricey as it is. 

3. The food is pretty good, but I'm not convinced it's worth the price. Going off #2, yes the food is good but it's not amazing and mind blowing that I would like to spend $90 on a meal for two people. 

4. I was told this place has a lot of good options for vegetarians and South Indian food. I am not a vegetarian or South Indian but my friend who came along is and said it had good options.

5. Service was not great. They forgot one of our dishes completely and when asked about it they said it was being made. We were served two dishes and we finished those more than half way when we asked about the 3rd dish... There was a large party near us so I will give them the benefit of the doubt this time.

Overall, I would recommend this place to someone who loves Indian food or is looking for a upscale place to take their family or dates. It's not super casual so probably not a good place to go in all sweats. It's a place I would go again if a friend said they wanted to go but I don't think I would seek it out myself.
author: Shin L.

description: DOSA is a beautiful restaurant serving high quality meals with tons of flavor. Absolutely loved eating here and will definitely return to try out more items. We had the classic masala dosa and the roasted chili garlic dosa and both of them did not disappoint! Masala dosa was a crisp dosa stuffed with potato masala and served with two chutneys and a soup, all of which could be used for dipping. The chili garlic dosa had the same masala stuffing but with a flavored crusty dosa. The coconut chutney complemented these flavors very well and made for a perfect combination. In addition, the ambience was amazing with high ceilings, beautiful art pieces on the walls and excellent service. Highly recommend to all lovers and novices of South Indian food!
author: Hira A.

description:
We've had three truly awful experiences at Dosa after a few years of consistently decent food.

This last one, today, was unfortunately strike three and we don't think we will be coming back.

The food was incredibly spicy. Not hot, but uncomfortably spicy - and I can handle spice relatively easily. The service was a-ok. We ordered one appetizer and two entrées and while the appetizer was 3/5, both entrées were 1/5 -- paper masala dosa as well as the egg curry with paratha. It's been 6 hours since I ate this stuff and I still have heartburn.  

For the prices they charge, the meal was totally not worth it. I know their drinks are good, but $18 for a cocktail is also kinda ridiculous if you want to have more than one drink. So, no thank you. We won't be coming back!
author: Karan A.

description:
Over-hyped type of place. Coming to visit SF to see friends in town. Two friends that live their mentioned Dosa to me. The food didn't have very distinct flavors. I felt like the dosa, uttampams and the curry all generally taste the same.

We order the Paneer & Peas Dosa, Roasted Chile & Garlic Dosa, Brokaw Avocado Chaat, Philipkutty Chicken Curry, and the South Indian Moons (5 different uttapams). Out of everything, I'd say the curry was maybe the best thing- but that was pretty typical but at least the chicken was tender.

The overall restaurant is very nice and fancy but food was sub-par. Recommend to try just once. Best to get reservation on weekend nights.
author: Cat T.

description:
This is a place I have visited in the past when me and my husband were dating and recently we decided to go to this place again.
The restaurant is usually busy and is a good fine dining place. Though the food is expensive it is a nice place to stop by once in a while.

We visited this place on Saturday evening which is usually their busiest times. We were given a table after 35 min wait ( we dint think to call ahead... doi).  After we were given a table, we ordered the fried idly. In about 20 after the food was served the waiter took away the utensils. We called him twice for water and both times he asked us if we wanted the bill. It felt like he was shooing us and was itching for us to leave. This left us a little annoyed 

The restaurant however has attractive food with beautiful plating !
author: Aishwarya G.

description:
I still love Dosa and I truly understand how difficult it has become to run a business in San Francisco. However the prices have gone up, portions have shrunk, and service is pretty lackluster.

My oldest child texted me to have dinner with he and his girlfriend...great Dosa it is.  It's a Friday night and the place is not that busy....hmmm. The patrons that are dinning are just ordering a cocktail and maybe an appetizer...hmmm.  

The place is still beautiful but service was slow and indifferent. My cocktail the Steph Curry was great but it was three sips at best.....look at my picture. Food is still excellent but portions are small and 20% more expensive. 

I don't know if it was a mistake or not but we were served a goat biryanis that we didn't order ( um no thanks....even when you offered it gratis).

So the four of us, four drinks, four dishes: $230 (including tax, tip and SF health tax mandate )....yikes

Now that's pricey.

Go to the bar for drinks instead!
author: David G.

description:
For an elegant meal bursting with profound flavor - DOSA is a superb choice.

DOSA's tall ceiling, inventive menu and professional staff - smoothly work together to deliver a unique and memorable evening meal.

Everything that we ordered here for our past group dining experience was fantastic. For those with dietary restrictions, DOSA is great about labeling everything on their menu accordingly - highlighting what dishes are vegan, nut free, gluten free, and dairy free. For those that are following low carb diets - they even offer up some wondrous paleo/low carb options like spiced cauliflower rice, Lake Kochi Grilled Prawns, and an outstanding goat option - which came highly recommended by our waitress.

DOSA's beautiful dosa and uttapam are well worth exploring: photo worthy masterpieces that are a treat for one's eyes and tastebuds. They excel at perfecting traditional South Indian dishes with outstanding locally sourced ingredients and subtle culinary twists, like the Quinoa Thinnai. Their curry selection is also formidable and I'd recommend leaning on your waiter or waitress for suggestions when it comes to spiciness etc.

If you're looking to indulge in captivating sophisticated South Indian dishes come to DOSA.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Yums! I really enjoyed the Masala Dosa dish I ordered, but I think the food here is quite pricey. I've been told by my brown companion that Dosa is overpriced and overhyped (and to not go here), but I still had to give it a try. 

The potato was quite creamy, and the dosa was light and crispy. I liked the sauces to dip the dosa in- it wasn't super spicy for me, but it can be, especially if you're not used to the heat. The sambar (lentil and vegetable dipping soup) was good as well. 

I tried a bite of my friend's uttapam (South Indian Moons featuring 5 different types of uttapam), and while it was good, it was not utterly amazing. The service here is very friendly, as one would expect for a restaurant of this quality. The meal overall was not too heavy, and I liked the fact that I felt pretty light and clean afterwards.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
DOSA on filmore had a great ambience as soon as I walked in. The staff was extremely welcoming - even though we came a little late for our reservation the staff made sure to accommodate us. 

For the table, my family and I ordered a the Kerala chicken, vada pav, idli fries, dosas (Paneer masala, rava, paper) - the rava dosa was my favorite on the menu. The paneer masala was not very appetizing. The Kerala chicken was spicy and extremely fried! Really great for a cheat meal. 

At the end of our meal, I ordered their herbal tea and it was enough for share for three to four people! It was great after the big meal for my family and I. Overall, i really enjoyed this place but wish the Dosa was more adorable. $16 for a dosa is white pricey but the appetizers were worth the lunch!
author: Safia K.

description:
Reserved a table for 2 at 7:30pm on Wednesday, and when I called to move up my reservation to 7 on the same day, I was told that they were all booked. This place is super popular, and entering through the nondescript door (which is automatic, by the way--you only need to give it a tug) brings you into this cavernous world of chandeliers and smelling of spices. I will say it's a bit of a tight squeeze if you're sitting in the booths against the side walls - you'll probably get more intimate with the tables next to you than you will with your partner. 

We ordered the mango lassi, idli fries, chutney sampler, and masala dosa. The complimentary pappad was so thin and delicious, especially dipped in the chutney sampler. The sauces do pack a decent amount of heat, and the idli fries are super crispy and gluten free (!!). However, we did discover that the two sauces we were given with the fries were the same as the ones in the chutney sampler... Poor planning on our part and lack of creativity on theirs. 

I was probably least impressed with the dosa. The sauces it came with weren't flavorful enough, and there was only a small patch of potatoes in the very center. You can't skimp on potatoes like that and think it's okay, especially if you're charging $15 for what is essentially an oversize crepe. 

I think you can get better dosas elsewhere for lower prices, and the only justification DOSA gets for charging what it does is the ambiance.
author: Sophie W.

description:
The food at DOSA is brilliant. 

But my 4 stars comes because I made a birthday reservation for 6 online once, followed up by a whole message about how they will start charging us if anybody in the group is late. So we get there on time and they had us wait for half an hour for our table. 

They made it up with a free appetizer, but the whole situation seemed a bit ironic. Probably won't go back for a birthday again! But still love the food.
author: Sydney G.

description:
We came here as a group of 4 a few months back - we were visiting and our friend recommended that we try this place. I wasn't impressed with the cuisine or prices. It is South Indian Food, so the waitress informed us as soon as we sat down that the food is different than typical Indian food.
 
I was excited to try it until I actually tried the food. We each got different things, and I ordered the Masala Dosa, which is this thin crepe-like dish that had a lot of carbs in it, including potatoes and rice. I thought the dish itself was a bit bland and I felt there was far too little protein. 

My partner had mini lamb kebab sliders and a lamb dosa. He thought his different dishes were a bit small as well. We left the restaurant still hungry even though we ordered pretty expensive dishes. We decided we wouldn't be coming back because we didn't exactly like any of our dishes and the food was far pricier than it should have been especially since our appetites were not even satisfied after dinner.
author: Molly L.

description: Amazing.. just amazing! This interesting take on South Indian food is absolutely delicious. Yum!! It's definitely a little on the expensive side. But it's worth it.. nice ambience combined with finger licking food. I will keep coming back to this one.
author: Divya G.

description:
I'm not an Indian-Fusion kinda gal (since I like my Indian food to taste authentic) but DOSA really hit the spot!

We tried to make reservations but DOSA threatens you with a cancellation fee so we decided to walk in. We were quoted about 40 minutes but were seated in about 20 minutes due to a prior cancellation.

We were given the complimentary pappad which was really good but I noticed our server didn't give us the sauce that goes with it. Any how, we ordered right away. Everyone ordered a different type of dosa; I ordered the classic Masala Dosa with my potatoes on the side. I was disappointed when they brought my dosa to me. I'm used to having my dosa be larger than the size of my plate; also similar to the dosas they show over their yelp page. My dosa, on the other hand, fit inside the plate. It was too small; especially for the large amount of potato they give you. 

I tried the mixed mushroom and truffle oil uttapam; basically a pancake with mushrooms on it. I LOVED it!

I also tried the Channa Bhatura. This meal was too fusion for my liking. The bhatura, the bread, was fine. The channa, the chick peas, came with very little sauce and had salad all on top (I guess that's the fusion part) but there was nothing special about it. 

We had the "house-made seasonal" gelato for dessert; aka mango ice cream. I felt deceived. I was expecting a creamy delicious mango gelato.... instead, we got a Kern's mango juice tasting mess. It was overly sweet and didn't taste fresh at all. It tasted artificial all throughout. I definitely do NOT recommend this to anyone. 

Service was on the slower side. When it was time to pay, a different server brought over 3 different checks letting us know they split the checks for us; which we did not ask for. When we looked over the checks, they were all different checks from different tables. Pathetic. 

Aside from the check mix up, I do recommend checking out DOSA at least once. If I do ever go back, I'm ordering the uttapam all for myself. Oh! And make sure you look over your check to make sure they're not overcharging you!
author: Love K.

description:
Best Indian food I had in the us. We had the tasting menu witch had good selection of different tastes.
They have an interesting cocktail menu with indian spices in them that are great. Execelent service , good size portions
author: Tal M.

description:
I've never had South Indian food, and maybe DOSA wasn't the best place to start to get a sense of the traditional food style since it's more modern, but it certainly was a delicious experience! It's also not a requirement or anything, but DOSA is the kind of place where you'll want to dress a little nicer if you can.

My boyfriend and I made a reservation and ended up pushing it back for later, and there was no penalty. So I don't know why, but we were  happy that we were able to change it!

The restaurant itself is incredibly gorgeous. Tall windows, high ceiling with lots of lights and colorful decor. I'd come here even just to sit, have a few drinks, and enjoy the ambience.

We decided to do the tasting menu, and for $60 a person you pretty much get to try everything there is to try, and we were definitely stuffed afterwards. We barely finished everything. If I can recall, you get appetizers, small plates, large plates, dosa, and dessert. I won't go into every dish, because that would be a novel, but I'll highlight some of our favorites.

FOOD: Hands down, our two clear favorite dinner foods were the smoked arctic char with peach sauce and chicken curry with coconut rice. The fish and sauce together were immensely flavorful in a way that was remarkably unique and enjoyable. The chicken curry was flavorful in the same way, but gave me the feeling that I was eating something comforting and hearty. As for the dessert, the kheer was AWESOME! It was tapioca, so that was interesting but I think it worked and I enjoyed it so much that I ate some of my boyfriend's portion too.

DRINK: You really can't go wrong with the drinks here, whether you want something non-alcoholic or cocktails. We ordered the mint lemonade, which was a tad bit too sweet but had a wonderful intense, herbal mint flavor. I also had the masala chai, which is one of my favorite ways to drink tea, and it didn't disappoint. As for cocktails, I had the gin and house tonic, which was EXCELLENT! If you've ever had Fentimans Curiosity Cola, it tastes like that, but not sweet. Their tonic has cardamom and some other things in it that make it a really unique taste. Such a classic cocktail but with some unique twists that turn it into something completely different. My boyfriend had the Bengali Gimlet and I think also the Water of Life, both of which he really enjoyed. We didn't get a chance to try as many of the cocktails as we wanted, so we'll definitely go back to focus on the cocktail menu!

Overall, DOSA is for those times where you want something unique, you're feelin' fancy, and you're willing to splurge and pay a lot extra for a great experience. DOSA is definitely more those who enjoy food and love to be out of their comfort zone and try new things.
author: Claire C.

description: Nice fancy vegan restaurant. Their Dosas are amazing. The staff is patient to explain their different dishes. The decor is spectacular, nice ambiance
author: Regina G.

description: The food was great. But dinging the place for the racist, obnoxious and arrogant hostess!!!
author: Sneha G.

description:
Amazing ambiance! The service is very friendly as well!

The food is wonderful. It feels as if the chef knows how to attain a perfect balance between different spices and make it taste healthy as well. 

Very few Indian restaurants have such a balanced and tasty food. 

Try their Idly fry. Its one of the best dish I have ever had. 

No complaints.
author: Nevil L.

description:
Few experiences make me quite as uncomfortable as the blatant systemic racism in the restaurant industry. 

Enter DOSA. This restaurant is certainly not unique in this critique, but I'm sitting here finishing up a meal cringing. 

For starters - how did this bartender in (what appears to be training) get hired? The bartender in question is sooooooooo obnoxious I had to ask myself if this review of her was my own gender bias, but I've concluded that she is just an unpleasant personality type in general. 

When I arrived here at 5:00 pm the bartender was a man of color who was helpful and knowledgeable. As the restaurant switched into dinner service I have witnessed him get delegated to a completely ignored bar-back, while the two white counter parts who arrived on shift took over managing the bar. And are doing a pretty bad job of it might I add. 

As the trainer (male) tries to instill DOSA wisdom on his new crush (female) he fails to correct her for the terrible way in which she chooses to approach the customers seated. "What is _____ like?" People ask about dishes and drinks. "It's good." She says point blank, daring you to inquire further, and without a hint of enthusiasm or warmth. I watch her slam down menus and water glasses in front of people without a hello or a smile. 

A weird energy settles over the bar. 

Hey DOSA! That guy I spoke about earlier? I can tell you first hand that he is a heck of a lot more engaging and knowledgeable than this weird emo girl and her crush who are currently running the show! Might be something to examine.
author: Becca B.

description:
Pros: Very nice interior with an elegant ambience. The cucumber lassi cocktail was delicious. Food was interesting (with  a bit of fusion) and pretty good. Has a bar.

Cons: The food was not worth the price in my opinion. The portion sizes of some of the dishes we ordered were so smal it was ridiculous. Food tastes good but nothing amazing. For the price, I'd say it was average.

I probably wouldn't go again for the food. I'd like to try the bar though.
author: Lasya B.

description:
DOSA is DOPE! 

Started with cocktails at the bar. If you're a couple and seating is sparse you can totally make the bar an intimate spot to cop a squat. It's simply beautiful. The bartenders are plentiful & pleasant. 

Drinks: 
R&D
Mumbai Felicia

We ordered several dishes to share amongst out crowd so forgive me for not recalling specific names. I can say with certainty that we thoroughly enjoyed every bite especially the puffy hot lantern looking bread. Even the desserts were mouthwatering.

It's extremely spacious with plenty of dining room seating. I suggest the upper level because it allows a wonderful view of Fillmore as well as the lower level of the restaurant.

~Christy
author: Christy A.

description: Great food and ambiance.  We came here for a birthday and will definitely be back. Everything we ordered felt like a subtle but new spin on a classic dish, that made it even better! The chicken curry and shrimp appetizers were standouts.
author: Ariel C.

description:
This place used to be my go to whenever I crave for either vada pav or dosa. But unfortunately my 2 recent experiences have been super bad. 

Vada pav: Not only it was oily but it had reeked of some oil. I would give it now 1/5
Sambhar came with vada sambhar and dosa was salty and fresh. It had weird taste to it. 1/5
Chaat papdi: it was good except it was too salty for my liking 4/5

The quality of food has decreased over time which is very disappointing. They have lost a loyal regular customer.
author: Khushdeep M.

description:
Went to DOSA last night for dinner with a few colleagues and it was really good!  This location focuses on Southern India so you wot find items on the menu at just every old Indian restaurant.  Nan won't be there as well as most of the coconut masalas you see in the north.  

We showed up without a reservation, but this place does do Yelp reservations.  We had about a 45 to 50 minute wait on a Friday night for 3 which was not to bad.  We went and sat at the bar and the bartender was a great salesman and knew the drinks inside and out on the menu!  He persuaded me to go from the beer I was going to get to an old fashioned!  It was great with a little spice that enhanced the bourbon!  

We shared two appetizers at the bar.  We got the Brussels Sprouts and the mini sliders!  Both tasted great and were big portions.  We were all a little on the full side before they even took us to our tables.  

When seated we all ordered our main dish.  I got the Trio Dosa which was amazing!  The portions are really big hear so think about sharing!


I highly recommend this place as it taste great and the wait and bar tending staff are amazing!!
author: Matthew L.

description:
"It was a damn near religious experience" Anthony Bourdain

My lady and I decided to dine at Dosa on a whim. I've been here a few times and the food has always been top notch, BUT this last visit was on an entirely different level. 

When we got to the establishment we were ambushed by an eclectic, yet nomadic interior. The high ceilings invited calm, spaciousness and patience, while the art-work was reminiscent of rustic India. Timeless pictures of women carrying rice, street food vendors cooking and the bold, dark and intense faces of India let you know that you aren't just eating South Indian food, but also etching a piece of the culture in your heart. The restaurant has a lifesize statue of Shiva, one of the countless gods in the Hindu culture. The bar area is brightly lit with neutral colors and carries a myriad of drink concoctions.   

We made a reservation on their site and were seated promptly upstairs. Our hostess had told us that the Chef recently visited Kerela, India and had such a great experience, that he created a special pre-fix menu which paid homage to his travels. 

It was 60/person and worth every penny. We got a little taste of what was about 8-10 dishes. It was one of those meals where you could swear that the dish you're eating can't get any better, and then it does with each new dish. It was sensory overload of the best kind. All in all, you can't go wrong with any dish, but if you want to have a nibble of many things on their seasonal menu, I would strongly recommend the pre-fix. 

Some of the notable dishes we ate: 

Lake Kochi Grilled Prawns (amazing!) 
Avocado Chaat (refreshing)
Smoked Arctic Char ( Delicious Fish dish)
Masala Dosa (Resturants namesake and a classic)
Coconut Kheer (made with tapioca)

If you've never had Indian food this is an excellent place to break your cherry and if you're familiar with Indian food, it's a great opportunity to see how a Chef is taking something familiar, de-constructing it and still managing to evoke nostalgia.
author: Anand S.

description:
This place used to be my favorite for it's dosa, dahi vada. 

Today we ordered chole bhature($22), masala dosa($16) and dahi vada($8). 

Chole bhature for $22 was totally disappointing. Bhature was just huge and sweet. Chole lacked spices completely and was sweet. Usually with chole bhature they give onions as sides. Even though they over charge - no onions included. 

Dahi vada earlier was served in a bowl with beautiful red and green chutney pattern. Today it was not even vada but bonda(round lentils balls) with no chutney pattern. Disappointed. 

Masala dosa was decent. Chutney was bad however sambar was decent. 

I challenge the Chef to come and eat at my home to taste the authentic chutney made from fresh coconut. Although I'm from south India, I can cook 100 times better tasting chole bhature. 

Not visiting this over pricy, hyped up with no quality restaurant again.
author: Dee S.

description:
My boyfriend and I think this place was alright. It is more like an Indian fusion restaurant than an authentic Southern Indian place. If we ever crave for dosa again, we probably will go somewhere else.

On the day of our visit, the majority of the dishes offered on the menu were vegetarian. Though the restaurant wasn't full, we waited for A LONG TIME before the staff came to take our order.

For the dosa, we ordered the classic Masala dosa (4/5). There were three complementary sauces and they were all pretty decent. They were more on the sour side. The dosa came really fast and the crepe itself was thin and crisp. Pretty good.

We also ordered mixed mushroom Uttapam. This dish was really meh. It felt like a simple pizza on an Indian dough. Uttapam was kinda sour and there was quite a lot of cheese on the dish. The complementary sauces were the same as the dosa's. The dish was fairly bland and also soggy. We could not manage to finish this.

Our last dish was the goat dum biryani. This was probably our favorite dish out of the three we ordered. The goat biryani was sitting inside a naan-bread like bowl and there was a yogurt-like complementary sauce. The biryani was well flavored and decently spicy. We really loved the goat -- super juicy, soft and well-seasoned.

It's a decent Indian restaurant but with how much it is charging u, I probably won't revisit again.
author: Clare L.

description:
Great Indian spot near Japantown - good Dosas, fantastic pepper shrimp and some incredible chicken and pork curries. Really loved the avocado appetizer as well. Idli, samosas chicken were familiar and super yummy. 

Would have appreciated a bit more help navigating the menu instead of us saying "what do you recommend" and the server asking "well, what do you like?"
author: Bob K.

description: I have found my new favorite Indian restaurant  in San Francisco! Thank you Christine ( the manager) for such a great meal and evening all in all! The crab balls better known as Poori were to die for! Those Idli fries were so darn good I could have had them for my dinner but then I wouldn't  have had the opportunity to try the Goat Shank which was absolutely perfect! I even got to shake the chefs' hand who prepared it as well!! Our waitress Cat was so on, along with Eduardo and Naveen! Everything ran so smoothly I can not thank you enough DOSA for making this a wonderful Indian culinary experience !!
author: Curtis L.

description: The best Indian fusion in the city... costly but worth every penny and the experience was awesome
author: Swamynathan R.

description:
I am at a 3.5. I did not hate the food. Neither was I blown away by it. When you name your restaurant DOSA though one expects out of usual great dosas from you. They have the best ambiance among all Indian restaurants I have ever been too by a large margin. The food experience on the other hand was quite underwhelming. The service is good - no complains there.

We tried their vada pav (not the same as Indian version but a decent one whatsoever), Kerala fried chicken- as far as I know Kerala chicken is not deep fried, they serve coated Deep fried chicken tenders tossed in a sweet spicy sauce. I have no clue why it's called Kerala fried chicken. Not even close to authentic. We had their roasted chilli garlic and paper dosa. The dosas were decent ,sambar was good- I have had much better though for a much cheaper price, chutneys were just okay!

I feel like the price is more for the decor than the food. I would prefer other cheaper shops over this anyday!
author: Dhanashree A.

description:
Terrible experience here today. We made a reservation for 6.30pm and they told us we have to leave by 8 - clearly not what I'd expect from an upscale restaurant. While we were ordering, they reminded us to hurry up due to the 8pm deadline.

The food was very ordinary, portion sizes were tiny. The drinks were very bad, tasted like there was no alcohol.

Throughout the dinner, we got reminded at least 5 times about the 8pm deadline, making the dinner unpleasant and stressful. We had a big party, so people would have ordered multiple drinks each and hung out, but they were clearly did not want our patronage. 

Service was abysmal throughout. My friend's food was taken away prematurely while he was in the middle of eating (presumably due to the 8pm deadline). Lastly, server seemed hesitant to take a group picture of us.
author: Ipsita B.

description: Who can believe that u can get authentic south Indian dishes  from dosas to fried idli to prawn curry and biryani and great drinks from the bar like turmeric musk mule . Ha ha what a combo to have a dash of turmeric. Loved the thought behind it .
author: Godfrey. Godfrey M.

description:
Great food and cocktails but the attention to detail by the staff makes it an experience worth forgetting

Right from the time the lady who takes your reservations, it appears that she was confused where we got our table 15 mins later to our given time Inspite of having come 20 mins earlier
Even after taking a seat at the table the staff from the front desk came to check out our names as there were so confused in terms of who had been seated

Our order taker Ramon was clearly someone who was overworked and every time you tried make an eye contact with him to place an order he just ignored you 
It felt like he was doing us a favor serving our table and making the entire dining experience unpleasant one inspite of the great food
author: Mahesh M.

description:
I'm going to open by saying that I'm south Indian so I have high expectations for dosa. AND I enjoyed it. I found ghee in dosa a little weird but I get why it was good. It would be nice to know that it was a ghee roast and not a traditional dosa. 
I felt surprised that they have very very less chutney and also charged me extra when I asked for extra chutney. The lamb Biriyani was good but I felt it was a little less spicy. The best dish was definitely the Wada Pav. It had some amazing flavor.
I went there mainly for the Dosa but the cocktails were great too.
The service was okayish and there was no wifi. 
If you can afford it, you could visit there once. But I don't know if there are better places in SFO to eat good dosa.
author: Nitya S.

description:
My husband and I were uber regulars at the Dosa on Valencia location for 5 years. We've since moved closer to the Fillmore location and I wanted to share my most recent experience here. 

Last Friday (09/28), I stopped in for an early 5:30 PM dinner with my husband and infant son. We came with our compact stroller and our well behaved 9 month old son. The hostess was lukewarm in greeting us and told us that she'd have to see if she could find us a table since we didn't have a reservation. My husband asked if we could sit at one of the round tables by the door as they were empty and we could leave my son in his stroller. The restaurant space is huge and I'd estimate that about 85% of it was vacant at the time. We had no problem waiting but a few minutes after we came in another couple arrived asking for a table. With my back turned away from the hostess, I overheard the couple tell her they did not have a reservation and she replied "it shouldn't be a problem seating you." I noted the markedly different responses but we continued to look forward to our meal. 

About 15 minutes after we arrived, my husband went to the nearby Walgreens to pickup a pacifier in the event that my son became fussy during our meal. During this time, I had removed my son from the stroller and was managing him along with all of our belongings alone.  The hostess told me that she had a table ready for us. She then told me it was upstairs and asked if it was okay. Her tone suggested that she was hoping we would give up and leave rather than sit upstairs. It wasn't a problem but we were confused why she was placing us up there given the gear that we had with us and the numerous empty tables on the ground floor.

I held my infant son, his water cup, blanket, pacifier, stuffed animal, jacket, and diaper bag in one hand while his collapsed stroller was in the other. I followed the hostess towards the staircase but she stopped to address the couple that initially came in (without a reservation) after us. I overheard her tell them that their table was ready and that she would take them to it right away. They continued to talk as I stood by the staircase with two hands full. When she came back to the staircase she walked up with the menus in hand (she was safely holding the handrail) while I followed, again, two hands full. There was no offer to assist me or place our items in an alternative location.

Once we were seated and my husband returned, he looked down and saw the couple that arrived only moments after we did (again, without a reservation) seated at one of the round tables on the ground floor that we had initially requested.

It was clear to us that we were viewed as a nuisance. As a regular Dosa customer, I am incredibly disappointed in this experience and want to alert Anjan, Emily, and the general manager of this issue.
author: Whitney A.

description:
Since the first time I tried this place in 2012, I have been a fan.  This is easily one of the places I visit when I travel to San Francisco.  I hadn't been there in many years, so when my trip to San Francisco finalized, I knew I was going back for sure.

I actually ended up eating here twice during my recent trip. The food is still as good. I did end up trying a few new things. But the service has gone down for sure, hence, taking a point off. The service is slow, the servers not as attentive. One of the servers came to our table after we had been waiting for 20 minutes. As soon as she arrived, she said "Are you ready to order"? No greeting, no nothing. Kind of a turn off at a fancy restaurant as this one.

Now to the food:
- Idli Fries: unique idea for sure as I have never had Idli fries before. Its definitely on the spicy side, as they pour red chilli powder on it. So make sure you can handle spice before you order this.
- Vada Paav: still as good as how I remember from 2012. Absolutely love it.
- Rava Masala Dosa: Delicious....I always prefer the rava dosa crust over the other dosas.
- Chana Bhatura: The channa (chickpeas) is a blend of fava beans and chickpeas, which is a bit of an interesting blend. I would personally prefer just the regular chana (Indian style).
- Ras Malai: Delicious dessert.
- Madras Coffee: Usually the madras coffee I have had is served in a steel glass, but this one comes in a regular cup. Its really good and worth trying.

After 5 years, I am still a fan.  I may not visit the Golden Gate Bridge, but I will surely visit this place every time I go to San Francisco :)
author: Ani J.

description:
I got the crispy Rava masala dosa which was great came with sambhar, green(ish) coconut chutney and tomato chutney. Hubs got the paneer and peas dosa which wasn't crispy at all(if u are ok with that) - it was rather squished down and rolled like a crepe! Got a kids cheese dosa that was also rolled and cut squished down ( not crispy, super soft, minimal cheese) - came with the coconut chutney, tamarind chutney and yogurt. 
Sambhar tasted great ..wish the quantity was a little bit more..
Service was just average even though restaurant wasn't packed at all! 
We also got chai  which was great but not really hot!
author: Priyanka U.

description:
Looking for authentic Indian cuisine in San Fran? This is the place to go! 

As soon as I walked in the doors, I knew my experience was going to be top notch. This restaurant focuses on Southern Indiana style unlike most other establishments. The interior was decorated beautifully with rich colors, gold hints and unique light fixtures. I stopped in with a few colleagues on a Friday evening and there was about a 45 minute wait. Heads up, they use Yelp reservations, so make that ahead of time! 

We were able to grab a seat at the bar, and ordered drinks and appetizers while we waited. I was going to start off basic with a glass of wine but the bartender suggested one of their cocktails. He explained that each drink is used to prepare for palette for the spicy foods. Based on his recommendation I order the Peony. OMG this hit the spot. It had a frothy consistency, gin and a hint of chili powder. Just enough to make your lips tingle. For appetizers we got brussel sprouts and the vada pav sliders. Both of these were super flavorful and delicious. 

We then got seated at our table. Our waitress was fantastic. She knew every detail of the menu and explained it to us in detail. I decided to order the paneer and butternut squash uttapam. This was amazing! The uttapam have a pancake consistency and the paneer and squash was the perfect combo. Dip it in sambar for a little heat. I was so impressed! 

I was so happy with my dining experience. Great atmosphere, food and service! Definitely check this place out if you are in the area.
author: Shelby N.

description: Best authentic south Indian restaurant in San Francisco. I like the food especially rava dosa. Very good staff and nice ambiance. Will definitely visit again.
author: Rohan P.

description:
Wohoo! Finally got around to try this place. This one has been on out list from a long time and we got to pull the trigger on a rainy Saturday evening. Well you know what? It didn't rain so overall it was a pleasurable experience.

We reserved a table for 2 via yelp for a Saturday evening at 8 pm. Thank you Yelp for making it easy. Just to be sure that we had our reservation, hubby called to confirm and everything was in place. We arrived 15 mins in advance and the place was packed. We waited till 8 pm and then our hostess walked us to our table. Loved the decor and vibe. While waiting you can order drinks at the bar if you like.

We ordered Kerala chicken, Kebab pav(Lamb sliders), and Habanero dosa. Kerala chicken was crispy and yogurt dip made with orange zest complimented it well. We usually avoid red meat but Kebab pav was really a delicacy not to be missed so no regrets of eating red meat. And really wanted to eat a dosa @ DOSA..lol. It was delicious and went well with sambhar & chutneys. Then came the dessert time..haha. We ordered pistachio burfi and we found it ok. The burfi part was hard but chocolate filling was delicious. It will be awesome if they could add Chicken Biryani to their menu for red meat avoiders. 

Overall a great experience and would love to visit again.
author: Bharti K.

description: This is my go-to place for comfort Indian food! Their roasted chili and garlic dosa is sooo good. We've also tried the vada pav, idli sambar, avocado chaat and chana bhatura, and we love them all! Do not forget to have the rasmalai after your meal!!! It's the best thing you'll possibly eat if you have a sweet tooth. They also have a nice cocktail menu, and the ambiance is great too. All in all, very worthy of 5 stars!
author: Shimolee J.

description: This is a great place to meet friends and have a chat. Service is attentive and the food is delicious. You can find something for vegetarians or carnivorous friends just the same. Fantastic Dosas!
author: Raul R.

description:
Very nice decor and good atmosphere. Service is very good too.

Ordered a sprout mung salad, lamb DOSA and curry chicken today. What I like the most are the curry chicken and complimentary chips they offered before the meal.
Sprout mung salad is way too salty. DOSA is very crispy and very delicious, but super oily. 

Probably won't visit again.
author: Wenjing Y.

description:
It's hard to find good south Indian food, but this place really does live up to the name--that is, they make a great dosa.

We came here for Saturday lunch during the cherry blossom festival, and it was surprisingly not crowded.  They were serving the weekend brunch menu.  I had the rava masala dosa, which was very good, though I think next time I would just order the basic masala dosa.  I preferred the tomato chutney over the coconut, but both were nice.  My husband was very impressed with the lamb dosa, and we thought the prices were reasonable given the area and the nice ambiance.  I also enjoy a good sambar, and the sambar here was very good.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Good ambiance, service and theme. Slightly on the expensive side for South Indian, especially when there are multiple other options in the South Bay/ Fremont Area.

Dosa was crispy and chutneys were unique.
author: Aakrati K.

description: Great southern indian food, love the dosa, and the cha.... bread? It's great, it's a giant puff of the most yummy dough to pair with the spice of the indian food and the sweetness of the riesling!
author: Trevor J.

description:
Made a reservation for 8:45pm,was told my table wouldn't be ready until 10pm... a heads up would have been nice. This is unacceptable.



Update: I was there 8 minutes ago and was told that because it was a busy night that even with a reservation we would have to wait till 10pm.
author: Eduardo G.

description:
Awesome place with superb ambience! It provides a fine dine experience and suitable for dinner dates and celebrations. 

The food presentation is great. They have customized lot of Indian dishes in a unique way to present it well but keeping the authenticity of the taste. I've tried few dishes and all of them from dosas to uttapam turned out great. Of course it is a bit expensive but that's what you pay for such an ambience in SF.

The servers are very kind. Not recommended to walk-in without reservation.
author: Dhaval M.

description:
I live in the neighborhood for a few years now and can't believe I haven't been to DOSA! Upscale Indian food in a super vibrant setting - rezzies highly recommended, and be prepared to pay more than the usual SF prices for your food.

What you get in return however is amazing - great presentation, fast and friendly service, and boozy drinks from the bar. I was impressed with the Lamb Kema Dosa - a rice and lentil crepe with spiced minced lamb ($17), less impressed with the Chutney Sampler ($5.50, pretty small), but then again impressed with the Prawn Masala ($30). 

Love the atmosphere and the food, and the prices... oh well.
author: Sebastian F.

description: I am a South Indian food fanatic. I grew up in South Bay with access to practically hundreds dosa restaurants in sight. I was sooo excited to come here. And after coming here twice, I just don't get the hype. Our idlis were so cold and the sambar Luke warm. Both times. The dosa was more like oil with some dosa batter. It's a shame because I would have loved to take people here who visit but I'm not sure if our food will even fit on the table!!! Bummer.
author: Surina S.

description:
Great ambience but below average food!!
There's nothing special about the food here. They have couple innovatively named dosas and uttappams but are absolutely mediocre. Uttappams aren't even cooked well from within (I could taste the raw batter) sambhar and chutneys tasted good thou... 
I'd sum up and say, you'll have an over priced experience for average good and small portions!!
author: Pooja G.

description:
Came here for happy hour. The bartender was so much fun and made great recommendations. Love good drink service!

The interior of the building is beautiful and so spacious. We stayed at the bar which was also comfortable. Parking here can be tricky because it's so busy but it's super easy to get here via the 38 bus and a quick walk.

I was avoiding the alchy that night so I had the bloody orange tea. It was pricey but the taste was good. Next time I'd love to explore more on their drink menu.
author: Susan G.

description: Loved the chilli uttapam! As someone who hails from South India, I can say that this place is legit
author: Avantika A.

description:
What a buzzing spot that was packed from the time we arrived to the time we left. Friendly host and servers which made the experience great! 

We started off with the chutney sampler, samosas and the butternut/squash chaat which were all really good, mainly the samosas as I'm a fan of them as these didn't disappoint. 

This was my first time trying a DOSA and loved the different style of Indian food I'm used too. I had the lamb keema which tasted great but was a little hot for me and I was struggling to finish it. The rest of our table also enjoyed their choices. The service was good with them coming around to keep filling up our waters, clearing the tables etc. The drinks were very tasty but a mix up of the order which was pretty clear to us but not to the server. 

A great place to eat and maybe try something different if you've never been to somewhere like this.
author: Steven W.

description: I took my wife on a surprise date.... glad I did...We had lamb shack along with uttapam.... lamb shack was delicious.... uttapam and 6 different variety of chutnies all were mouth watering.... we also had pomegranate juice and mixed fruit drink with ginger, mango, pomegranate...we had mini laddu desert.... all orders were delicious...please make prior reservations which I did... the place is pretty packed....
author: Mithun D.

description:
Great customer, good decent Indian food but the seating situation could be better. 
Definitely best to make reservations before heading there to avoid the walk-ins wait. It's also available on yelp page as well. Wouldn't mind going back again. 
Paneer&Peas DOSA is the bomb
author: Sonia L.

description: Love this place. The ambience, the service and specially the food! For appetisers- can't go wrong with the vada pav and the fried idly. I have tried the weekend brunch thali- it's awesome! Fresh and flavourful. Also loved the lamb keema dosa, the egg curry and paratha. The cocktails are awesome too! Overall- love this place, definitely recommend. :)
author: Ahana D.

description:
Another instance of Indian food that has been elevated to another level, yet I'm not sure the price is justified...

The ambiance of the restaurant is very high end: with tall ceilings and low light, this is a place that would make a great date spot. The drinks at the bar were well made, and all have a spicy twist. Steph Curry (a bourbon based drink) and Uncut Old Fashioneds were both great ways to chill out after a long work day.

The food itself was very good - DOSA focuses on southern indian food, as its name suggests. Instead of naan and roti, they serve a variety of Dosa with different dips. Everything was well presented and very tasty - even some things I did not expect to be good (like smoked cod) were great.

Would I come back here? Only if I had money to blow and felt like eating fancy indian food. Otherwise, there are other places that are probably more worthwhile.
author: Albert C.

description:
Birthday redux! Done so right! Yes yes we had a lovely time and wonderful meal here. We'd first come last march to celebrate my birthday with friends and while we all enjoyed everything we ordered our server was inattentive and did a couple uh things that spoiled the night. However, I reached out to management with our details, and in response, Andy was incredibly kind and respectful and invited us back to try again on the house. Finally got back and we are so glad we did! It was an incredible meal/evening with service exactly on point. We really recommend DOSA for folks who want unique, fresh modern Indian food. AND very creative cocktails. 

DOSA you must get a dosa at DOSA. They are wonderful. We started with the paneer and peas version because we're paneer peeps. It is great the texture, w fresh peas, the dips, and the lil bowl of lentil broth vegetable stew, it's a very nice combination dish. Loved it. Must have more.

Very cool modern creative cocktails I got the peony a lavender colored not flavored soft silky gin concoction. Well 3, I had 3.

We ordered the Arctic Char with peach curry and WOW it was so well cooked and such a delicious dish my mouth is watering thinking about it now two days later. We also ordered the Channa Bahtura which was outrageously delectable. It might seem like just a bean dish with a bread balloon (see my pics) but it's not. So delicately spiced, cooked tender garnish that really adds to it. Just yum! I'd recommend they put some ginger in it though to prevent bean gas. And that tender crisp ballon complimented it well. I'll order it again. 

So Andy had moved on, but still handled our situation deftly, texting the new manager, who texted that nights manager. All done seamlessly. So Christine was expecting us and we didn't even know all that had happened. She greeted us kindly and even shared a couple dishes we didn't order, just I guess to assure we had a grand experience. We did, we so did! One was a nice fresh avocado grapefruit salad fresh and lovely. The other was two deserts. She even knew it was a birthday redux and the layered pistachio thing came with a candle. A sweet touch. We also enjoyed the nice rice pudding patties very unusual! 

This is a night that really was worthy of a birthday celebration and we can't wait to get back and try a different dosa. Thanks to Andy, Russell and Christine for being so wonderful to us!
author: Lisa M.

description:
I love this restaurant. I believe this once was an old bank and the result of putting a restaurant in such a beautiful spot is incredible. Ambiance is unbeatable. 

Some people think this place is expensive. I don't really like that word since it sometimes is associated with worth or value - of which this place delivers on both.

The bar is beautiful and everything is upscale. Sure, that comes at a price but it is well worth it. The food, the service is all how I like it. I found it to be assertive but not to the point I felt needlessly fussed over. 

Sometimes there is a wait... but there is a comfortable spot to hang if necessary. 

Star Pizza in Alameda freshly opened on Park Street. If you are ever in the neighborhood drop by. Its the same formula of: outstanding restaurant in old bank. Give it a try.
author: Stefan T.

description:
Really good Indian food in the Fillmore. This is Southern Indian cuisine, so not what we're used to in the States (no tandoor, no naan). With that being said, the breads are absolutely delicious, as are the various toppings, fillings, and curries. 

Would highly recommend the butternut squash and paneer uttapam and the vegan curry that comes with the poori. 

Service was efficient and friendly. Cocktails looked interesting, but I didn't partake.
author: Adrienne K.

description: I ordered take out in the past and it was always fine, however, the last times I got to go either my order was messed up, it wasn't done right or I got charged for items I never got. I strongly recommend the managers to take a look into this or they will lose more clients.
author: Abel K.

description:
Don't even think of going here 
The pics are deceiving 
Very poor sambhar 
The Dosa was soggy too 
Even the mango lassi tasted stale
author: Tithi P.

description:
*Review for catered food*

Company ordered a catered lunch from Dosa and it was definitely a highlight meal of the week. 
How they managed to transport a huge tray of naan without it becoming cold or soggy is amazing - it stayed fluffy, soft, and delicious!

The salad was fresh and crisp - as well the the indian fruit salad with peaches and apricots. The karaikudi chicken korma was a little on the oily/ heavy side but the flavors were great. 
The chicken tikka masala sauce and channa masala were good too. I didn't eat the chicken pieces but they looked tender and moist. 

The sauces that came with the meal were awesome - yogurt / raita , tamarind, mint , and roasted chili chutney. Each had different flavor but mix it all together and it still works! 

Great catered food - I'll have to try the food in house next time.
author: Brenda L.

description:
Checklist:
1. Quality -  
2. Service - 
3. Quantity- Not so bad, food is filling 
4. Parking - Hard to find
5. Reservations -  
6. Ambience-  
7. Per person cost - $25-30 (without alcohol)

Review:

They take reservations and are usually crowded over weekend so make sure to reserve a table. Yelp app allows you to find a table and book it.

The place is romantic and a good spot for couples. 

Lets talk about the quality and quantity. I am not so impressed with the quantity of the food here. Dosa is small and is overly expensive. Quality of the food is great. Our Dosa was cooked in coconut oil and is had s good taste. I ordered
1. Roasted Garlic And Chile Dosa
2. Paneer Dosa
3. Masala Dosa
4. Idli fried
5. Rasam Soup

Dosa and idli tasted good but I was not happy with Rasam. Rasam was too sour. Chutneys and sambhar are not the best. 

CONCLUSION :
Overhyped place with slow service. It took 45-50minutes to get our dosa which takes 4-5 minutes to cook. Ambience is decent with polite staff.
author: Nishant M.

description:
Amazing food only to be spoilt by very poor service. Had to wait for 10 mins for some one to appear to seat us. Waiter drops the food (dosa) for my kid on the floor; apologizes gets a replacement after 15 mins. After we pointed out potato masala was missing; they say "ah! Must have been missed out." 
Sincerely felt that even Saravana Bhavans service was way better than DOSA. Too much hyped.
author: Santosh Kumar R.

description:
This lamb slider was literally out of this world. Shit, who am I kidding- everything on the menu over at DOSA on Fillmore in San Francisco was fantastic. 

BRAND EXPERIENCE
Located in between Japantown and Lower Pacific Heights, this place was a very classy and upscale Indian joint located. The servers were all super high touched, constantly making sure that my friends and I were being taken care of. The mood of the lower area was loud and rambunctious whereas the upper level was quiet and intimate. 

PRICING
Come prepared with a projected budget cuz you will be spending a good amount of money. Expect to drop between $30-50 per person if you're a non-drinker or $50-100 if you like that firewater.

ALCOHOL
I don't normally talk about boozy things but they had such an outstanding selection I couldn't NOT talk about it....but with that being said I can't remember the name of anything. Try the purple cocktail if you like sweet, the ginger beer cocktail if you like spicy or the anchor beer if you like dark beer. 

FOOD
Hands down the best Indian food I've ever had- though to be completely transparent, I haven't had very much in my life (that will be changing). My favorite was by far the lamb slider, a savory grilled lamb burger with a fiery bite and sweet undertones. Others dishes worth mentioning were the prawn curry, coconut rice, lentil salad and dosa. 

OVERALL EXPERIENCE
This place was suuuper fucking tasty, broke my wallet and my diet...but it was definitely worth it. I'll be back when next in San Francisco.
author: Kajana M.

description:
Heard so much about this place. Food was less than average. Pricey and very dimly lit (not in the romantic sense). Staff/service was decent - and thus the 2 star vs 1 star.

Menu was very odd and off typical. That by it self is not bad.. but when you butcher those dishes.
.why not stick to traditional Indian dishes and get them right first.
author: Briana L.

description: Such amazing food! So tasty and great portions. I will definitely go back. I forgot the name of this but it was bomb!
author: Zoraida A.

description:
Nice ambience, friendly staff, average service.

About food - South Indian dishes were authentic and average.  A rice-cabbage  dish was horrible.. uneatable. Overall.. expensive but not a great experience.
author: Vishal A.

description:
When you mention that you're going to DOSA and someone asks you to order takeout for lunch the next day, you know you're going somewhere good.

That was the pre-hype I experienced about DOSA, when me and my friend announced our intent to grab a late night dinner there. Was the guy who said that right about just how good the food was? Eh. It was good, but not something I'd look forward to eating day old like him.

We snuck into the restaurant right before closing. Still, our waiter was very courteous even though we stayed past official hours. The decor of the restaurant is classy and is definitely a hip, upscale place.

For food, I opted to try the South Indian Moons-- the chef's selection of five different uttapams. I really appreciate when a restaurant has the option to sample different dishes! They were all pretty good, but I think my main issue was that I couldn't tell them apart.

Maybe I should have gotten a dosa-- after all, that is the name of the restaurant. I think for the price and experience I'm willing to come back and try it again. The service and ambiance impressive, I hope next time to find a dish I fall in love with.
author: Angela C.

description:
Made a pickup order for some vegetarian dishes. Arrived at the restaurant at the tail end of the pickup window to give the restaurant time to prepare the order, but the food was not yet ready and wasn't ready until well after. Got back home much later than expected with the food only to realize that the order got mixed up and instead of a vegetarian meal we had a dish with some kind of ground meat, possibly beef, which is a major no-no for a lot of Indians. 

Multiple people had to call multiple times just to get a hold of the staff that night. When we did get a hold of them the restaurant was closing, so no dinner. Had to do it all again the next day to get a refund.

Maybe the food is great, but even didn't get a chance to try it...
author: James B.

description:
Tried this place for lunch last weekend. Had heard so much about this place, so finally decided to give it a try. This place has great ambience, but sadly, the food did not live up to the hype.

Being a south Indian myself, I was really excited about this place. We ordered the pani puri shots for appetizers, and we got 4 puris with pani served in shot glasses. The puri tasted fresh and crispy, however we felt it was over priced for just 4 puri's ($10). It's also quite rare that you find only 4 puri's per serving of pani puri.

For the main course, I ordered a chicken thalli and my husband ordered the rava dosa. The rava dosa was good. It was with good serving of sambar, which I was happy with, although nothing extraordinary. The chicken thalli came with small servings of salads(2), chk fry, chk curry, channa, sambar, rasam, raita, curd, uttapam, lemon rice and white rice. All of which were average. Nothing bad, but wouldn't really go back.

We live in San Jose and there are numerous options for great south Indian food for 1/4th the price. So if you're one of them, don't waste your time.
author: N N.

description:
I really enjoyed this upscale and edgy Indian restaurant.  The staff is really friendly and the tatted host was entertaining.  He shared his experiences in India and showed us how to enjoy food with our hands.  Very sweet man.

We had the regular dosa, the bread was flaky on the outside and soft on the inside, and not greasy as I often experience.  The mushrooms and truffle oil uttapam had juicy mushrooms - and a lot less mushrooms than their online photo ad, but so incredibly delicious nevertheless!!!!  We also had their cod and eggplant small plates, and the pieces are small, but tasty.  I like that this place can fry food and not have it come out oily.  Nice!  All the dipping sauces are made fresh and are only "good for 30 minutes" we were told.  So we dipped quickly.  Now I understand why the host took so long to gloat about the sauces...each sauce had it's distinct flavor and bite and was sooo refreshing, it that's possible.

The huge chandeliers and massive art hanging overhead made this dining experience an elegant one.  The staff is helpful and friendly and more than happy to take the time to engage in conversation.  The food is spectacular...every bite is filled with aromatic spices.  The microgreens gave the dishes nice kick.  Very nice.
author: Trieu G.

description: Most of the dishes we ordered at Dosa were quite good. Really enjoyed the Dosa and the idly fries, which were full of so many diverse flavors. The paper dosa was awesome (i.e. literally, awe-inducing due to the portion size). As soon as it was served, I realized we had ordered simply too much food. The paper dosa could probably feed a party of four comfortably. After the dosa, our entrees came (the prawn masala and duck). I wasn't a big fan of the duck dish but the prawn masala was explosive in flavors. Great location with a beautiful interior, would definitely come back to try out some of the other items on the menu!
author: David Y.

description:
This is probably the only restaurant in the whole of Bay Area that serves the best masala dosai and sambar. This is all I need and thanks to dosa!!!

The food was so good that we wanted to take a pic of the chef and truly appreciate the food
author: Balaji V.

description:
Visited the DOSA with family as it came with a glowing recommendation and a 4* rating on Yelp. But boy, were we in for a rude shock!

Landing at the place with a prior reservation, we were welcomed by a big heavy door and a sizeable eating joint designed at two levels.  Little did I realise that it was the only big thing that we were gonna be experiencing in the restaurant that night (besides the final cheque of course which was already expected)

We immediately realised after talking to the hostess that they had forgotten to reserve a table for us (Yelp??). They tried to turn it around with a tiny corner table on the upper level which could have seated 5 kids maybe! After a few minutes of contemplation, maybe the staff realised we were definitely not gonna sit in each other's laps and the guests on the adjacent table sportingly moved to make more space for us.

The real horror started then with our server for the day, Brittany C. Now when a restaurant decides to charge you a 20% service markup automatically just because you are group of 5 or more, the least that you expect is a decent service! But Brittany came in with a tiny heart and grumpy attitude and seemed more in a mood as if we were there to eat for free!

After a very offending introduction to a "$60 set menu or the preferable ala carte menu", we placed our orders without any recommendations being offered by her despite telling that it was our first visit. We ordered the rava dosa, egg dosa, chile uttapam and goat biryani along with a rasam 

The complimentary pappadums never came out even though the meal came pretty quickly. We had to explicitly ask for them before they turned up. Now the dosa and uttapam were served with a moderate sized bowl of Sambhar and tiny portions of chutneys. Anyway knowing anything about south indian food may please enlighten me how to eat a dosa with a few spoons of Sambhar and a teas0oonful of chutney??

The food was served very rudely and when we asked if we could get more chutney, we got a condescending answer of "it will cost you $2". When we have our consent another server brought it out and it was shockingly just another teaspoonful! We asked the new server if this is what we get in $2, he got confused and said he will be right back after checking but it never happened!

Now in this entire episode the food isn't anything great to write about. It isn't bad but it is definitely not worth a 4* for someone who knows how south indian tastes like. The goat biryani is definitely not a recommendation at all!!

Coming back to the service, we never got any water refills and noone checked on how we were liking the food. At the end of it we left most of the goat biryani but Brittany just brought out the cheque and didn't even care to ask why the biryani was left over. For the biryani we asked for a take away box (thought we could give it to someone needy) but Brittany just brought the box and placed it rudely in front of us without a word or smile

After all this, we decided that the service did not deserve a 20% charge and we called in the manager who came in with a fake smile and concern. The manager heard our entire ordeal and said she will fix the bill and offered free desserts. We told her very clearly we didn't want free stuff but also didn't want to pay for a service we didn't get and just wanted the charge removed. But she insisted that as it was mother's day she would want us to have desserts so we agreed. And then she crumpled the old bill right in front of us, don't know if that was really required to be done!

In comes Brittany with the dessert (oh the horror!!). She placed one dessert in front of us rudely (she could have dropped it on our head if she could have had her way) and made a statement "you talked to my manager, your bill will come in soon" and just walked away. And then she comes back with another one and leaves with a statement "hope the free desserts make up for your concerns". Hello?? Why the hell do people think that customers complain to get free stuff?? Oh and she did come in again to offer chai or coffee which she said was on her. Well dear Brittany, after the experience I would not even had Water if "it was on you"

Coming from India, I always thought America offers a different standard of service to customers.
