But dear DOSA management, believe me I realise now that tiny hearts and money minded businesses are incapable of offering anything more than a product. Please keep your free stuff to yourself, if you can offer anything do offer some warmth in your cold little place!

To Mr Anjan - Thanks for your revert but it just reaffirms your attitude towards the whole incident! We are not looking for your free stuff so please keep the offer to yourself. Would have been happier to see your revert say we would offer impeccable and warm service!
author: Abhishek C.

description: Had a wonderful time at dosa! The manager Jean and her team were wonderfully welcoming and kind. We had the mung bean salad and tapioca Kheer dessert! Perfectly balanced and spiced. Highly recommend!
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
For the price you pay here - not worth it. They used to bring wrapped dosas - no more. You get a giant crispy dosa that's taking half of your table and a few sides. Makes the dish look big and adds unneeded complication to the consumption. 

Keema "Lamb" Dosa - minced lamb drenched in fat. 

Rava Masala - some potato pieces are not cut evenly, not cooked through.  "al dente" mashed potatoes?  

Sliders - way too small of a portion. 

Summary: Lack of attention to detail, small portions. Feels like I am helping the owner to pay his rent and decor by consuming mostly vegetarian, hence cheap, food at premium protein prices. Out of 8 dosas only one has protein drenched in fat.
author: David G.

description:
I made my reservation at DOSA for Valentines Day weeks in advance when Yelp was kind enough to remind me to book a table for the big day. I had originally reserved the table for 7.30 pm but ended up reaching the place a good 45 minutes early. The hostess was kind enough to immediately accept our request to be seated at one of the empty tables that was probably reserved for walk ins. 

We weren't very hungry in the first place since it was quite early in the evening and decided to rely on Yelp's most popular dishes for the few things we were going to order. We started by ordering the Kerala Chicken (spicy fried chicken strips) that came with a tangy pomegranate dip. The chicken was well cooked and went perfectly with the dip. 

Since I had to drive back, I decided to skip the cocktail menu and went with the Madras Coffee which was as authentic as it can get in the city. (Sunnyvale South Indian food lovers look away!)

We then ordered the Paneer and Butternut Squash Dosa, which was average but came with 2 chutneys and a bowl of sambhar that was to die for!

All in all, DOSA on Fillmore is a fancy Indian place in the city that serves good food and can be a good place to catch up with friends. That being said, I'll want to visit again to try other dishes before thinking of giving it a 5 star rating.
author: Gaurav K.

description: I absolutely love this place! As someone who is Pakistani and grew up eating Desi food, I have high standards for good South Asian cuisine. However, this place is such an ingenious spin on traditional South Indian food that it left me pleasantly surprised and excited about trying something new on the menu every time I visit. I have brought friends and family from out of town multiple times here and they have always enjoyed the food. The cocktails are amazing to say the very least. My favorite is the tumeric mule. The cocktail menu takes traditional Indian spices and uses them to create unique and refined drinks that are very surprisingly pleasant to your palate. I highly recommend this place as it is a modern spin on traditional Indian cuisine!
author: Neda P.

description:
Lamb sliders were yummy. They didn't have the truffle dosa listed on the menu but we were still able to order it (it wasn't made the same way though, instead of the truffle being in the dosa filling, they said they just cooked the dosa in truffle oil... didn't have quite the same taste)

The peony drink was yummy

Service is always a bit spotty in terms of wait time but everyone was nice
author: Laura D.

description:
Average South Indian food. We've definitely tasted better and this was no where great.

Had a minor incident with the dishes the food was served in being dirty (left overs from previous service not cleaned), which doesn't inspire confidence in the kitchen staff.

"Naam bade, darshan chotte"!
author: A M.

description:
Pricey for elevated Indian food but really good. I'm coming back again for sure.

$14 for a teeny bit of brussel sprouts? Tastes good but not worth getting that. Avoid though they recommend. 

paper dosa ($14) -- yuuuuuuuuuge. Very good. liked the masala dosa dipped in a mix of the warm sambar sauce with the spicy tomato chutney. Did not like the spicy green coconut chutney.

prawn masala ($30) -- grilled over a bed of firm coconut rice surrounded by coconut tomato curry. Had a nice bit of spiciness. i dont like coconut curries but i loved this. came with large-ish de-shelled but tail-on shrimp.

cocktails -- interesting flavors and tasty but very light on alcohol for being $13+
author: Jennifer M.

description: Good food, great ambience, reasonable pricing - we had the uttapam moons as a starter to get our appetite wet for the true star of the show - the masala dosa!
author: garbanzo b.

description:
Pros: gorgeous venue, creative drinks, friendly service. Food tasted decent. 

Cons: overpriced. The bill was excessive for the type of food we ordered. I usually look forward to modern fusion cuisine, but this one didn't feel worth it. Points to the chef for a creative menu and food very well presented, but wasn't meant for my pallet. And to top it off the chai was not free and they charged for sauce...
author: A. A.

description:
Why does your website say the bar is open "all day" Saturday, but you actually don't open until 5:30pm? 
http://dosasf.com/restaurant/dosa-on-fillmore/
author: Molly Z.

description: So this would be 5 stars for the awesome food and servers, but your hostess (I think Marta?) was so inexplicably rude to me! I asked her where the bathroom was, and she responded by staring at me like I was dumb. I had to clarify with her whether she meant it was through the double doors or in the back and she finally helped me by reluctantly motioning me in the right direction. I hesitated posting this, but her unnecessary rudeness really left me with a bitter taste in my mouth after an otherwise perfect dinner. :-/
author: Lea C.

description:
Service was super slow. 
Food was delicious.
Chai was cold. Could see the kitchen them giving us the last bit of chai in the pan and they didn't consider heating it. Sent it back and they reheated for us.
author: Nidhi A.

description: Went here for lunch today and was pleased with the service and the quality of the food. Me and my friend ordered the vada sambar. Loved the chutneys and sambar that the dish came with. Would definitely order again. My friend ordered the paper DOSA and I ordered the butternut squash and paneer uttapam. Both were very delicious. I would definitely give this place a try again!
author: Prasiddha H.

description:
The portion sizes are ridiculously small for the price. The main course - South Indian moons - is not even as big as a starter! I eat small portions but one main course order doesn't fill me up. 
The flavour of the sambar was great though.
author: Samyukta R.

description:
4.5 Stars.

Its a shame that I waited a year to try DOSA -- literally a block from my apartment -- and am now moving across town. The lone reason for not going 5 stars is the bit of disorganization at the host stand. Other than that, once we were seated (just about 20 minutes after our 8:45pm reservation), it was culinary bliss for the rest of the evening. 

I left the ordering to my colleague, but with each plate I could not be passive and wanted to know about each delicios dish. 

DOSA actually has me considering renewing my lease after all...
author: Joshua L.

description: Good, but the menu is very limited. The lamb sandwich is delicious. It is  a fancy restaurant.
author: Fábio Z.

description:
Tried this restaurant for the first time during the new year week and  everything for the table was super good - both north indian and south indian food. We had already done reservation as we were a big party of 12 people. When we arrived for dinner they had set aside the table for us. We ordered Idli fries and Vada pav as appetizers. The Vada pav is a must try. It was one of the best you can have around Bay area. For the main course we ordered a variety of dishes including Extremely Spicy Mixed Chille Uttapam, Idli Sambar, Moong Daal Dosa, South Indian Moons Uttapam, Spicy Pear Dosa and Roasted Chille and Garlic Dosa. All the dishes were delicious, a contemporary blend of authentic south indian flavors without being too over-powering on the spices. The Sambar which came with all the dosa's and uttapam's was especially mind blowing. 

Interiors are nicely done. It is clean and the service is quick. We had to circle around for a bit to find parking. Price wise it is a bit on the expensive side . Deducted one star for the server who was not very friendly and pleasant to talk to. Apart from that a great experience. Will recommend to try it out atleast once if you are in/around the area.
author: Shatakshi G.

description: The tasting menu was delicious every step of the way. Great ambiance, with a friendly and attentive staff. I look forward to returning.
author: Kris M.

description:
Their are a lot of South Indian dosa places in bay area but I found DOSA to be the most authentic specially when it comes to sambhar. I found it oooh so yummy!!  The masala and the flavours of drumsticks perfectly blend together along with dal and other veggies. We enjoyed our meal with the free papadums served. 

I am not rating it 5 star because I expected more vegan entrees.
author: Chandni Joshi P.

description:
DOSA on Fillmore is pretty rad. The space is huge which is always a treat in SF. 

We made a reservation on Yelp and waited at the bar while they got our table ready. They have a really great cocktail selection and looks like they regularly rotate out new drinks. I forget what I had but it was spicy and unique. 

My first thought was what's a DOSA? They're basically giant Indian tacos but a little more sophisticated. First off, they're huge. They're veggies and meat wrapped in delicious bread. We got one or two as an app and it was great. We got some other apps as well but the must have one is the giant puffy bread. It's literally fried dough the size of a basketball and filled with air. It tasted great and was fun to eat. 

For the main dish I got the Prawn Masala. I love all things coconut milk and seafood. It was exactly what I wanted. You don't get a ton of food here like most Indian place. For $30 it was perfect for one person but I didn't have any leftovers. 

This was my first upscale Indian experience and I loved it.
author: Aaron B.

description: First time at this restaurant ,would I go back? IMMEDIATELY!!!! Greeted by two great receptionist and shown to our reserved table. Get a basket full of papadum right away. The manager , Christine, was so gracious ,stopping by our table often. Waiters were extremely attentive and very nice . Eduardo and Naveen always wore huge smiles while waiting on us. Cat was our beverage server and also very nice. DOSA is definitely going to see me and my partner a lot!!!
author: Gary R.

description:
This is a great option for south Indian food in SF. My menu favorites are: their dosas, Chennai chicken, their cocktails, uttapam dishes.

Their brunch (which they started serving not very long ago) is also a great option for a laid back, off the grid brunch option in SF. For brunch, their egg curry is a must!
author: Miriam L.

description:
The masala dosa was tasty however there was a very small portion of the actual potatoes in the center. We also ordered the chefs choice uttapam which did not give us a bang for our buck, the five pieces were tiny and basically served as one biters almost. If I had to re-order I'd go with a regular uttapam rather than a traditional dosa or the chefs choice. The raita we ordered on the side was as expected but again the portion was 1/3rd the serving bowl. 

In summary the food was average/good but the portions were very small giving the impression of corners being cut.
author: Shireen K.

description: I came in about a half hour before they closed and the employees warmly welcomed me in. We sat in the comfy chairs by the windows, and ordered fairly quickly. Hailey, was SO friendly and helped us choose what we should order. We ended up eating everything that we ordered and decided to get more!! This was one of my first times having Indian food and it did not disappoint. It tasted authentic, flavorful and spicy. Would highly recommend. The only downer was that the lights were a little too dimmed. Other than that it was amazing.
author: Melissa B.

description:
South Indian food with a twist. I am not a fan of paneer but their paneer matar dosa was sooo good it melts in your mouth. Loved the avocado Chaat, idli fries, mango lassi with a hint of cardamom, and the uthappam sampler. The sambar was pretty fantastic too. 

The only let down of this place we're the chutneys. All 5-6 of them were bland for my liking.
author: Manojna K.

description:
We chose the Kerala Spring menu, and were treated to an avalanche of innovative and wonderful tastes - 9 dishes, a DOSA, and dessert. Highlights are the crab poori, the avocado chaat (with grapefruit, habanero & coconut), and the smoked Arctic char with moilee sauce. Every dish is so good, blending local ingredients with Indian herbs and cooking style. 

Congratulations to Arub Gupta, who came out to talk about the dishes with us.

Unreserved endorsement - for us the best Indian set menu ever tasted!
author: David F.

description:
Upscale Indian food with fine dining in the picture!

I let my dining partner order since he was here before.  The puffy crisp and light bread is very fulfilling and a sight for the eye on presentation as well as the nicknamed street food, vegetarian burger filled with spices!  They were atypical to my palate and delicious!  I have never tried anything like it before!  

I adore discovering new entrees in cuisines. It makes food adventures exciting and continually creates a different appetite for ideas and flavors! 

However, I was surprised at myself on how full I have become, just by eating half or less than that of the portion size.  I suppose it is high in carbs and fiber, presumably (to make myself feel better).

Dimly lit ambiance with a refined variety of cocktails  and wine to choose from! 

A pleasant dining affair.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
The waiting was really long but the waitress was very friendly and welcoming once we got seated.
I would definitely recommend calling to reserve before going or use Yelp reservations.

The ambience is really good. One of the few fine dining Indian restaurants in the United States.

I really liked all the dosas we had there.
My favorite dishes were paneer dosa, garlic dosa, chana bhatura and the chutney platter. 

I found  the lamb keema dosa as very average though. Also I think the food is not completely authentic Indian food but I loved it.

Overall a really good experience.
author: Supriya L.

description:
The food was really good, but the service was bad and some portions were abnormally small. The bad service included forgetting to put in the kids' food order in with the kitchen even though we specifically told our waiter that they were hungry and to start their food first. The kids got their food last after we reminded him. Also, waiters just putting the food down at the nearest end and asking us to pass it down rather than serving it to the person that ordered it. After I told them that we'd like them to serve the food to the right person, they fixed it - but we shouldn't have to teach them basic table service.

Out cocktails we're great - we got the Paparazzi and the Desi Rose. The food - we got a corn Chaat - which was tasty, but there was about 3 tablespoons of it for $14, and the way it was presented, we thought someone's had taken half of it out. It was in a messy ring with nothing in the middle. The lamb seekh kababs were good, with a great sauce. As was the chicken curry. Their dosas were great, as were the Uthappams. The kids' Kerala chicken curry was tasty, but spicy for them - even though the kids menu said it would not be spicy. Our kids came home hungry .

When we got the check, they'd added 20% gratuity because we were a party of 7. I asked the waiter if he thought the service was worth a 20% gratuity, and he said No. The manager came and talked to us and took it off, so we could tip what we thought was fair for the service. All in all - disappointing.
author: RK P.

description:
Good, not spectacular.

We both enjoyed our lunch here, NO complaints! 
My man is from Punjab, India and well, we eat at loads of Indian restaurants. 

We ordered the vegetarian paneer thali and a masala dosa (vegan) 

Both pretty good, not amazing and twice the price you would pay at one of those real (yet admittedly not as fancy) Indian spots in the South Bay. 

I know, I know, apples and oranges, just not dying to come back here, but we would if we happened to be in the area.
author: Stylishshopper ..

description:
Dosa used to be one of my favorites for Indian in SF. After my meal last night, I will be in search of something new. They obviously have some staff/process issues. 

I arrived on time for my 6pm reservation (my friend was 5 minutes late). I was seated upstairs, as the hostess was being yelled at by a manager (?) for seating too many people downstairs, apparently they were short on waitstaff. Meanwhile my friend was seated downstairs and then yelled at by the same manager demanding to know why she was seated at the table the staff seated her at. Eventually we were reunited upstairs without any sort of apology or explanation.

It was so dark upstairs it was almost impossible to read the menu. I did notice that it was a new menu, with higher prices (and smaller portions we would come to discover). Example - chicken curry $28! 

We ordered the mung bean salad, which was good but small for $15. Roasted carrots, about 6 of them for $15 with VERY spicy sauce, which was okay. And a mushroom uttapam (pancake), also 15, it was okay too.

The cocktail menu is odd. I had a gimlet that tasted like cumin. Not good, very small and a strange color. It seemed to be trying too hard on the whole.

Service was over attentive to the point of us feeling rushed. They kept trying to clear our plates with food still on them. It was a tuesday night, it was not too crowded. 

With drinks the bill was over $100 and I was still hungry. 

No thanks Dosa. Good luck with whatever sort of new audience you are trying to appeal to.
author: Nicole M.

description: Pretty expensive, but everything has been pretty tasty that I've tried. I got the lamb chop dish, which was a tiny portion, but very flavorful. I also tried some of the masala dosa which was much more substantial. I would recommend coming here if you want a solid meal, but be prepared for a pricey menu.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Great ambience but below average food.

Spicy Avocado Chat - was sour and had a bad after taste
DOSA was average, nothing special
Chana Bathura was flavorless and bland 
Coffee wasn't good either 

Service wasn't good either, they served everything together. Only giving 2 stars for ambience, wonder who liked food here with so many great options around
author: Saurabh M.

description:
I have been to Dosa several times and they never stop amazing me with their delicious food. 

I love that their menu is different each season. I can not wait for summer so I can eat their Summer Uttapam again, so good. They also have delicious, refreshing lemonades during summer.

They definitely do their name justice with their dosas. The truffle dosa is my favorite but even their plain dosa is spot on. All of their food is perfectly spiced. Great service and ambiance as well. 

Yelp Reservations makes it very easy to make a reservation. The restaurant has a convenient location, being right across the Kabuki theater. 

The restrooms do seem like they have seen better days but oh well.
author: Ellen H.

description:
Being a south indian girl, DOSA is where I go to get my Dosa brunch fix. My favorite things on the menu: uttappam with sunny side eggs, 5 moons uttappam, most of the Dosas are good, but the Lamb keema dosa is amazing! Also love the egg masala with paratha. Always get the chai here, so good. 
Dinner menu- Love the lamb sliders and the batura is excellent.
author: Isha S.

description:
Very good place. Delicious food, but a little on costly side.
Avoid having starters , portions are small, and not value for money
author: Saumitra S.

description: We have been here 5 times in a row and we have loved it everytime. Make sure you book a reservation and have the rasam. You will enjoy your food for sure.
author: Aaditya R.

description: Went out to dinner with a group here last night after being told over and over again that this was the best place for South Indian food in the city. Safe to say, I was not disappointed! I ordered a bhathure and the summer corn and mushroom poriyal. I've eaten a lot of bhathure in my life, and this was hands down the biggest and best bhathure I've ever had. I never expected what came to the table, and I was in heaven. The poriyal was also so tasty! It was fresh and light, the perfect complement to the bhathure! I can't wait to come back and eat more bhathure as well as explore other things on the menu! Only losing one star because the service wasn't amazing! They forgot to bring one of the meals for our group because they didn't enter it all.
author: Sonia S.

description:
We celebrated birthday with a large group. The food was amazing!!!
The presentation, the flavor, the color, the aroma and the attendance made the celebration very special. Even our menus had the b-day person name on it! The restaurant suggested a family style menu and I am so happy that they did. It was very impressive to see all the dishes coming out, the paring of the dishes was so beautifly crafted. We enjoyed it every minute of it. The birthday person said - "it was the best bday ever". Thank you DOSA!!!!
author: Anna M.

description: Although the name of the restaurant suggests focus on South Indian cuisine, this classy joint serves variety of  fusion snacks and meals- east meets west. We enjoyed Kerala chicken, south indian "moons" (baby uttapams), dahi wada, south indian monsoon- a non alchoholic cocktail drink, mango lassi and masala dosa- all very good. Staff are very friendly. Service is fast for standard items (masala dosa) but makes you wait for non-standard ones( e.g. south indian moons). On a saturday afternoon there was no wait time to be seated for lunch. Although, when visiting this place for dinner we did experience 30-45 minutes wait times on weekends. The ambience is nice spacious airy and colorful. The tables are placed too close to each other for comfort. Overall a nice place.
author: Sujit D.

description: We went there in evening time, so the ambience was very ordinary. Probably during night, it might light up. Food was good but may be not worth the markup.
author: Gaurav N.

description:
Had an enjoyable meal with a friend here. Compared to their restaurant in the Mission, this location is huge and very beautiful! This would be great for a date; such a great ambiance. 

We were a little unclear on what the portion sizes would be and how much would be enough for 2 people to share. We ended up getting 2 sharable plates, a dosa, and a bhatura. This ended up being A LOT of food and this is from someone who can definitely power through a large meal if need be! Our sharable plates were the samosas and lamb sliders. Both of these were delicious! The sauce on the lamb was soo good! These were definitely the stand out of the dinner. The bhatura is definitely a sight to behold, so huge and fluffy!

The dosa by contrast wasn't quite as delicious. This could be because we had it after the samosas and maybe it was too similar but I didn't find it as flavorful. The lentil soup it came with was good though.

Due to the ambiance I would definitely come again and try some other stuff. The lamb sav sliders are definitely a must!
author: Jesus E.

description:
My wife recently organized a birthday party there for a physician friend of ours plus 15 attendees. A practiced crowd with seriously extensive dining experience across the board, with much of it gained across the world. Our unanimous post dining verdict...the food, service, ambience, and overall execution of the party, all AAA+. Everyone was extremely pleased and that's high praise indeed from this group.
Daniel M. 
Lawyer. Housing, Litigation, Criminal Defense. San Francisco CA.
author: Charlie B.

description:
Hey Dosa, where's the rest of my duck? Why not up the price and put more pieces in. 3 pieces... really, 3 pieces?

Stop the pretension, it's the Fillmore, not the marina nor the financial district...

Everything was delicious but definitely not a place I would bring my friends back to.
author: Nathan D.

description:
I have seen the one in the Mission but glad I got to check out the one at Fillmore. This location is A LOT bigger and definitely a nicer ambiance (dim lighting, beautiful chandeliers). It gets busy during dinner time but does not get loud. This is a great place for a date or a place to meet with friends. The menu is extensive, separated into shared plates and dosas and uttapams. We asked what was the appropriate amount to order and the waitress wasn't too helpful (note: ordering 2 shareable plates, a dosa and a side of bread may be too much for two people as we found out). 

We started with the samosas and bhatura bread and drinks. We were also given papadum to start (crispy lentil bread). I LOVED this stuff. I got the Morjim Goa. It came with a bit of sweet foam (garam masala air apparently). I liked this a lot! The bhatura was a big fluffy pillow (so big!) and the samosas were perfectly fried. We were then given lamb sav which were lamb sliders. These were my favorite--they were spicy and sweet! The lamb was done really well and had a lot of good flavor--garlicky and moist.

We then got a dosa with the spicy mung masala. This comes with a lentil soup (sambar) and two chutneys. Because we had gotten the samosa, having more potato at this point wasn't as appealing because the filling was essentially the same. I enjoyed it but think we could have made do without the samosas. This was still yummy...the lentil soup was my favorite. I'd drink just a bowl of this and dip the bhatura in there!

Overall, I'd give some of the food options a 3.5 but the overall experience was a 4. I'd want to try the other food options for sure!
author: Natalie M.

description:
My Indian friends raved about the food here and recommended that I check it out! I made a reservation Day of and got a table for two at 8:30. We were seated 10 mins early. 

The ambiance of the restaurant is lovely. Really trendy and modern. Great for big groups and date nights.

For cocktails - the first one on the spice menu (forgetting the name) is really interesting. It has a real kick to it and  is topped with the icon masala foam. The four drink on the menu, the dry named one was fantastic!!

For food - definitely get the veggie sliders. It was my favorite item on the menu. Can't go wrong with any of the dosas; all we're great and filling. The mushroom and truffle oil flatbread was also fantastic! 

Coming back for more and next time with a record of the names of the order!
author: Tiffany T.

description:
This is probably the best dosa I had ever had in the US. Must visit if you are in town. We had two appetizers and two entrees and both of them were awesome. They also have good cocktails. I had ginger Ante and if you like spicy ginger flavor, then do not forget to try it. 
My wife had Chai And it was as good as home made Chai.
author: Ashish S.

description:
Can't get myself to give it more than 2 stars because of the stomach ache this place gave me on a Friday night, where I was supposed to be enjoying myself on a night out with my friends instead of curled up on a buddy's couch while everyone was up and about playing drinking games around me (sad image am I right). Usually Indian food is already a hit or miss for me when it comes to the post-meal feels since the food is generally heavily spiced/buttered/creamed and my body can't handle the contrast to my normal diet, but I thought that a $$$ Indian restaurant wouldn't do me like that since one would assume that paying a premium for Indian food, WHICH EPITOMIZES CHEAP EATS, would be worth it. Going to Dosa should be like going to a fancy Mexican restaurant instead of Taco Bell because you're not ready to commit to a morning after spent in the loo (ok a bit of an exaggeration but you get the point). Not gonna lie, I love Indian food and I usually think it's worth the pain when I spend $13.99 for an all you can eat Indian buffet with unlimited garlic naan, tandoori chicken, and chicken masala BUT COME ON NOW $30 for a tiny bowl of curry? WHAT?! In no world is that worth my pain... let's not mention that the curry wasn't even that good. 

Okay, bodily discomforts aside, two other things that warranted this crap review include 1) the mediocre food as mentioned above, and 2) the what the heck service. I was with a group of 9 girls and one girl ordered the following for the group: Dungeness Crab Poori, two orders of Bhatura, Smoked Arctic Char & Blood Orange Curry, Almond Ambur Chicken Curry, a veggie curry, South Indian Moons (Uttapam), and the Basil & Garlic Dosa. Everything except for the Smoked Arctic Char was so mediocre, and I honestly wouldn't even go back to eat the arctic char again, therefore it wasn't amazing. Apart from that, apparently the food we ordered wasn't enough for all of us because the curries were tiny -- either that or we didn't know how to portion out each of the curries for all 9 of us because by the time 5 girls scooped their portion of each curry, we were out. Not sure where to put the blame here, but I feel like this is something the waiters should have at least warned us about when they took our order... Didn't help that the food came out so slowly and every time a dish came out, the waiters kept on putting them at the same end of the table so the second half never got anything (we had to then reorder the 3 curries for the second half which then delayed our dinner). Also, what I found so amusing was that shortly after they brought out the second order of curries for our half of the table, they came back asking if they could clear our plates even though we were clearly still working on everything / THE DISHES WEREN'T EVEN HALF EMPTY YET. 

I am officially fuming as I am typing this review. I'm so confused why this place has 4 stars. I'm tempted to change my review to 1 star but I'll end this before I do since that would just make me feel like I 100% wasted my money (which I mean... it still was a waste so don't go here if you don't want to waste money... but I'm just trying to make myself feel better about the $70 I spent on this meal instead of a decent pair of jeans at this point). Also, I'll be generous and leave it at 2 because prices and other factors aside, the food at least wasn't terrible.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Unpleasantly surprised! Disclaimer: This is my favorite restaurant in the city and I am regular here!

Made a reservation to go here for dinner tonight for July 4th and the service was horrible!
The restaurant was busy which is understood but there was clear chaos in the service. 

It took the waiter a good 10 minutes to come by the table to take the order. 

After we finally ordered here is sequence of events:

Drinks: ordered a glass of wine, a beer, kingfisher and a kids mango lassi. The first drinks to arrive was mango lassi; came in a kids cup but no straw and the wine. Asked the server about the missing beer and he said he will check and he walked away casually without acknowledging the missing straw on the cup?! Hello!! How do you expect the kid to drink that?? 

Will come back to the beer in a bit...

Asked another server passing by for a straw and he delivered one..

Ordered Vada pav for appetizer & prawn masala, paratha and paper masala dosa for entree.

The first food item to be delivered was the prawn masala (which comes with rice) minus the paratha. No sign of appetizer either or the beer. 

Story of the beer: After 10 more minutes of waiting the waiter stopped by and my husband asked for the beer and his response?! We ran out of kingfisher yesterday. I am sorry I just found out, can I get you a pilsner instead? My husband, ahhh ok, please do! And the beer came after another 10 minutes of ordering that!!! Phew!

And then came the paratha!  And another 5 mins after that came the appetizer, vada pav.

My little one then asks, mommy, WHERE IS THE DOSA? Which took them another 10 minutes or so .. Gawd!!! 

Utter and complete Chaos in service today!!
author: Prarthna A.

description:
This place has probably the best Dosas in the Bay area. It is very close to the Dosas that you get in South India.
My wife and i really enjoyed the food, ambience and the cocktails.
author: Aravind C.

description: Went here based on recommendations from family and friends. As soon as you enter this place is huge and has a beautiful and vibrant ambience. The staff is very courteous and attentive to any food needs you have. This restaurant had by far the best Dosa, Idle, vada and even surprisingly lassi you can have in San Francisco. For Dosa lovers this is a must. Truly impressed by the quality of food. Will definitely go if in San Francisco again.
author: Dev S.

description:
Awesome place just overpriced.

The taste is also good maintained the traditional indian flavor  and ambience is also good

Just i thought it is over priced as compared other indian restaurant in sf which provides similar service
author: Shreyas D.

description:
A couple of friends and I visited this place on a Friday night with high expectations. The wait was about a half an hour- we wish we'd just gotten a reservation via Yelp instead. 

The food was fine- definitely not the best dosas I've had. We got the idli fries and vada pav to start with. Both were v.good, the fries nice and crunchy and loaded with a tasty spice rub, the vada pav a delicious mixture of sweet and sour (pro-tip from a Mumbaikar- where the vada pav was invented: make the vada less soggy by holding back on the imli chutney! Also would've been nice if it was a tad spicy). All in all, the appetizers were a success. For mains we got the paper masala dosa and have to say, was a little disappointed, esp for a place that's named after this lovely South Indian dish. 

The portions are on the small side by Indian food standards, but I guess that's what you expect from an upscale place?

Oh, and our server was *super* nice. 

Would definitely go back again to try other items on the menu.
author: Surashree K.

description:
Along with Amber, DOSA is probably one of my favorite nice Indian places in the city. We had a reservation for a Friday night, and the place was packed. Service was fine, our appetizers came out super quickly but the rest took some time. I tried the peony gin drink which I loved, it was unlike any other gin cocktails I had tried before. We also got the spiced avocado chaat- which was just okay- the dahi vada, channa bhatura, and spicy basil dosa. The main times were the clear winners of the night, especially the channa. 

Also really liked how the owner comes around to tables to ask how things are going, seemed to be a nice touch to the night.
author: Alka M.

description: Literally as good as it gets. The food is amazingly delicious, beautifully presented, and creative (yet authentic to the flavors of India). Great ambiance, and a fantastic bar program with Indian flavors infused in cocktails as well as a well-paired wine list. Great for dinner, but also for brunch or lunch.
author: Whitney B.

description: Love this place. Excellent food and ambience. Also, thank you for accommodating all my birthday guests!
author: Rish M.

description:
Ugh, this place is such an embarrassment to South Indian cuisine. I do understand the "modern-take" on south indian food - but it's poorly executed. Trying to create this hybrid is a huge compromise to the flavors. Do yourselves a favor and go to Rasa in the South Bay instead - they seem to have gotten the concepts much better! 
The vada pav was probably the best thing I ate here - but even the pav (bread) left a lot to be desired.
author: Sam M.

description: This was the first place I have ever eaten Indian food, and I can tell what the hype is about. I had the paneer and peas - the perfect introductory dish. The bread was delicious here and paired well with my dish. The cauliflower rice was also good, but I thought the market salad was a little underwhelming. The Lime Chile Scallops were good as well, but the presentation was my favorite part!
author: Run.It.Off V.

description:
SO GOOD!  Restaurant week menu is a steal at $40 plus $20 extra for wine pairing.  Score! 

Everything was just absolutely delicious!  Food is full of flavor and well seasoned.  Plating is nicer  Service is friendly and efficient.  Love this place!
author: Winnie W.

description:
What a great Indian restaurant! 

Went here for lunch with a few friends, from pani poori to zuckerberg asparagus to avacado chaat to chicken curry and Dosa, everything was super amazing and delicious! 

I could care about the crab poori tho, don't really make sense to me personally, some of you might like it! 

Great quality ingredients, food was fresh and delicious! 

Give it a go! Recommended!
author: Kim W.

description:
Awesome south Indian food! I have visited this place multiple times and I have favorites - vada pav and dosas!
The food is very flavorful and I always walk out happy.  ;)
author: Aanchal G.

description: best indian in SF!  The Chennai chicken and the lamb chops.  My jury is out on the Dosas themselves, and this location is the superior one.  Also, try the Ginger cocktail.  But all around, this is classy Indian dining, and makes for a great pre- or post-Kabuki.  Or, pregame for the Fillmore. It's worth the extra money for the service, the food, and the care they take...
author: bacchus m.

description: This restaurant used to be little better few years back with respect to food & guest services. Now you don't get that feel. It seems like they are doing us a favor by having us dine there. Food is over pricey. They are way too strict on reservations or its modifications and even charges $$ for no show up on reservations. There is nothing great about this restaurant or its food that it is behaving so stringent on its rules. In this era of food & new restaurant popping up at every corner of the city, i see no reason to visit this restaurant again.
author: Rishi P.

description:
I made a reservation for 5 people on May 13, 2018, at 7:30 p.m. to celebrate Mother's Day with our family visiting from out of town. The ambiance was lovely and the restaurant was semi-full.  
We arrived at 7:15 p.m. and checked in with the hostess.  The hostess told us that she will get our table ready so we waited to the side of the podium.  During the wait, we over heard the conversation between the hostess and the gentleman up in the balcony that somehow he did not see a party of 5 on his list.  About 10 minutes later, the hostess took us up on the second floor to our table.  The table is located at a corner by the wall next to the window.  I saw the table and realized that the table has a bench and two chairs.  I reminded the hostess that we have a party of 5.  She responded "we have seated 6 people like this before."  To my astonishment of her response, I waited, somehow, she realized herself that she couldn't seat 5 people.  There were two nice ladies sat next to our table said "that table won't fit 5, how would she said it had fitted 6?"  These ladies were almost done with their dinner and were willing to move to the spot that is empty.  I thanked them and the hostess came back and helped put the table together.  
We checked out the menus.  The in-laws are visiting from India and it is their first time.  It wasn't my first.  I had been at this location once before.  I have been coming to the DOSA on Valencia more often.  The waitress by the name of Brittany C. came and asked if it was our first time.  We unilaterally said "Yes."  She explained the menus and said with a very condescending tone "this is a pre-fix menu and it costs $60 or you can order a-la-carte."  She then left without saying another word.  We took about 5 minutes and said we were ready to order.  We waited and finally waved her down to get the order.   She asked if we wanted cocktails, we said no, water is fine. 
The food amazingly came out pretty fast.  We ordered 4 dishes and a soup (3 dosas, 1 birayani and a bowl of Rasam).  Each of the Dosa's dish came with two chutneys (coconut and tomato chutneys).  We really liked the coconut chutney and asked if we could get some extra. Brittany, the waitress, said "it is $2.00 extra."  We found it a little bit odd with her tone, but we said that is fine.  She didn't bring it out, but it was another gentleman.  The size of the extra (for $2.00) was a bit ridiculous.  It was about 1 to 2 tablespoons max.  We asked the gentleman if that was for the extra $2.00 he said he is going to check.  He never came back and no one came to the table for the entire meal.  Our water was never refilled. We decided for the principle, we didn't touch it and left the chutney to the side. 
We finished all the dosa dishes and not the Biryani.  My hubby and I were the only two can eat meat and we didn't like it so much.  We had the dough/cover on top instead.  We asked to take away the leftovers of the Biryani and Brittany brought out a box and left it at the table without saying a word and left.  She came back with a bill.  There was not even once of the entire meal that someone came by to ask if we were okay or need anything else or re-fill our water. As normal circumstance, I would gladly pay for the 20% auto-added tips for party of 5.  However, I (we) feel that for the service we got for this entire meal, we wouldn't want to pay for that 20%.  We called the manager and discussed and explained the situation. The manager offered free-desserts.  We politely mentioned to her that we weren't looking for free-items, we were absolutely happy to just pay for our meals without the 20% tip auto-added because we don't believe the service was rendered to deserve the amount.  She said no-problem she'll fix the bill.  However, when she took the bill back, she crumbled the bill in her hand right in-front of us and we found that to be very rude.  However, at this moment, we weren't expecting anything better.  They brought out the desserts, and here come Ms. Brittany C.  She dropped (literally dropped - not placed) a bowl of sherbet on the table and walked away without saying a word.  At this time, my hubby's mum couldn't hold her disappointment and said "that is the rudest gesture I have ever seen."  
Ms. Brittany C. brought back a bill without the 20% tip added and took off the Biryani.  When she handed over the bill she said "I heard you talked to my manager and she is getting you free desserts. I hope that makes up for whatever problem you've had tonight." She continued to "Would you like some tea/chai, it is on me." We were once again couldn't believe the statements and just shook our heads and said "Thank You."  There were not once Brittany smiled when talked to us.  We paid our bill and I wrote on the signed receipt that "I have been there or at least to the DOSA establishment in many occasions, this is the worst experience in service I have ever had." I would not return or recommend DOSA to anyone!
author: Michele H.

description: The food was great. It a great place to hangout with friends. It is upscale for sure. Be ware the salty lasso here is sweet ! The service is fast and be careful while ordering your food.
author: Diana P.

description:
The food and cocktails were amazing! The waitress was really helpful in making sure we got a variety of flavors and just the right amount. 

My only complaint is that it was really busy and crowded, so it took a long time for the waitress to get to us. The hostess, who was really nice, didn't let us know when our table was ready after we checked in for our reservation. 

Favorites: Prawn curry dish and the sweet puffy bread!
author: Caryn R.

description:
Brilliant service and amazing food!!

This is one of the best South Indian restaurant in San Francisco. Their dosas are so light and fresh, you feel like eating more. The Sambar is also flavorful and delicious. We ended up ordering the chili and garlic dosa( it was not that spicy), South Indian moons and Bombay Frankie. I especially loved the moons( they were basically small uthapams with different toppings). I was surprised to see a beetroot uthapam and it tasted fantastic. 

Would love to comeback and have food again!
author: Bhawna J.

description: Wow. My fiance and I just ate at DOSA for the first time and we were blown away. Everything on the menu looked so good that we couldn't decide, so we tried the prix fixe menu. Unlike many other restaurants, they happily accommodated us when we mentioned that a couple of items in the listing were problematic because of dietary restrictions, and substituted dishes, which was awesome and so very appreciated. Each dish was better than the last, and the flavors were complex and, frankly, incredible. The portions were perfectly sized for sharing, and gave us a great tour of the menu. Service was friendly and attentive.  I'd list standouts on the prix fixe menu, but, honestly, every dish stood out. We will definitely be back, and soon. Thanks for the great food and excellent service, DOSA!
author: Mara E.

description:
Stopped in to DOSA before a movie across the street at Kabuke and sat at their bar to take advantage of their awesome happy hour- 

Not only was the bartender a great person to talk to, the dosa we ordered to go with our happy our wine was awesome! We asked his opinion on which one to get as there's quite an extensive menu of dosas to choose from and he recommended the pumpkin one- alright then!

Amazing flavor and perfectly seasoned, it was an explosion of awesomeness in my mouth. A bit spicy but the sauces will help cool that down!

I am anxious to go back to try more of their menu as the smells coming out of the kitchen were next level- here's hoping another movie night is in my future!
author: Elliott W.

description:
Went without a dinner reservation so had to find a spot at the bar as they were packed. Best decision ever! 
Drinks:
Sat opposite Magic Mika, a skillful bartender, who recommended the peony and the drought relief. Tropical and refreshing! A must have. 
Food:
We had the Vada pav, the kheema dosa, and the five uttapam platter. The Vada pav was tasty  with a crispy pav and tangy tamarind. The uttapam were fluffy and the flavors were great (they had mushroom, beet, caramelized onions) but the kheema dosa blew my socks off. It was the right balance of spices and the lamb flavor shone through. Best dish ever. The tapioca and mango sorbet kheer dessert topped off an incredible evening. 
Definitely sit at the bar and ask for Mika.
author: Manas S.

description: Great food, awesome ambience, reasonable pricing, we had the uttapam moons as a starter; the homemade fruit fruit shrubs were "amazing." This is an absolute favorite to share with friends.
author: Zachary F.

description: With a cool classy ambience you will enjoy some of the tastiest south Indian food. I had the Kheema Dosa and it was delicious. Light, tasty crispy dosa served with a mildly spiced lamb Kheema, two chutneys and a richly spiced deep flavour sambar.
author: Ratnesh S.

description:
I've heard about this place from multiple different sources: friends, family, websites, etc. Being South Indian, I was intrigued as to how they took a simple, home style cuisine and made it "trendy". I had been meaning to go to this place and finally went on a work dinner. 

To summarize, I was pleasantly surprised! I expected to get not impressive South Indian food at higher prices, since I haven't really been impressed by the other places I've tried in the San Jose/Fremont area and in Los Angeles. We ordered the chutney sampler, samosas, Chennai chicken, Rava Masala dosa, Idli Sambhar, Masala Dosa, Chilli Garlic Dosa, and the Halibut curry. 

The chutney sampler was pretty standard and came with 4 chutneys and some papadum. The samosas actually surprised me. As someone who doesn't particularly like samosas, I really enjoyed these. They were light, the stuffing was delectable, and the crust was flaky. The Chennai chicken was very juicy and well seasoned, although I wish it had more of a kick to it. The idlis were made just how I like it, so that made me super happy. Sadly, they only give 2 idlis for $9.50 - and that made me sad. 
The dosas were all fantastic!!! But also very buttery. Not too sure if they used butter or ghee, but I would've liked it with way less. The sambhar and chutneys (coconut and tomato) that came with the dosas were also very tasty! Just like how my family makes it and how it tastes at mom-n-pop food places in south India. The Halibut curry was delicious but was also on the saltier side for my taste. 

Overall, great experience and great food! Service was also nice and pretty quick. I just wish it was more affordable! But also don't want them to cut down on quality - it's a trade off! 

Would I recommend this to my South Indian parents and grandparents? Most definitely.
author: Sitara R.

description:
I love dosa!!! I'm so happy I got check this place out. 

I got the masala dosa, which was really delicious! They the potato and poppy seed in it and the dosa was perfectly crispy! I liked the dipping sauce that came with the dosa. I thought their chutney was good, but I think I have had better. Overall I had a good experience and like the food a lot. Definitely would come back to try other items on their menu!
author: Liz L.

description:
Had a great experience. Ambience is good and food is even better.. 

Great customization.. would definitely love to visit again.
author: Sandeep G.

description:
DOSA on Fillmore is the most considerate unique spot I've been to in ages! I booked a reservation to celebrate our anniversary and they went above and beyond. We showed up early so they offered to let us hang out at the bar while we waited. The bartender was great! He knew the menu, provided recommendations, and overall, was just an awesome guy. Favorite drinks: 3) the peony 2) "pink drink with crazy awesome foam" and our TOP FAV: 1) Drought Relief!

Appetizer: chicken marinated in yogurt with red onion...it is AMAZING, tender, seasoned, delicious!

DOSA: sweet potato!

Entree: coconut prawn curry

The Surprise: mango sorbet with coconut milk and tapioca and a delicious pistachio dessert with champagne.

To the DOSA staff, you all are amazing! Thanks for the great night!
author: Miranda C.

description:
DOSA on Fillmore, San Francisco: 7 April 2018 (by maggiesfoodjournal)

From start to finish, the experience here was a day to remember. Our server, PJ was friendly and cheerful. She did not rush us to order - and at the same time was very helpful. After we had sat down, PJ brought a serving of Papadum. These thin, crisp, chips with popping flavours were a hit at our table. 

Our orders:

Paper Masala Dosa: Dosa is a kind of pancake - its main ingredients are rice and urad beans. Dosa is a South Indian dish - popular all over the Indian subcontinent. This large, thin, pliable, crispy, thin cracker came with potato and other dips. (5 of 5)

Rava Masala: Potato masala with onions and cashew. It had the perfect spice and heat - an excellent marriage with the crispy semolina wheat dosa. (5 of 5)

Lamb 'Keema': Three of us ordered this item. The plain dosa was a genius way to accompany the spiced minced lamb. (5 of 5)

Mango Lassi: All of us had the mango lassi. I am not a big fan of yogurt but I like mangoes - so this gives me a chance to combine the two together. It's not too sweet and well balanced. (5 of 5)

Madras Coffee: The coffee seeds are shade-grown and brewed with chicory. Gladly, I did not taste the chicory - but I could use more sugar in my drink. (4.5 of 5) 

Ambience: 5 of 5
author: Maggie T.

description:
Dosa delivers big flavors and great textures.  The Dosa itself is worth coming back for.  

Highlights - 
Dosa Masala
Prawn Masala
Kerala Fried Chicken

Also tried the Dahi Vada - while good and creamy, there was so much lemon juice it was borderline offensive.
author: Dan W.

description: Downhill Dosa! This used to be one of our top restaurants for years. The curry was bland and the Dahi Vada tasted like stale sponges. Additionally, one of the hostesses was wearing flip flops--I'm all for flip flops but not at a restaurant where the bills easily reaches $100 for two people.Super disappointing across the board and now we know why it was so easy to get a reservation at the last minute!
author: Olivia D.

description:
This fine establishment is the polar opposite of my favorite Indian (well, Pakistani) spot in SF, Shalimar. Whereas that joint is grimy, spare, and you're barely even noticed after you order, the service at Dosa is attentive and impeccable, and it's easily the most beautiful Indian restaurant I've been in since Tabla. 

Not only is the room gorgeous, but the plates are also stunning (in addition to being tasty). They even make samosas look good, which is no mean feat. Among the starters, my favorite was the Chennai chicken, and I almost didn't want to cool my palate down with the yogurt in the Dahi Vida because the whorls of tamarind and mint were so damn lovely. 

Best of all, they don't turn down the heat for American palates. The spice in some of these dishes is no joke; I'm not into spicy for spicy's sake, but when the flavor is there it's wonderful. The Steph Curry (a bourbon cocktail) had some heat, and the rub that they put on the lamb chops had me sweating, although I couldn't resist going back for more. The chicken dum korma was another winner, and from what I can tell from my friends around the table, just about everything was as well.

This is basically about as nice an Indian meal you can have out, but you'll be getting a bill that reflects that as well.
author: Peter D.

description:
The food and ambience was too
Good. Though not very happy with the dosa as it was soggy and not at all crisp.
author: Dipen J.

description: Hi, this place is one of Our favorite restaurant for South Indian food. Vadapav and masala fry idly are our fav appetizers and obviously sambhar of the best thing which attracts me to go so for lovely dinner.  And for non alcoholic drinkers don't forget to try Monsoon delight.
author: Rt T.

description: This is the fancier cousin of the DOSA on Valencia street but with the same menu and prices. It's great for group catch-ups!
author: Meryam B.

description: I was honestly disappointed. People at work kept saying it's so good so we went and got Vada Pav, Dahi Vada, Masala Dosa, and Avocado Chat. I have to say, nothing was great. It's regular food that Indians eat - I don't understand the hype and "it's so unique" claims. It's good food, priced really high, and badly hyped. It's maybe amazing for non-Indians, but for us, the food's regular. Super regular.
author: Satyan C.

description: Great meal- loved everything we had. Unique menu, great space. Service was also very good.
author: Heidi V.

description:
This place is very famous I guess because it is  always crowded. I have been to this place three times but 1st time I didn't taste the food as it was full and we didn't know that we have to  make reservation first and then go there. Second time we got in the restaurant and ordered one paneer dosa, monsoon south indian drink and chole bhatura. Everything was good. We liked it. 
But to be honest it is expensive and highly priced restaurant.
3rd time we went and again I ordered the paneer dosa, Masla dosa, monsoon drink and pomegranate juice. These things were nice. so we thought of ordering dessert. We ordered bread pudding and it wasn't that good and also the quantity was not worth of the price they charged.
This place is famous that's why they charge price insanely. This time I wasn't that happy with the food and quantity and price. So if you are planning to go please make reservation and then go. To be honest I am not going again to this place.
author: Piya G.

description:
Had a 6:30pm reservation for 8 people. There was an accident on route so we had to take a detour to reach, we called in to check if our reservation could be moved by 20mins. The staff handed the phone to the manager who took our call, she was very rude and gave us no options except to cancel the reservation. The family who we had invited to dinner was visiting us from out of town. They arrived at the location 6:40pm, 10
minutes after our reservation time as they too were taking the same detour, they were refused seating saying that they wanted the entire party to be available to be given seating, they too mentioned that the staff was very rude and asked us if it's a norm in San Francisco to be treated like this. It was very embarrassing ...I understand you are busy and need to plan your reservations ahead...but what's with the rudeness? A friendly 'sorry can't make it work' would have been totally acceptable. Sorry won't come back again.......left a bad taste in our mouth.
author: Noveena V.

description:
Maybe I ordered the wrong things because everybody else seems to be a fan of Dosa. 

I made reservations for a early weekday dinner with a coworker who suggested going to Dosa. 

We ordered:
1. Chai Tea
2. Mint Lemonade
2. Dahi Vada
3. Chennai Chicken
4. Kerala Chicken Masla
5. Lamb Curry

I didn't want the chai tea. What I had wanted was the mango lassi. I was told about 5 minutes later after I ordered my lassi that they didn't have the mango one that sad. Super sad panda! I'm very sensitive to spice so I wanted to have something that would reduce the burn on my tongue from all the Indian food. Then I ordered the chai. The chai was SO STRONG. Even my Indian coworker agreed that it was too strong. So I sent that back and settled down with my mint lemonade. 

The food was very meh. I didn't need to pay Dosa prices for the food quality and taste. I could have paid less than half of the price for better Indian food elsewhere. The service was also very bleh. We could never track down our server even though the place was only 1/4 full. 

AND the real cherry on top was that the hostess decided to seat a 7 person party (3 were really young children) RIGHT next to our table. There were other tables that could have accommodated that many people further away from us. The restaurant was only a 1/4 full! So instead of a quiet dinner, I got subjected to kids kicking our legs, bouncing up and down on the shared booth cushions, and parents who couldn't control their children. 

I will NOT be back. Nothing made the experience worth coming back for. There are far better Indian restaurants in the city of SF, and I'd recommend that you go to those instead.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
My fiance and I came here for dinner before a show at The Fillmore.  The food here has been, for us, consistently great and unique with the service always coming off as efficient and quick.  It's the perfect place to go if you want to get in and out quickly while still not feeling overly rushed.

We ended up each getting an entree, a drink and then becoming suckered in (not really) to a dessert.  We both left incredibly happy and without breaking the bank!

On a side note, if you can get a table in their upstairs area by the railings you can do some great people watching.  We will definitely be back!
author: Janos M.

description:
This is a tough call. DOSA can be good, it can be not; but it's worth a visit to see for yourself.

I appreciate that it's an upscale(ish) Indian restaurant. There aren't enough of them. Indian fusion is an interesting concept as well. I'm just not crazy about their food and even considering high cost of San Francisco rents, their prices are a bit high particularly because the cost of the ingredients in their food is fairly low.

Also know they pass the cost of providing health insurance to their staff on to you. This shows up in the form of an additional line item on your check (not in the cost of their food) and it's called "SF Mandate 6%." Then they'll charge you 8.5% tax (which is actually mandated) on everything including the 6% "SF Mandate."
author: Tushar N.

description:
Tastiest Indian food in San Francisco. 
Dosa, Poori the best. 
Biryani presentation was immaculate.
author: Pranay K.

description:
Great spot to get amazing food on a date night.  We stopped in on a busy night (seems like the place is probably always busy) but we're able to get a spot at the bar.

Our bartender helped us out with tasty cocktails and tips on favorite dishes.
author: Jason B.

description: We're not sure when they decided to go with such small plates but this place was definitely not worth the high prices. I can say that the tiny amounts they served were tasty however when we're paying close to $100 per head I shouldn't have to fill up on bread to feel satiated. With the abundance of food options in this city you'll be able to find far better options.
author: Liam F.

description:
The food has very subtle flavors and the quality is good. But if you are looking for the traditional spicy indian food, this may not be the place for you.
I would also add that the portion size is very small for the price. So even after $32 entree we were left hungry and i and my wife are small people.
Also there is a room for improvent in the service. The service lacks the kind of attention and details you expect fromsuch a restaurant.
For instnace, we were not attended for good 10 minutes after given a seat. Also the waitress snatched the signed check while i was still signing my copy. Usually you wait until customers leave the table but if you are in rush, you can always ask politely.
author: Ashish M.

description:
I've been wanting to visit Dosa for so long, bookmarked and been waiting for a great date (which hadn't come) so I decided to meet for drinks/dinner with one of my gfs last night. We made reservations for two, which I didn't think was necessary since it was a Thursday stormy night in SF...but they ended up putting us at the bar since we came late for our reservations (well I did, lol). The bar was the perfect setting, and the manager Chris was simply a delight to have serve/entertain us! He explained the menu (which has numerous GF, dairy free, veg, air free JK) options and gave us the best drink suggestions as well. My friend has lived at Dosa with numerous bday dinners so she knew she wanted her favs (Scallops, Sweet potato something, pistachio dessert). 

The food was amazing, the drinks were awesome (and the bar manager Chris was wonderful in giving us a tasting sampling array, explaining the liquors, etc.). The food was wonderful, unique tasting and not overbearing. 

GREAT experience at Dosa, so happy to have finally visited! If you're a girl or comfortable with feminine drinks, get the one that's pink and looks like a bubble bath! It makes you feel like you're in the market place at India (surrounded by pink clouds). I will definitely be back, maybe with a hot date next time :)
author: Mahsa T.

description: This is by far my favorite Indian restaurant in San Francisco! The food feels authenticallIndian but yet has a local flavor added in. My husband and I both ordered the tasting menu which provided a wide array of flavors, spices and tantalizing colors. We also are non alcohol drinkers, and the spritzers with homemade fruit shrubs were "out of this world",  especially the one made with tamarind.   Finally, the staff was outstanding. Everyone from the host to bartender to server to the manager, Jean, was wonderfully attentive, helpful in making suggestions, and very pleasant to chat with.    This has become one of our favorite restaurants to share with friends.
author: Patty S.

description:
Confusing experience, bad dosa, everything else was amazing.

So this was a strange experience.  We ordered the Dungeness Crab Poori, which is really Pani Puri/Gol Gappa and was amazing.  We also ordered the prawns starter and this was one of the best I have had.  This was followed by the lamb chops, also exceptionally good.  I cannot emphasize how good all three of these dishes were, they were perfect.

Then came the weird part.  The Dosa is terrible.  From the plating of it, which is lazy to the actual taste, it is a shadow of Dosa Bros, Vik's and dozens of others spots in the Bay Area.  The Sambar is listless with no soul, the dosa isn't crispy the potato stuffing is flavorless.  

If they weren't called Dosa, I wouldn't care, but its weird that this is what the name suggests they would be best at.
author: Tree P.

description:
Stellar service. Our waiter was clear and concise. He asked if we've ever dined there before and went from there. Explaining the difference in the style of food and made some personal recommendations of what and how much to order. He was never afraid when we asked about two dishes which he would choose and why.

We went with the prix fixe because we were hungry and weren't sure what to order. 

I started with the lamb slider...my goodness this was friggin delicious. Soft sweet bun, slightly spicy sauce and cooked to perfection.

Then had white truffled dosa. This was also good. The sauces meshed everything all together.

By the time the pork chop with lemon rice came I could only have a few bites. This was also very delicious but I had them box it so I could enjoy the next round...dessert.

The carrot cake. Now this isn't your standard but wow when you scoop it all into one bite, perfection.

Don't take my word for it, try it all for yourself. Delicious.

A tad pricey but you should already know this before even stepping in. The place looks like a million bucks.
author: Guisela L.

description:
I hate to give bad review but the service was really bad. One of the person on our table got his dinner after everybody completed the dinner.

Food was okay. Not worth the price.

Be ready for 36% Service+Tax+SF charge over already high prices..
author: Joy S.

description:
I drove there from Pleasanton with my wife and kid just to have dinner at Dosa, The food & the ambiance here is really good, the service sucks and the waiters and managers are really rude.

This restaurant is very expensive which I understand being in the heart of San Francisco. The waiters and the managers there behave like as if they are paying us to eat the food. Our experience was horrible in terms of service and it really spoiled a nice Saturday evening for us. 

Although food was great but with the money we spent we were looking for an overall better experience than regular Indian restaurants.

When you pay top dollar for regular Indian food, everything must be excellent.

I hope you guys improve your service else people like me will definitely find other places and since we have a lot many in bay area it shouldn't be any problem I guess.
author: Bharat B.

description: Ambience is really nice, modern, inviting, warm and lively. I had high expectations for this place given all the great reviews but I was very disappointed, at least for the dosas. The dosa itself was good but the sambar, chutneys and masalas were not tasty at all, it's really missing the Indian kick. Chana batura on the other hand was good. Overall nice place but food is overrated.
author: Anna A.

description: Hmm...so 5 stars for the ambience! But the food is just about average. It is really over priced south Indian food which does not even taste like authentic south Indian food. We ordered the vada sambar, idli fries and rava masala dosa. All of these were just okay, nothing great at all. Have had amazing south Indian food at other places in the Bay area, so this is nothing in comparison to that. But yes the ambience is really good. So combining the ambience and the average food you will still have a good dining experience overall.
author: Nibha K.

description: Went there with high expectations. Came out little disappointed. Ordered paneer dosa, cheese dosa and rava dosa. Paneer dosa was ok, sambar was good but quantity so less.  Rava dosa was good. Overall ok experience, not as good as we were hoping for.
author: Amit U.

description:
So I went back to the restaurant with a group of my friends. We had the Kerala spring menu. The food and the ambiance were good , but very few of it was authentic (dosa sambar  vs. asparagus and avocado?). So this is more of a South Indian fusion restaurant. I pre-ate before I came. Again small portion sizes. 1 Dosa for 4 people is stingy. The Masala dosa tastes good, though.

 The worst part is I hear they add on a "service fee" which is really a 20% gratuity automatically to the bill. Then they have a separate section for tip. I understand its tough to run a business in SF, but being dishonest and ripping people off is unethical. Also our waiter kept asking us if we really wanted the family-sized meal because we could get too full. Reading through the reviews, I doubt that's a real problem with your patrons.
author: Flora V.

description:
I just wanted to write to thank the staff who was working around 7pm on Dec 27. I was part of the party of 8 people sitting upstairs, where one person in our group had to suddenly leave the table. Our waitress, as well as the other employees of the restaurant were incredibly helpful, friendly, efficient, and made everything stress-free. The woman in our party had felt dizzy and faint which was why we had to leave so suddenly. It had nothing to do with the restaurant or food (in fact she is still talking about how delicious the food was the next day!), but it was due to her age. 

Again, thank you and your staff for being so gracious with everything. We look forward to going back to your restaurant. 6 of the people in our group haven't been here before and they loved everything. Our waitress encouraged us to try different things and it was all wonderful. Thank you!
author: Mary K.

description:
The food was very good, not great.  The prices have doubled since I was here last.  The appetizers are a few little bites and the entrees are the size of appetizers.

The tables are far, far too close together and I couldn't hear a word my husband said during the entire meal, but had to listen to tech industry d-bags shouting and bragging over each other.  I asked the waiter to move us and he said he could not. Won't be coming back.
author: paula m.

description: Lamb sliders, Vada pav, idli fries, all dosas, pani poori and awesome cocktails.. yummm .. must visit
author: Praveen K.

description:
By far the best Dosa in the US
It was Dosa perfection, it took me right back to Matunga home of modern Indian Dosas 
I ordered the ground lamb mix with the Dosa, its called keema dosa, the match was spot on 
The service, now the young bartender was polite, looks after her guest well n most important knows the menu well. 
Overall this is one of finest Indian restaurant in California, maybe USA
I wish them growth n strongly recommend
author: Bhushan A.

description: We ordered dosas and idli fries. The idlies were over fried and the chutney did not have any salt. The mushroom utthappam was undercooked. All in all, not really worth the price, except for great ambience and atmosphere.
author: Ajay G.

description:
Spectacular experience! I visited Dosa on Fillmore on Thursday, Feb. 22. We had an 8 p.m. reservation. We were seated immediately, and I was highly impressed with the pacing and speed of service! My friend and I split about 9 courses, and while we enjoyed every single plate, the highlights were the lamb chops (melt in your mouth) and the crab puffs. 

The cocktails were tasty, and the presentation of the drinks and food was very impressive. The atmosphere is casual, however the restaurant feels intimate and is decorated beautifully. Kudos to manager Natalie and her lovely team! Five-star service!
author: Wendy A.

description:
Popped into DOSA last week for a quick happy hour and boy was I impressed. The happy hour menu is full of amazing small bites and cocktails for very reasonable prices. I had no idea. The last time I ate at DOSA was probably 5 or 6 years ago so I had basically forgotten how good the food was. I suppose I'd have to thank Kabuke theatre for bringing me there because on Tuesday they have $6 dollar movie night and I was burning some time. 

I started with a delicious cocktail, the Bengali Gimlet. It had this curried nectar that really paired well with the gin and a nice citrus balance. Yum. As far as the appetizers go I ordered the following...

- Spicy Vindaloo-style duck tacos: they were indeed spicy and I found myself sweating through my eyes. Delicious. 
- Chennai Chicken: I mean, who doesn't like fried chicken? The coriander and cumin made this dish complete. 
- Pappadum & Chutney Sampler: I nice little variation of flavors with the crispy lentil wafers to dip. 

All in all, I think my bill was under $30 bucks for all this food and the one cocktail and I split all of this food with a friend as it was plenty! I would say this is one of the better happy hours I've had in awhile.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
This was supposed to be our best Indian restaurant in SF.
We always loved food here.
Came in for a Mother's Day Brunch.
Looks like the chef or something has changed.
The menu has changed, and the people serving the food have no clue about what they are serving.
Very bad experience for a Mother's Day.
FROZEN Paratas really. Are you kidding me.
They proudly accepted, sorry it's frozen.
No Mother's Day special menu as well.
Not sure where is the restaurant headed.
author: San K.

description:
I had dinner here two Mondays ago with a friend who was visiting from out of town. I am generally not a huge fan of Indian food, but since my friend expressed a desire for Indian food, I brought him to DOSA.

I wasn't sure how busy it would be, so I made sure to snag a reservation. When I looked a couple days prior, there were plenty of reservations available for Monday night. Originally reserved an 8:30 pm timeslot, but on the day of, we found ourselves free earlier than expected, and luckily I was able to change my reservation to 7:30 pretty last minute.

I wasn't really hungry since I was sick and had little appetite, so my friend got one appetizer and we split a dosa. I didn't try his appetizer so I can't speak to that, but I thought the dosa was just okay. 

We stuck with the masala dosa since that was the classic dosa and we wanted to stick with something basic (though I was very intrigued by the seasonal pumpkin dosa I saw on the menu). The bread part of the dosa was fine, but the potato filling inside was overly salty and I couldn't enjoy it as much. I've had dosas here before and I don't remember them being so salty, so maybe the chef that night had a heavy hand with the salt.

For dessert, we ordered the sorbet flavor of the night which happened to be mango. It was a refreshing end to the meal.

I like that DOSA has two floors. I've been here for team dinners before and we would take up the entire second floor area with 25-30 people.

We were able to find parking a block away on Fillmore. This area has mostly metered spots; there were a couple open spots Monday night, so parking wasn't too hard.
author: Dianna H.

description:
One of our friends suggested this place . We could book a table through yelp and it was easy . This restaurant has an amazing decor . As we entered the restaurant my husband , my uncle and I were seated by a lovely lady who greeted us with a smile , but the order was taken by another person who was a little grumpy . He took our orders but I expected him to be a bit welcoming , he served us well though . 
Talking about the food , I ordered for sambar Vada which was crispy and the Sambar was very good , I also ordered for vada pav which was good but I would have liked it even more if they could add a green chili like an authentic Mumbai vada Pav , I loved the way it was served . I was not that impressed with the masala Dosa as it was not hot when served . 
My uncle ordered South Indian moons , mini pancake size dosa s with different ingredients but he was not that impressed with it . My husband liked his roasted garlic Dosa and we also loved the madras chicken . They have a unique menu and I would love to try them in future !!
author: Chaitra V.

description:
I'm so used to eating South Indian food at traditional South Indian restaurants like Madras Cafe or Udipi where the focus is on food and not ambience that I was really surprised to eat excellent South Indian food in a fine dining restaurant like dosa! 
While their starters are more traditional, the main course is a bit more fusion but overall the flavour, quantity and quality of food is all excellent! I would definitely return and would recommend anyone wanting to eat South Indian food in a fancier venue to give this place a shot!
author: Misha M.

description: I've been here twice. Vegetarian friendly! The dosas are pretty good. So are the idlis and wadas. Chutney is super but the sambar misses something. I tried the plain dosa, the masala dosa and the idli wada.The ambience is classy and the servers are nice (they should smile more though) Honestly, the place is over hyped. One visit is here is great but don't go out of your way. Oh, parking is a big problem here.
author: Megha U.

description: This evening we had a meal at Dosa on Fillmore, and were quite disappointed with the food. The Sambar was bland and over salted. The rest of the food that we ordered was equally bland, and nothing to rave about.
author: K J.

description:
Came here upon recommendation from my vegetarian Indian friends and if meals keep tasting like this, I could go vegetarian on occasional meals, haha. Whatever the chip like things they start you out with, please bring more. They're super thin, crispy and the dip is delicious! I got the basil and garlic dosa as my main entrée. It's got a bit of kick to it which I like. I like the texture of the dosa and the filling was delicious as well. I was also a huge fan of the soup that came on the side of it. 

Overall, I went vegetarian for a night and survived. It was a delicious meal, and had a classy ambiance.
author: Sophia Y.

description: Indian food done creatively. Great food. Great ambience and loved the drinks too. Will be coming back here again. It is a little too expensive even for all the good and one thing I didn't like is they add some SF service tax in the end that's almost 9% and it feels like it's an amount that you don't know about till you see your check. Regardless. The food is good enough for me to be back here again!
author: 49er ..
