I finally had a weekday off from work, which meant I could actually hit up a happy hour in my neighborhood. The man and I walked in right at 5 and plopped down at the gigantic bar. 

Everything at DOSA is enormous, from the high ceilings to the massive chandelier, to the large Shiva statue and other oversized decorations. Go big or go home seems to be the theme, and it carried over to the food as well. 

Happy hour starts at 5pm with drinks (1 beer, 2 cocktails, 2 wines) and from 5.30-7pm you can enjoy select appetizers at discounted prices as well. We started with 2 glasses of white wine and, once the kitchen opened, opted for the Tacos "Frankie" that were the winner of Taco Knockdown SF in 2015. Spicy Vindaloo-style duck and heirloom tomatoes nestled into an egg brushed roti taco and served with a side of creamy coconut chutney. These were killer! Perfect levels of spice and flavor. You get 3 tacos at happy hour for $9. We also had the pappadum & chutney sampler for $4 - it comes with unlimited refills of the crispy lentil wafers and you get 4 chutneys. Our chutneys that day were mint, tamarind, roasted chile-garlic, and apricot. All completely different from one another and bursting with flavor. 

DOSA has a great cocktail menu and the ingredients in each are extensive and exotic. I tried their newest concoction, the Kerala Rhum Runner - Batiste Rhum, curried strawberry gastrique, creme de violette, mint, lemon, champagne for $13. My man chose the Steph Curry - Four Roses Bourbon, curried nectar, spiced agave, lime, Tempranillo for $13. Both were unique and damn delicious. All the ingredients come through at different moments when you're slurping these cocktails. 

We ordered some food of the regular dinner menu. You simply have to try a dosa when you come here as that's what they're clearly known for. All dosas get served with sambar (a lentil & veggie dipping "soup") and fresh coconut & tomato chutneys. After consulting with the bartender on his favorites, we went with the Roasted Chile & Garlic dosa. The mashed potatoes had the perfect consistency and the great spice kick that we were looking for. To cool our tongues a bit we also ordered the Dahi vada small plate. You get a bowl of cool organic Strauss yogurt over a large lentil fritter, all seasoned with tamarind, mint, and mild spices. I absolutely loved this dish and kept slurping yogurt with my spoon. 

Our two bartenders were awesome, talkative, and fun. One of them even gave us a sampler tasting of a new tequila that is made only with the tops of the agave plant as this can then regrow and makes for a much more sustainable tequila making process compared with the traditional way of chopping the whole agave plant off. 

We left with very rotund and happy bellies. Can't wait to come back to try some of their scallop and lamb dishes.
author: Anna R.

description: Excellent dosa, excellent food all round. Service can sometimes be slow, dishes can occasionally be a little greasy, but overall I love eating there.
author: Sameea B.

description: We went from the South Bay since we heard a lot about dosa on Fillmore , sadly the taste was very average for the price , have been to other Indian fine dining places in sf, compared to those I dint see any presentation or taste which you would expect for the price !
author: Poornima G.

description: Awesome ambience, good food, excellent service. Pricey though. One of the expensive Indian cuisine in the bay
author: Keerthi B.

description:
Fantastic!! Everything about DOSA was incredible. The flavors are different but delicious and the range of the menu means you will find something for everyone. As the name implies, the dosa's in particular were my favorite (but that might just be because I like eating with my hands ;). The staff was attentive and coursed out our many dishes appropriately which to me means a lot! Even though I know DOSA's very popular, I never felt rushed to finish which was great! I will definitely be back and probably try the Mission location next, which I'm sure will be just as good. 

The only reason I knocked 1 star off was that I thought the cocktails could be a bit better. I had a carrot vodka drink which sounded good, but was underwhelming. I do like the clever way they name their cocktails though!
author: Brandon P.

description:
Had the chicken Bryani-4 stars arrives baked inside a phillo dough crust. Slightly expensive 

The channa masala was great but the yogurt sauce they charged on the side was 7$! I don't need that much..
author: Michele G.

description:
I think I'm one of the very few people who has given this place a low rating but I have a long story to narrate so bare with me

Being an Indian from south India I can say I have a very high standard of South Indian food. When I heard of this Michelin rated place called dosa I jumped with joy. My husband planned the perfect birthday evening for dinner at dosa. We got here with roaring appetites. We ordered drinks which were good and the famous vada pau. We then ordered the namesake- a chilli garlic dosa and that's when the blasphemy occurred. The dosa was soggy. Yes. It was not hot and seemed like it has been made that morning. N it tasted nothing close to the Michelin crispy goodness picture I had painted in my mind. 

Now fast forward 10 months to my close friends birthday. I was wary but decided to give dosa another honest chance. We got the tasting menu. I got the mung dal paneer salad(average) and the Utapam (good but not mind blowing). The lamb chops were inedible and the waiter recommended them. It was like an entire bottle of Indian all spice was dumped into that poor lamb. My husband got the veggie kofta from the tasting menu but was given a green beans curry instead. To top it off they said they said they'd made a mistake and switched it with another item in the menu. But the green beans curry was not part of the menu. Not sure what they were trying to pull off there. 

Not cool dosa!

On top of that the service was so slow that many people from our party had to miss their next engagement because they were waiting for their $55 meal for more than an hour. So disappointed. 

I don't know what the fuss is about.
author: Ashmita V.

description: I got this from a fellow Lyft rider. Turned out to be fantastic food, ambiance and service. It's an upscale restaurant
author: Muzzamil A.

description:
I've eaten at dosa many times. As a person who spent many years Growing up in India, I can safely say that the food here is as close as it gets to authentic Indian food. The flavor is spot on and every dish on menu is prepared with precision. 


If you love Indian food & live in Northen California i would highly recommend you try this place out.

Some of my personal favorites:

- chennai chicken as an appetizer 
- lamb cops for the main course 
- chicken dum biriyani 
- lamb sliders
- ras malai for desert


The bar tender does have some good cocktails up his sleeve , so please be sure to ask.
author: Rajnish T.

description:
Unlike most Indian restaurant, DOSA serves South Indian cuisine. 

For a table of 5 we ordered:

-Sprouted Mung Bean and Paneer Salad (appetizer): More beans than leafy greens. I enjoyed this dish but if you're looking for the greens, consider another salad option. 

-Bhatura: It was a giant fluffy ball of goodness!

-Garlic and Chili Dosa: Would definitely order this again

-Mushroom and white truffle Uttapam: Would recommend it if you love mushrooms!

-Chicken Dum Korma: Tender, with nice balance of spices but it was difficult to get the chicken out since they put two whole drumsticks in a pot!

-Tamil Lamb:  Flavorful but not too gamey. Little on the heavier side but was delicious. 

-Raito: Extra yogurt sauce with dill and chili to dip the dosa. 

-Mango Lassi: hit the sweet tooth. 

Everyone was well-fed by the night and it served as an excellent comfort food.
author: Linda K.

description: We had a decent lunch here. The restaurant is very spacious and comfortable. The dosas were delicious - paper dosas were spot on but the chutneys were just ok and they are missing the white coconut chutney. The Kerala chicken was delicious, good hit of spicyness and interesting raita. Service was lacking in some character and personality. The most dissapointing part of our lunch was the chai - it tasted just like sweet milky tea. Also, $5.50 charge for a serve of raita is a little absurd.
author: Chris N Kalista M.

description:
Love this place! The place is located right on Fillmore right next to the kabuki theatre. One of the best indian places in SF.

Dosa is more concentrated on South India food with more a spicy kick than North Indian food. For appetizers I would start with the chennai chicken, minced chicken samosa, and the Frankie (very unusual for an indian restaurant - its like a taco shaped dish with duck, tomatoes, and chutney).

For the main courses for spicy: Spicy Mung Dosa or the Lamb Keema. The dosas are perfectly cooked very crispy and served every variety of dipping sauces. 

The ambiance is great here it is like a palace style inside with dimmer lighting for dinner. Service is great, very friendly and funny.

Recommend going there for any occasion - larger groups, dates, business outings, etc.

P.S Make sure to make reservations it tends to get really busy during peak hours and on weekends.
author: Kunal T.

description:
It's unfortunate that I am reviewing this place with such a low rating. I have been to Dosa several times, and the food and ambiance kept bringing me back. However, the last time was a terrible experience with service, and unfortunately, this was the second time I have experienced bad service, thus writing about it this time.

For a place with a high price point, I am going to be picky about its service...what else are we paying so much for? We went there on a Monday night (party of 4) and despite it not being very busy, the service was slow, the server was rude and uninterested, we never got any attention unless we jumped out of our seat to flag him down (literally). The portion size of one of our orders was CLEARLY off, and when we mentioned this to him, we got a snarky remark with an attitude. I'm Indian and I have had Idli's all my life, don't tell me 1 whole idly and  1/2 another makes a portion...admit it was a mistake and move on. I would appreciate that more than a passive aggressive response. Eventually, he told us that he would bring out a better serving...which took about 30 minutes. After dinner, we waiting another 40 mins to get the check. I would embrace such attitude in a low budget Chinatown restaurant, where rude service is a part of the culture, but for Dosa...THE DOSA, no sir, it doesn't fly.

With the ever growing restaurant scene in the Bay Area, I will find another place to spend my money and feel more welcomed.

That was my $0.02.
author: Tarun P.

description:
A very cool modern twist to Indian food is what you will get at Dosa. The ambiance is very chic, they have bollywood music playing in the background, the hosts are ethnically dressed (they try) and the menu is traditional Indian but with a touch of westernization. 
I have been to Dosa multiple times. The one on Fillmore is definitely much bigger and busier than one on Valencia. During my multiple visits I have tried and loved each of the following: dahi vada, vada pav, egg curry, mysore dosa, masala dosa, the uttapa sampler and the cocktails! They get reaaaly busy on weekends so making a reservation is necessary unless you don't mind a long wait time. And all my servers have been amazing - very patient, friendly and helpful.
author: Reema B.

description: Recommended by a Berkeley "foodie" friend. Made reservation on Yelp, arrived a bit early, and were seated promptly. Megan, our server, was wonderful. Since we were new to southern Indian food, she recommended several starters (chutney, spiced avocado chaat, pepper shrimp) and a main Dosa dish (alas, can't remember what Megan brought to us): all good and just the right amount of food. I think I'm still a fan of northern Indian food, but this was a grand experience. High ceilings (used to be a bank?), good music, pleasant ambiance. We arrived about 6:15 on a Saturday evening, and the place was not crowded. By 7:15, the place was packed.
author: Dave M.

description:
Felt rushed to leave. We have been coming here for many years, one of my favorite restaurants. Looks like its under new management because it's gone downhill fast. Food was ok, ordered the chole bhature, which were a bit sweet, dunno why, bhature shouldn't be sweet at all. Chole were good, interesting mix of edamame and grape/cherry tomatoes, very california. Papad appetizer was either soggy or undercooked, i.e. oil wasnt hot enough. 

Service was terrible, sitdown to getting food time must have been at least 30 mins but when we were done, they kept coming back every other minute to clear the plates. Felt rushed to leave. Annoying when you have a family.
author: Manish B.

description:
We have dined here before, and the food is extremely tasty, but the service is incredibly rude.

Recently, I made a reservation for a birthday dinner. Days later, they informed us of an insanely high minimum that we had to hit that would be about ~$200/person. Our party included 50% children (including an infant) and we were told that we would hit the minimum with alcohol. Give me a break This is unreasonable to ask, when half the party will not drink alcohol. So disappointed in their lack of response (I tried emailing several times over 3 months with NO reply), and then to be treated so indifferently. Will not be patronizing them again.
author: Sejal P.

description:
Recommended for anyone who loves indian food. Its truly amazing. Never thought i would get exceptionally yummy indian food in SF.  Also try out the one at Fillmore. I find it nicer and more spacious. 
Great food, great service and overall super awesome!
author: Natalia B.

description:
The service was so rude. We went on a Saturday afternoon. The restaurant was at least half empty. I asked the hostess about keeping our baby's stroller near our table as she was asleep and her response was very blah and "whatever". 

The food was average and there are several other better South Indian places. I guess they r just riding in older high reviews.

Just a more pretentious Indian places charging more money for average food than a regular Indian place.
author: Manek K.

description: Just satisfy your appetite and make your day complete with the yummy South Indian food, loved avocado chat and vada pav/sliders, idli fry.. amazing ambience and cool place to hang out with friends!!!!
author: Pragyan P.

description:
Awesome place but definitely make a reservation if you can! It's always packed (especially weekends and evenings). We actually came here because we tried to go to State Bird without a reservation (d'oh) and didn't get in.

But, this place was absolutely amazing with great food, great ambiance. Loved everything, but things do run a bit spicy. I asked the waiter about the sauces and he said "it's not that spicy"...it was very spicy (but I also have a very low tolerance for spicy stuff)

Would definitely come back again and try out some other items on the menu!
author: Jennifer J.

description:
I came here with 4 of my friends tonight and have to say that I'm very disappointed in the service. I'm only giving this two stars solely because the food was good and the bus boy was our saving grace (I wish we got his name to thank him). That being said, I don't think I've ever had an experience like this before. 

We made a reservation for 8pm and arrived on time. We were told to get drinks at the bar while they "prepared" our table. You would think that their phrasing meant that our table was just about ready, but they needed to set it up. Well, around 8:30 we still weren't seated. When we asked about the status of our table (twice), we were met with "the people at your table are paying now". Interesting. I'm curious why we couldn't be seated at another table that left closer to our reservation. It wasn't even that crowded. Around 8:45 we're finally seated. 

We're immediately greeted with waters by the awesome bus boy. A few minutes later one of the managers comes by-unprompted- to apologize for the wait, they "got a new system that's buggy and difficult for everyone to learn". While I understand that implementing and teaching new technology can be tricky, it's no excuse for making your customers feel forgotten about. 

We had to ask random employees multiple times to please get our waiter. We only saw the man twice the entire meal: the first was after practically begging someone to get him so we could order, the second as we were leaving. That first encounter came almost 20 minutes after sitting down (9:10ish). There was no acknowledgement that we've been waiting, just "what would you like to drink?" "We're ready to order, *order*" "Okay" *walks away*. 

Around 9:30 none of our appetizers or food have been delivered, and the only person who had paid us any mind was the busboy. I think he noticed our frustration and gave us these chip things to help settle our hungry stomachs. 

We had to physically call over a random waiter so that we could ask for a manager. A different manager than before approaches us, and we explain how frustrated we are. He claims it's the system again, and "it has nothing to do with you guys". Damn right it's nothing to do with us, we've done nothing but try to dine at your establishment. We counter with trying to explain that the system doesn't account for the fact that we've only seen the waiter once when we requested him. He comes back with the same statement that it's the system it's been like this all night and it's not our fault. I've now asked why, if this has been happening for so long, they haven't gone back to simple pen and paper? After trying to get through that at this point we don't think it's really the system, and having him assure us it's the system, we ask "so is our order even in this system?" "I'll go check on that and bring you some things." To which we say, "Are those things going to be what we ordered?" And no response there. 

It's nice to be offered free extras, but frankly we just wanted our actual order and to be assured that it was coming in a timely manner, and we didn't get that. We after joked that we would need to go pick up burger King from across the street  while waiting. 

Suddenly all the food comes out at once. All the appetizers and entrées all together. It was overwhelming and not a great presentation. In the back of my mind I question whether this has been sitting out for us waiting for our absent waiter to retrieve it (although he did not bring anything to our table at any point, I stand by my statement that we saw him twice). 

The food was good, I'll say that. I enjoyed everything we ordered plus those 2 extras. I don't think the food was worth this experience. 

Everything went fine after eating. No complaints about that... Except the auto gratuity of 20 percent for parties of five and above. I'm usually for tipping well, but it's ridiculous that we don't get a choice in the matter when the service was through and through horrible. I've written only a few yelp reviews, and haven't reviewed in a while, but I felt that this really needed to be said. I was excited to try this place because I've heard such rave reviews from friends, but I ended up disappointed.
author: Robyn N.

description:
This was my first time visiting DOSA at fillmore, and now I can say this is surely the better of the two locations and the reviews and ratings are justified. It may not look any special from outside, but as soon as you enter the feel and ambience are welcoming.
The food is great here and probably does justice to the higher price tag. The have options for vegetarian and meat lovers alike. I would suggest trying the fried idlies small plate, they serve with tomato and ginger chutney. All dosas are pretty good so you can try what works for you. 
I would suggest calling on and reserving your table as the place is almost always full. Parking is easy around, there is a lot of road side parking plus a parking garage right opposite the restaurant.
author: Chetas M.

description:
This review Is for the caviar specific menu. 

I generally like Dosa, however, it looks like they decided to partner with Caviar on cheaper food ... and it tastes / looks like it. 

2 stars is specifically for the Caviar delivery specific menu. They had chicken tikka masala with naan and rice. I was surprised to see that since I didn't think they had that dish in the restaurant. I decided to give it a shot since the food is usually pretty good. Big mistake - the food came out cold. The naan tasted like they just got it from the grocery store. The portion was also small. 

This was clearly a shameless attempt by a normally successful higher end restaurant that serves generally tasty food to go down market.
author: Myron N.

description:
I was a big fan of dosa. Have referred a lot of friends to this place because the taste was authentic and had a Californian touch to it as well. I had the weekend thali and was throughly disappointed. 
* Poriyal had no salt and was half cooked.
* Rasam was just tamarind water certainly not like what it should have been.
* Service was average.
* Increased price and decreased quality. 

Other day I had dosa and the chutney was not good at all. I guess the coconut had gone bad in it. 

I think their chef had changed. Hopefully they fix it before they lose their name.
author: Magizh T.

description:
A great upscale cousin of its sister property on Valencia. The menu is a little bit more varied (more seafood options), a hip bar scene and high ceilings. Great to entertain.
The FOOD is amazing. We stayed with the small plates mostly and that is where the kitchen has tried a lot of new things. A must visit.
Dishes to try- lamb sliders, Idli fries, Chennai Chicken, Scallops (try the sauce)
author: Puneet G.

description: Great food but poor service. The ambiance (music) and look of the restaurant doesn't go with the Indian culture. The Hispanic servers know nothing about the Indian food or spices. The hostess is rude and you're not really greeted well. Very poor experience
author: Kiran P.

description:
FOOD POISONING ALERT- ordered the korma and got very sick from it. 48 hour food poisoning currently going strong. 

Not to mention, terrible service. 2 entree dishes came out within 15 minutes but had to wait over an hour for the third entree and finally canceled it. Unhelpful staff too. I understand weekend nights being busy, but if kitchen is unable to fulfill orders in a timely manner (dishes for same course coming out within the same hour), do not take more reservations.  

Love DOSA on Valencia but will definitely not be returning to this location. Very disappointing.
author: Naomi B.

description: Honestly, this used to be my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE restaurant for years in San Francisco. I moved away to CO about two years ago, and came back recently to dine there, and it was the worst Indian food I've ever had. I asked the waitress why everything was so different, and she said they recently had some menu changes. I could not be more depressed about this. I ordered the Idli fries as an appetizer, which were unimpressive and the prawn masala as my entree. The curry to the prawn masala tasted like watery tomato soup with some spices, and was not even the consistency of normal curry. My mom ordered a chicken curry, which also had a watery consistency, and no flavor. This is one of the pricier Indian restaurants, and I had always felt it was worth it perviously, but if you're thinking of going there now, I'd advise you to save your money.
author: Kim B.

description: I used to love Dosa when I first moved to California.. loved their chicken biryani as it was done very uniquely and with lots of green vegetables. Then I think they changed their chef in late 2016 and the food is just mediocre now. I wish Dosa would go back to its original way of cooking items on the menu. Still love their drinks and lamb sliders along with the ambience of the place but that is about it.
author: Tanvi G.

description:
We had a great experience at DOSA. This was my 2nd time and still held up to my first experience which was last June. The place is posh and fun. Full bar. So not traditional looking in style, but I personally love that. 

This time they had a family style menu in addition to their regular menu which is nice for those of us inexperienced with Indian cuisine. It was 3 starters, 3 main dishes, and 2 desserts. $45 per person. It was fantastic. Very fair for what you get and you get to pick. I'm not going to nail the names since I'm truly an American, so I apologize in advance. 

We started with the salad which was arugula, sprouts (I believe) and pomegranate seeds with season tofu. Delicious and refreshing. Perfect starter. We then had a dosa with seared scallops and it was divine...lemony, herbaceous, and a hint of spice. Next was the Chenala chicken...wow. Sooo tasty! I loved the light crisp and spices with a yogurt sauce for dipping. 

For entrees we got a vegetable dish as well as a lamb dosa and prawns. The dishes came with rice. The prawns were kind of curry style and the sauce was delicious. We dipped the chips that came at the start in the sauce. The dosa was amazing. The ground lamb was so flavorful. I wish I could remember all the spices. What I loved is that it was just the right heat. Not too spicy, just enough. 

We wrapped up with a refreshing mango sorbet and a decadent, but not to heavy pistachio chocolate torte which came with fresh berries. 

We also enjoyed cocktails & wine. I loved the Peony and the Albariño. Definitely recommend for the meal. 

The service was also wonderful. Kirstin did a great job...friendly, fun, and helpful. We'll definitely be back when in SF!
author: L R.

description: The food is OK. The service, abysmal. We ordered two dishes and one drink that never arrived. When we asked, we were told it was coming. Never did. Utterly useless service and ruined the experience. Not worth the money IMO.
author: Gordon C.

description: Dosa is a large restaurant so it is easy to get it a seat, environment and decoration is beautiful, food is amazing and staffs are great here. I highly recommend trying their Dosa's!
author: Ellie T.

description:
We had recently done an escape room nearby for an offsite, and unfortunately we escaped but not in the suggested time frame. We had to drown our sorrows and discuss what went wrong over some drinks. Dosa was the shoulder we used to cry on. 

We had a reservation for 5:30pm but since we didn't escape the room in time (so sad), we arrived a little bit later so they weren't ready for us (maybe they gave our table away or ???) The place feels gigantic with high ceilings, bigw windows but still plenty of mood lighting. They have a happy hour but it only applies if you sit at the bar - not at the tables which kinda sucks. 

We sat down comfortably upstairs in a group of 10 and were immediately served this delicious, warm papadum which is crispy flavorful chips made out of chickpeas. Delicious and  kinda healthy - i don't know why papadum isn't sold more commercially! 
A majority of my table got the Emerald Monk - highly recommended my friend who consideres Dosa her home away home. It's a beautiful chartreuse with vodka, lime, chili agave, and ginger. Everyone had really positive reviews about. I ordered the Peony - Gin, hibisucs masala nectar, coconut, lime, birds eye chile. Highly recommended. 

We ordered a bunch of snacks for the whole table: Chennai chicken - perfect bite sized with raw onion slices and cool dipping sauce,  vindaloo style duck tacos - spicy with a green sauce, samosas that were gigantic and very shareable, veggie sliders - spicy with a side salad, and idli fries - thick cut fries with powered lentils - looked  like they'd be cajun fries but don't taste like much - kinda bland actually. All the shared small plates are definitely large enough to be their own dish if it's just for one person, especially if they come with a side salad it's giving off those vibes. 
Service was fantastic as always, very quick and friendly. Dosa was the perfect place for our team to unwind and bond over food and drink.
author: Veronica L.

description:
We had truly superb service by J. Jameson on Friday night. It was my birthday dinner and he went out of his way to make it excellent. 

As always, the food was delish. Thank you, J!
author: SF Dweller G.

description: Went there on Jan 13th, Saturday.  Luckily we got same day reservations for a late evening dinner. No problem. We got seated on time and our order was promptly taken and the food also delivered on time.  Had the rava masala dosa and it was good. Both the sambar and chutney were delicious. We also ordered the spicy uttapam which turned out to be REALLY spicy and the quantity was also small compared to the RMD.  The choley batura was also good and the size was huge.  Overall, good dosa, pleasant hostess and good service.  Could definitely go back there.
author: John M.

description:
i have been meaning to check out DOSA, and today was the day :) 
Called around 11:30AM to make a rezzie for 1:30PM on the day of (actually, we were craving ramen and was japantown bound when we found out it was cherry blossom festival - quickly realizing it was probably a bad idea and it would probably take us forever to get seated).
Upon arrival, we were seated immediately. 
So first time trying Dosa.
Dosas are very thin, almost crepe-like versions of naans, to which I dipped into curry-like sauce.
Mine was extra crispy/thin because it was the paper dosa! beware though, they are HUGE! like a big tunnel! 
The utappan was slightly thicker, almost looked like pancake - the truffle mushroom was super delicious.

the mango juice and chai was also excellent! :)

great experience overall at this southern Indian restaurant! 

recommend brining guests from out of town!
author: holly n.

description:
I feel like I will lose all SF food cred writing this review. I didn't love Dosa! There must be something wrong with me. I typically love Indian food but found everything to taste the same, bland across the board. The service was AWESOME and I LOVE the ambiance. It's perfect for a date. Neither of us loved the food though. We ordered two appetizers the steamed rice patties and lentil dumplings. The rice patties were super dense and heavy. The dumplings were in a white soup base which I imagine was meant to be cold because it was. Nothing was appetizing really. I ordered a sweet potato dosa which was good dipped into the chutneys. But I didn't feel wow-ed. We had the pistachio fudge bar for dessert. That was my favorite thing of the night, along with the sweet tumeric tea. 

I am going to give Dosa another shot though. Perhaps we just ordered the wrong things for our tastes.
author: Jane R.

description: Excellent food! The lamb sliders are a must along with the bhatura! Cool vibe - service was fine (nothing bad or special). Def recommend it if you want some authentic Indian dishes!
author: Sam M.

description: Very nice place and ambience for an Indian restaurant. The dosas and uttapam were amazing. Vada pav was best in Bay area.
author: Chintan D.

description:
Another great neighborhood go-to! I have never made a reservation at DOSA, but am thinking we should start. Every time we've gone, we've gone at prime dinner time (7pm-8pm) and have seen a long wait. Every time, we've miraculously found a spot at the bar or been seated at a table in record time. Lucky, I guess! I am not a huge fan of eating at the bar here, as it is busy and noisy. I'm paying the same for the meal, I would prefer the "full" experience. Sitting at a table is lovely and service at both table and bar is top notch.

Now for the food: boyfriend always gets a dosa and loves them! I've been a fan of dosas, but for whatever reason I don't dig DOSA's dosas. So I've experimented... One time, I got a mango salad with some sea tuber that was inedible it was so salty. Another time, I got scallops (eh). Once, I just ordered bread. Last time, I got the prawn masala which was great. I finally found my dish. One thing never changes: I always order the bhatura. Oh. My. Sweet. Jesus. I love this bread so much. When it comes out, it's a huge puff the size of your head. Everyone stares. Worth it. It's like low key fried dough. I could eat that bread every day (and do every time we go to DOSA). Huge highlight even when my main dish isn't to die for. 

Overall, love this place. Great upscale ambiance, great place to bring visitors. Again, would recommend a reservation. Also, without fail, we are always surprised by the bill. Both food and drink are a little spendy for weeknight Indian, but we keep coming back!
author: Chloe M.

description: Loved the food! Restaurant interior was fabulous. Servers could be trained a bit more to be more customer friendly but I think that is part of the dining experience
author: Yogi B.

description: Had the white truffle Masala dosa on our Japantown Tour. It was so wonderful! The samba was fantastic!
author: Crystal B.

description:
I am completely speechless! I did my research before coming here and when my meal was completed, I realized this restaurant more than exceeded all my expectations. I haven't stopped thinking about it ever since and I'm already planning my next visit!
     Wow! From the moment we walked in, we were immediately acknowledged by the bartenders even though we didn't stop at the bar. We were seated upstairs (our choice) which was great because we had a wonderful view of the entire restaurant, which is aesthetically pleasing, decorated with amazing artsy chandeliers and in gorgeous hues of orange! Our waiter was super friendly and the service was great!
     We all ordered specialty cocktails. Mine was a gin and tonic, mixed with a house made fig and cardamom tonic. Best gin and tonic I've ever had. We ordered many shared plates. They were nothing short of amazing!!!

Spring Fruits and goat cheese salad---So good I had to order a second one! Visually beautiful with Strawberries, oranges, greens, peas, sweet roasted walnuts, goat cheese fritters, and edible flower petals in a spicy avocado coconut dressing! Superb!

Sprouted Mung Bean & Paneer Salad--with chunks of watermelon, tofu, mung beans, coconut and kale with a spicy Apple dressing. Yummmmm...So fresh!

Five Moons Uttapam Sampler----just beautiful! Little pancakes with toppings. You dip them in tomato and coconut chutneys and lentil sambar (which is a hot lentil soup)

Shikampuri Kebab Sliders--- minced lamb slider on a sweet roll with a spicy dipping sauce. My mouth was on fire but it was worth it!

Chennai Chicken---Succulent shreds of deep fried chicken with a cool coriander cumin sauce. Mmmmmmmmmm!

   And as if that wasn't enough, our waiter brought us a complimentary dessert!!!

    Our tab was very reasonable and I left extremely happy!

    This was so worth coming all the way from Napa Valley for!! Like I said, I'm speechless and happy to have found this restaurant. I'm coming back as soon as I can!!! Thank you so much for enlightening me!
author: Grace H.

description:
I am a fairly regular visitor at the two Dosas in the city. The experience I had on valentine's day dinner at the fillmore dosa was quite horrible. First, we being regulars, were looking for the dosa menu. We were not only refused the regular dosa menu, but were also told that only pre fixe menu is possible ($100 for one meal). While the price was definitely extremely steep, that wasn't the only thing that bothered me. 15 mins later another couple came on the nearby table and ordered the regular menu and were given the option.

Even in the pre fixe menu, the main course (lamb dish) had lamb that was super-chewy and not cooked properly.

Overall, quite a crappy dinner experience. Again, while one of the favorite restaurants of ours in the city, we felt completely ripped off with the experience :-(
author: Gaurav J.

description: Visitor from a small state - Went for brunch - nice place, decor, and staff. Ordered idly and dosa. The idly didn't taste fresh. The potato masala in the dosa was too little. Chutneys were not so good. Sambar came to rescue everything and was excellent. The high price point makes everything a little more underwhelming. Maybe the location is the key here but food is mostly average.
author: Ram A.

description: I thought this restaurant was very expensive. I ordered a dosa, which is a huge crepe with potatoes and veggies that cost $13. It came with a small cup of spicy soup. I couldn't drink it cause it was too spicy for me. Too bad they didn't have a non- spicy option for the soup.  They give you free chips. I asked them if they can refill the chips and said yes,  but it never came. I asked again but they ignored me or maybe they were busy.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
This review is for table accommodations only. We've been here many times & have loved their food & cocktails. Their service was always friendly, efficient, & accommodating. Unfortunately, last nite was a total let down. We made reservations for 5:30pm & requested a table by the giant window in the front. Why you ask? Surely not because we crave being gawked at while eating our dinner... we requested that section because my husband has a bad back & that section & only that section has the comfy sofa-like chairs with a relatively high back compared to the regular chairs. 

As we checked in with the hostess, we were told that indeed they've reserved our table as requested, but they have no one to serve that section until 6pm & asked if we wouldn't mind waiting at the bar till that time. Now we've reserved 5:30pm tables here many times so we could make our 7pm movie, so we declined. We asked if we could sit at one of the high back wall sofa seats instead. She said yes & off we go. Unfortunately it was to a tiny little corner table for 2 that juts up against a giant beam... very claustrophobic! So we ask if we could have a table that's a little more open & the waiter said "yes" & proceeded to lead us to the opposite side where an identically claustrophobic table was located only it juts up against a beam on the right side this time. So getting frustrated we asked if we could have a different table other than the 2 corner ones that would be less constrictive. The waiter looked totally confused & that's when the hostess stepped in & asked if we would like to sit up stairs. Now if we wanted to sit upstairs where it gets stuffy & hot, we would have asked to be seated upstairs. We've literally sat everywhere possible at Dosa & we prefer the seats we requested. I can't believe that in a restaurant that's 99% empty (I counted 3 tables of diners & a half dozen at the bar) yet you can't accommodate 2 people? REALLY!!!!! We thanked the hostess for her efforts, or should I have said the lack of it, & left disappointed.

We're not sure if we'll be back. It really is too bad, because Dosa was our "go to" almost every time we watch a movie at the Kabuki.
author: Amen C.

description:
Third time in San Fran, third time here! This was our first lunch and it was delicious. In general the place looked great, service is amazing, and the food... just great. 

We had dosa (served with one of the best sambars I've ever had), and a chicken curry. The curry was advertised with lemon rice, but came with plain jasmine. Here is the reason for 4 star. While the waiter apologized and actually brought a free lemon rice as well, the lemon rice was bad. My mother in law is from Tamil Nadu and has passed her recipes on to me. This was not good lemon rice. Week and not lemony in the slightest. Additionally, the chicken curry was bland. 

Take my word for it, the food here is creative and good. The lemon rice was a lone blemish on an otherwise glowing series of experiences.
author: James W.

description:
This one was tough. My family makes this food all the time and I know good and yes I understand the built in bias but there was some pleasant surprises in the fact I saw an orange chutney I wouldn't think a restaurant would be highlighting. Also the bus boys and manager service was amazing. Been to hundreds of restaurants in India, globally and all over the US and have to say these are the most engaged busy boys I've seen--in fact so much they put my waiter to shame as he didn't pass by much. But bus boys seemed happy, assertive and proactive to make your experience. I lead 120 direct reports myself so I have to assume this behavior is cause of the manager so that's great! But this is a restaurant. This feedback is for the owner: the prices? I know how much dosa would cost to make; cents on the dollar? How can you charge 13-20 dollars for one albeit it being large? And you said Tamil Lamb? Cmon. Nobody in Tamil Nadu puts corn in their lamb dish; is this some adaptation for the Western pallet, I'm not sure. My wife liked but not too authentic. I just could understand how my wife and I were billed nearly 100 dollars and didn't make sense how the entrees total to nearly 30 dollar a peice. And for main reason I gave a 3. The waiter somehow misunderstood me and I said poori and he said curry? I assumed it came with something? And he never gave me poori but a curry that was overpriced. Wasn't happy but I'm not an asshole and I sucked it up. 

Anyways yes the dosa was good. Not great but the above set me back and I will say the decor was over the top good. Sure at one point many would give a 5, it's almost there.
author: Abubu A.

description:
I'm in love with the ambiance and decor. It gives a very inviting and sexy feel to your dining experience. They serve typically South Indian style cuisine. 

I came with a party of 10 and were seated upstairs where we were able to overlook the bar and rest of the restaurant. I think for large parties, they suggest the tasting menu for $44/person for 3 dishes. You can still add stuff from the regular menu, but the 3 course tasting menu comes in generous portions that will fill you up. I was a bit tired from work that day so the tasting menu was perfect because it didn't require a lot of thinking! Haha!

Red Beet & Cumin Soup - it was made with pureed roasted red beets, and creme fraiche. Very tasty! I've never had beet soup before, its bloody red and very healthy for you.

Organic Mushroom Uttapam - made with trumpet, maitake and beech mushrooms, cilantro, curry leaves, and drizzled with white truffle oil. This one is my favorite because of the white truffle oil, it added an extra umph to the already fragrant dish. Comes with plenty of dipping sauces.

Spicy Basil Prawns - basil leaves, caramelized onions, chile, tamarind, ginger, garlic, tomato and coconut rice. Mildly spicy and really tasty on top of the fragrant  coconut rice! 

I'd definitely come back so I can try some of their other things off the regular menu!
author: Janny S.

description: hayley should be promoted to drink master. thanks for the best sugar free lemonade. if you need s great drink and good service, head to dosa.
author: Taige E.

description:
I recently had their food and had to post a Yelp review. It is so delicious. Service is really awesome too!

Highly recommend Tasting Menu if you are up for it/

They give you pappadam as a complimentary appetizer. 

FOOD:

1. Vada Pav Veg - This is one of the bests!!! It comes with only 1 of them. Ask for 2 if you have 2 people

2. Dahi Vada - one of my all time favorites! Awesome Presentation

3. White Truffle Masala Dosa - to die for!

4. Spicy Mung Masala - Really yummy!

DRINKS:

1. Bali Hai - My favorite!

2. Steph Curry - really good cocktail with Bourbon

3. Mango is the New Black - It's okay for once but wouldn't get it again!
author: Hiral P.

description: Not worth the hype. The fried idlies were good, the rest, dosas and chicken fry, were average.
author: Goutam M.

description:
Tea horrible 2/10 tasted stale and as if boiled and left out for hrs
Vada can't eat , smelt of old oil, bad consistency
Oh and server pulled out menu from my friend who was still reading it
Never coming back
author: Nivedita L.

description: Heard so much about this place from my brother in law, who is a regular to this restaurant. Came here on thanksgiving weekend with my extended family a total of 15 people. We were all having a great time:) suddenly my brother in law says to me " look" and I asked him what.... there was a piece of glass in the sambar!!! We called our server and showed him the glass piece and he said let me talk to the manager. We wait and the server comes back with the bill and says we took one dosa off ( on the house)!!! The manager does not come to talk to us no apologies from them..... very sad. Well for sure no more visits to this place for us.....
author: Ruchira B.

description: The ambiance is good but food is over priced not that great at all. DOSA came very cold on the table.
author: Pal P.

description:
I felt like I was eating at a completely different restaurant then the last time when I gave them a 5 star review.  I wonder if the lunch crew is different from the dinner crew.  Service was slow even though they weren't that busy.  The dosa had a bit of a fish flavor/smell even though it was supposed to be just paneer and peas.  Despite requesting no onion and garlic, they brought the sambar which did contain it.  Unlike the last time I was here there was no chutney or yogurt.  I did not even finish the dosa because it tasted so bad.  And hours later my stomach was upset, so something wasn't right.  Very disappointed with this visit.

I probably won't go back because at this price point I do not expect this level of inconsistency.
author: Anoop G.

description: Not what I expected but a fun foodie adventure!  Very good food, beautiful restaurant and ambiance.  Bit pricey for Indian food and my lamb was very fatty (yuck) but everything else was great
author: Jenn T.

description: First time going here. Lovely decor inside. Service was not very good for us. Three of us were waiting for the rest of our party so we ordered some appetizers and drinks. Server totally forgot to bring one of the drinks and didn't even notice we had to remind her. Lassi was sweet even the I ordered the salty one. I felt like too many people were waiting on tables and it was confusing for the servers if someone had received their food or not for us 3 times they put food on our table when we had already gotten us. I ordered a madras curry which is generally a milder curry but it was quite spicy and mouth on fire style. I feel like most of the food was overly spicy. We were overcharged on our bill as well. Service needs to improve food was ok but I've had better Indian unfortunately
author: lyn m.

description: The ambience is good, service is quick, reservation system is methodical - we had an overall good experience. We loved Lamb kheema and Rawa dosa.
author: Nikita D.

description:
Upscale Indian food with spot-on service. The high ceilings, decor and lighting are fancy and make me feel glam. It's probably a good idea to make reservations. The first time I went, we just walked in with 4 of us early on a Friday evening and had to wait 30 minutes before we got a table. Now I try to remember to reserve. Beware if you don't like spicy stuff. The food is hot!!! 

Gluten-free people will be happy with many options. Try the masala, spicy mung masala and sweet potato dosa. Veg sliders to start are awesome!
author: Alex W.

description: For the first time in my life, they brought dosa without sambar or chutney. When asked they looked at me as if I was strange. I had to order them as exta. Dosa was cold and smelly. Had to wait 10 min for the sambar! Will not repeat. They added 20% tips and gave me no choice. I thought the service was bad.
author: Bala A.

description: Dosa the word it self is close to heart as South Indian and as we are first people in the restaurant and as I was in music turn me on and table we choose was next to glass everything was good for Sunday morning and coming to food now which I can't skip being a foodie the food look amazing and presenting and flavor very much home for me. I highly recommend this place.
author: Ravipati P.

description:
Worth the hype and the money! Excellent service, and very good selection in the menu.

Cannot go wrong with anything. Do try the Lamb Keema Dosa, the fried chicken and the Prawn Masala.

Parking may be a hassle, but hey this is SF!
author: A K.

description: Really good but really spicy south Indian food and really really bad service. My server forgot to bring my wine until I was almost done with dinner & they initially charged us for someone else's tab & the person sitting next to us was brought the wrong dish twice before the right stuff arrived. The place was packed but I wonder how the place makes any money with so much mismanagement.
author: A. B.

description:
The food here is very delicious. I would highly recommend the Vada Pav and Chennai Chicken for appetizers. Get a couple dosas and curries to share, and a couple of their spiced cocktails, and you're set. 

The only knock on this place is that the wait staff here is a little off. I've had weird interactions with all the waiters I've had here. And be warned that even if you make reservations on a busy night you may have to wait an extra 30 minutes because they can't seem to manage the timing of their reservations.
author: K T.

description: I am conflicted in reviewing this place. It is one of the best Indian dinner places for special occasions as it is fairly expensive. The food and presentations are on point. I wouldn't go here if all I wanted was some delicious dosa (or other South Indian breakfast options ). There are plenty of places in the south bay that are better for it(e.g. Madras Idli kadai).  Yet, I can't deny that the food is delicious here it is just that it is too pricey for what it is.
author: Saideep S.

description:
I've been here twice now. I really love this restaurant overall. I would give it five stars for decor and service. It's gorgeous inside and they play nice music in the background. The menu has beautiful choices of traditional dishes as well as interesting fusion dishes like black truffle dosa. Hmmmm! 

We've tried and loved the Chennai chicken, vada pav, paper masala dosa, and uttapams. Delicious!!!!! I can't tell you how great those things are. The only reason they do not get five stars is their chutneys. The coconut and tomato chutneys they serve with their dosas are both not very good at all. If they changed their recipes for these dishes I would easily give this restaurant five stars.
author: Jen B.

description: looove Dosa.  we eat here a few times a year.  always a treat.  love their cocktails too.  delicious.
author: Venus H.

description:
First off, the interior of this place is gorgeous.  They have two cool feathery chandeliers hanging downstairs that creates a lovely modern atmosphere.  There is also beautiful artwork/photography of scenes from India.

As for the food, it was excellent!  We ordered the calamari appetizer.  I thought the squid was prepared perfectly.  It wasn't cooked too long so didn't have a rubbery texture at all.  It was also accompanied by a uttanapam (like a pancake thing) and a side of greens, which were great complements.

We ordered the chard and sweet peppers dosa as part of our entree.  The chard was slightly bitter, as expected, but not overwhelming so.  And the flavors balanced nicely with each other and the sauces.  The dosa also came with a side of soup that was SO wonderful.  Hearty and flavorful.  My friend said she actually prefers to order the dosa plain and just enjoy that soup with it, which I could see ordering next time.

For our entree we ordered the chicken korma.  I really liked it, but I also didn't notice anything super special about it.  Just basic, good dish.

Our servers were really wonderful.  They knew my one friend hated the taste of cilantro, so when we ordered lemon rice they brought her plain rice.  Also they were very friendly and just the right level of attentive without being overbearing.  Our only note is that at the beginning of the meal it took a long time for them to take our initial order, which felt even longer bc we were really hungry!

This place is pricier than "normal" Indian restaurants, but actually sharing food with my 2 friends we actually only paid $19 each and we were very full at the end of our meal!
author: Mia N.

description:
This is one of my fav south Indian restaurants in SF. Love the ambiance and the food. Their dahi vada is pretty good and so is summer monsoon beverage. 

I am not a fan of their sambar particularly, but otherwise their dosas are one of the bests I have had. My husband is really fond of their chilli uttapam but I have no idea how he survives the spice level of that thing!
author: Neha G.

description:
Had reservations yesterday for 5:45 on a Saturday and was told there was a parking garage next door. But when we got there it was full due to Cherry Blossom Festival so we spent 30 mins looking for parking. We ended up finding parking 13 mins walk in the rain from the restaurant. 

Got to Dosa 10 mins late but the friendly promptly seated us upstairs. It's a lot quieter upstairs because you don't have the hubbub of the bar downstairs going on. Our server Christi was patient and informative since we are newbies to Indian food. We notified her we had to be at Orpheum for a show so we needed to be done by 7:15. She said no problem and in the end that was a true statement. 

My friend ordered the Channa Bhatura which came w/some garbanzo stew which you dipped your doughy baked thing into. She liked it and it was pretty tasty and not too spicy. I ordered the Mushroom Uttapam which is like a dosa but thicker like pancake and came w/three dipping sauces. I don't recall the names of them but they were all good w/my preference being the sweeter one. I love mushrooms so I was a happy camper.  Serving sizes didn't leave me hungry so that's also a big plus. 

I took off one star only for the parking. I hate wasting time looking for parking...especially when I'm hungry. Wish there was more parking available close by. All in all a good experience and I'll be back to explore more of menu.
author: Les I.

description: Delicious food, great ambiance, and unique cocktails. The Brussels sprout appetizer was tantalizing for my taste buds. Four of us shared 4 different types of Dosas and it was plenty of food. We will be returning again.
author: Cari H.

description: It was SF restaurant week so Dosa was offering a 40 dollar prix fixe menu that appealed to me. I guess I wasn't the only one that felt like this because even with a reservation I did have to wait 5-10 minutes for a table. That was fine though since they had a bar, I treated myself to some mango lassi. It was good but I wish it was about 10 degrees cooler. Once we got our table we ordered off the prix fixe menu (3 apps/3 mains/2 deserts). The food was solid a little too much on the spicy side for but all in all it was a good meal and the prix fixe menu made a pretty good value. I'd definitely go back to try out more of the menu. I did like Rasa in Burlingame more though. Also the interior of Dosa looks really good.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
I used to live in London and I have had good Indian, Dosa is GOOD! I feel that the owners
have taken the time to create dishes that are the real deal. The chutneys were out of this 
world, the lamb shank with tamarind was so tender!!!! Our waiter took the time to explain
the tasting menu and other dishes, and I have to say he was a big help.The drinks at the
bar were fabulous. Everybody from the hostess to the bartender and servers made it all
sooo wonderful.This is a place that most items on the menu are all made with thought
and care. Thank you for all the hard work that is put into this restaurant, we will always
come back!!!!! I took home some left overs and had it for breakfast!!!
author: Mia A.

description:
We had been wanting to check out this place for years because of the hype. We made reservation and were a bit early so we sat at the bar. Drinks we're good but way too sweet for my taste. Beer selection could definitely need an upgrade as well. It was basic.

I got the dosa but was not impressed, I guess I should have gotten the curry instead. Some of the food items did not state spicy such as the duck tacos which were so spicy (and I LOVE spicy) we couldn't even finish them (sad panda!).

It was very expensive for curry (cheapest $19 which has no meat).
If I am ever craving Indian food sorry but I won't be back here.

Was very disappointed because I even brought my mom here hoping for a nice dinning experience but was definitely let down. Service was okay. They didn't bring the food all at once and left my mom waiting for 10 min with no food while we all had ours.

Next time we want Indian food I'm going to stick to my favorites (Shalimar and Pakwan).
author: Amber T.

description: One of the few upscale Indian restaurants in San Francisco. Very cool ambience and service. Love their cocktails here and food tastes good as well.
author: Rakesh G.

description:
Contemporary indian cuisine; these three words pretty much sum up the restaurant.

The high ceilings, open floor plan, modern design all make it a very fun & vibrant place for one to enjoy an indian cuisine.

Con; the food is pretty good but not outstandingly authentic to Indian cuisine. 

The drinks, not so creative, just your regular fancy restaurant type.

Overall though it's a cool place to enjoy indian cuisine.
author: Nauman B.

description:
Food is excellent. Wine list is good or better than good. I would give the menu 5 stars. 

But the night I tried to eat here the kitchen was very short staffed. Or so they told us. Long wait for food. Had to leave to get to the symphony.  Won't go back. For the prices I expect somewhat functional service. I think we were "overlooked" in part because we were neither hipsters nor Sand Hill types. I would give the service 1 star. The wait staff were nice once we got their attention. But it was overall a bad experience. 

If you're young attractive and rich this is probably a good restaurant when the kitchen isn't in chaos. I won't be returning as I don't expect I'd ever get good service.
author: Liz W.

description: I've been here a couple of times and I have my favorites - the Idli fry and Vada Pav. The Rava dosa had very less salt and the sambar doesn't really taste like the authentic South Indian one. Their mint chutney is good, same with their tomato chutney. It has a good ambience and would probably visit again. But not the best South Indian food in the bay!
author: Malavikka R.

description: My review here is for the bar only as we just stopped in for cocktails after having dinner elsewhere. The ambience at Dosa is upscale but chill and welcoming. The bartenders are very personable and friendly and after a short conversation about cocktails it is apparent they know their stuff. The cocktail menu has several speciality cocktails that are a fitting match to the theme of Dosa and are all quite nice and unique served in a decent portion size which has become rare in San Francisco. No half filled glasses here! Dosa was a great spot to hang and have a drink. I will deffo be back.
author: Steven B.

description:
We come regularly for drinks. But we learned that Dosa was offering a special Lunar New Year menu. Wow, what a concept!
We ordered their beet and cumin soup with creme fraische, cauliflower in curry, prawns Szechuan style, chow mein, and coconut rice for dinner. Then for dessert we had the tapioca with mango sorbet, and rasmalal cheese and pistachio in
Each item was delicious, but the sauce and condiments on the cauliflower and prawns  seemed identical. C
The desserts were beautiful and tasty, as shown. 
Service, sadly, was disappointing. We had to ask that the rice be served when an entree was served before the small plate, request the table to be wiped, to serve the tea (cup and saucer presented minus the tea), etc. At one point there were 4 serving staff but it took effort getting their attention.
The service issues were compensated by the lovely decor and not overly loud ambience. Overall, a lovely evening.
author: Liana T.

description:
Went in a large group...tried idli sambar,dahi wada,pali hill manha,bengali gimlet,mango is the new black drink,monsoon,idli fries,vada pav,rava masala dosa,south indian moons,squash kofta,madras cofee and for desserts:carmel ganache.

Their idlee fries,vada pav,cocktails and desserts are really good.Somehow their dosas are not great.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
A friend of mine made a reservation for a girls' night here and the ambiance definitely fit the bill! The decor and lighting make the place feel super upscale yet warm, somehow. Loved that!

Onto the food - be forewarned that if you have a palate that is SLIGHTLY sensitive to spice, most of the items we ordered had a low heat that built up over the course of the meal. I personally love spicy, but I had 2 friends who wished they'd been warned about the spice on the menu beforehand.

The menu was a bit overwhelming so we followed the recommendations of our waiter.

Would order again:
-- Prawn Masala: The thick, flavorful yummy sauce! The prawns! Everything about this dish was just so good. A decent-sized portion, too - it came with 5 large prawns (yes.....I counted...)
-- Chennai Chicken: I would describe this dish as flavorful chicken tenders served with a yogurt sauce and onions. Very shareable, good for a small group to split!
-- Masala Dosa: Of course you have to order a dosa when you come to DOSA! This was my first time trying one, and I loved the concept of various dipping sauces.

I was underwhelmed by the "South Indian Moons" (a sampler of uttapams) because they all kind of tasted the same. If I were to return, I'd stick with the dosas, appetizers, and entrees!
author: Stephanie C.

description: This is a good restaurant in need of a refresh. Looking a little sad inside, but still a popular spot on Fillmore. Once again enjoyed the duck appetizers, but was wisely wary about the accompanying curry sauce (very hot). Their food has not changed much since my last visit, served in plain bowls or platters without fuss. There was no evidence of food artistry or creativity in the preparation or presentation of these traditional Indian dishes.
author: Lynn S.

description: Had a bad experience, our server spilled my cocktail and broke the glass on the table, took them a while  to clean and pick up broken glass,once cleaned they forgot all about us, worse service I've ever had, would not recommend this place to anyone
author: Illa P.

description: Took forever to get a table even though there were a bunch open. After about 45 min finally got seated. Continued to wait for any server to come take our order and get even just water. Waitress/hostess was not very friendly at all. Food was delicious. Then she came and took plates without even asking if we were done. Took away a plate that was still being eaten! Guess it was near their afternoon closing time. Maybe if we were seated earlier, you would need to be pulling our half eaten plates from under our noses before we were done. Probably won't be coming back despite the Dosa being really delicious.
author: Doris C.

description:
Everything about DOSA on Fillmore is outstanding!!! The food is excellent, the staff was helpful and really knowledgeable of the menu. The restaurant is a little dark, I felt like I almost had to read the menu with my phone's flashlight, but it's really beautiful inside. 

We started with vada pav and the Channai chicken. I had the spicy basil Dosa as my entree and would definitely recommend it. My friend also mentioned that all of the drinks really capture the essence of the Indian fusion style of the restaurant so I tried the Forbidden City. Definitely worth ordering.
author: Ryan P.

description: Overall, Dosa on Fillmore was a very good experience. We made a reservation but weren't given a table on time because of an unfortunate problem, we were a little disappointed, but from that point onwards their customer service was amazing. They took our order asap, and made sure food was served within 5 mins after we got seated, they were sweet enough to offer us complimentary samosas for having waited. The principle that a customer is really important to them was commendable. Food was good. Overall I'll give them 4.5/5 for customer service and 4/5 for food.
author: Balaji S.

description:
Delicious drinks and tasty dosas! What more can you ask for?

My friend and I came here on a weekday to hang out at the bar & enjoy some munchies.  When I looked at the menu, I knew we came the right place.  They have a huge offering of dosas which I love to enjoy while drinking. Their dosas come out piping hot and really crispy, the way they're supposed to be! I especially love their chutney sampler with pampadam chips. 

Who knew there would be such a cool & delicious Indian spot in Japantown! Definitely coming back for more.. and more.
author: Wina K.

description: Showed up at the location for Thursday brunch and it was CLOSED. Very disappointed with the information on Yelp and on the phone service.
author: Puneet G.

description:
We were a party of three and we're waited on by Claudia who was snooty, unprofessional and forgot to put in our order and then blamed the computer... When our second round of drinks didn't show up we asked another waitress to check on it and apparently they were out of the scotch!! And nobody bothered to tell us... 
Some of the gems she dropped on us
When asked what Single malts were available...." I have a lot do u know which one u want?  With a healthy dose of attitude to bear... and we asked for a scotch menu she rolled her eyes comes back and then a curt 'what food and drinks do the rest of u want' ...I'll have the House Chardonnay and her reply was...'well that's not food but whatever'
Are u kidding me???..  Is there a statute of fucking  limitations on ordering drinks..?Service was slow...maitre d' looked lost...
You expect an experience when u go to Dosa...if it was just the taste, texture, flavor of food...there are better restaurant out therr
author: Kalyan K.

description:
I know a lot of Indians that rave about Dosa so I thought I'd give it a try.... I was very disappointed in their service. From the get go our waiter seemed very half-assed. He didn't seem like he enjoyed being there. I even asked him for recommendations on what to eat... I think he had no idea. He just listed what they had and left us to read the menu on our own. He did that twice. We asked him about drinks and when he came back..  he did that for food. Like "hey, read it yourself because I'm lazy and I know nothing".  

Once we got our meals we were rushed to leave. Our waiter asked us 3 times if we were finished in the last bites of our meal... In less than 15 minutes. We could barely enjoy the last bites in our meal! The other 2 waiters also rushed us out. I even told one of our busboys that we were still working on our lamb curry and he took it away, anyway! What the hell. 

In summary, we paid a lot for our meal and we get shit for service. No thank you!
author: Lyra C.

description:
Absolutely love love love this place. The drinks are superb,  so very unique n absolutely great! The food was great too.  We had :
Chutney sampler
Chennai Chicken 
Vada Pav (vegetarian slider) 
 
Everything was fantastic. Love the Vada Pav the most. And for dessert, we had Kulfir Popsicle. Just delicious. 

My favorite drink here is Steph Curry, just want to swim in it!  Must also have Peony. Another signature drink. 

Most of all, came back n would come again and again because of our charming and fantastic bartender, Mika!  He is the best of the best.  Thank u Mika, for making our meal reach perfection!!! 
See u again soon!
author: Mary J.

description: Not a great experience, unusual for this place. We have been here a few times in the past, but today was really bad. Entrees were spicier than we expected. Waitress described the dishes as mild, but they were super spicy. Lamb chops was the only good dish.
author: Nasir M.

description: Came for dinner. Has a great ambiance, some of the menu items are really authentic (as a south indian myself, I would be making it exactly that way at home too), great service.
author: Maggie J.

description: Some of the better Indian food I've eaten in the Bay area, although they could have a little more variety. The service is good, as is the ambiance. Definitely worth checking out.
author: Roma T.

description:
Indian food, in my humble opinion, is one of the most difficult foods to get right as it is. Therefore, whenever I find an Indian restaurant that experiments with innovative ideas and concepts, I am always intrigued because very few do it well.

To be honest, I was initially drawn to this place because of their happy hour menu, specifically the idli fries. Unfortunately, there was not enough time before our reservation to enjoy the happy hour menu so we instead ordered the fries at our table. They were amazing! We also sampled the cocktails which were very innovative. I would definitely come here just for the happy hour menu!

For the main dining experience, we all ordered the tasting menu that was featured for restaurant week with the wine pairing. Now, as any wine snob knows, pairing wine with Indian food is one of the biggest challenges in the world and few know how to do it properly. DOSA did know... The wines were not only amazing but they went REALLY well with the food. We got a mixture of items including kebabs, dosas, biryanis, fish, and chicken and they were all delicious.

Amber India is still my favorite Indian restaurant in the Bay Area but DOSA is definitely the biggest competitor for them now. Amazing dining experience!
author: Kunal N.

description: Accommodated us as walk ins on a busy night. Was with a work colleague and they were quick to take our orders and serve us. The fried idli appetizer and the beet dahi vadas were absolutely amazing. We ordered the paper masala dosa and the paneer dosa. Tons of food as we had to take some of the dinner entrees back for the next day. Nice ambience and friendly service.
author: Harsha P.

description: Terrible customer service . Our waitress took our appetizer order and never bothered to come back to inquire about entrees . I spotted her at a corner , failed to get her attention with my waving, and walked over to ask her to come to our table . Finally we were graced by her presence and she deigned to take our order . But They brought our madras filter coffees at the beginning of our meal . We asked them to bring it to us at the end of the meal . They never did . We were checked on a total of Zero times . No water refills . I have heard there is a drought , but when I am paying Michelin Star restaurant prices , for substandard , poorly conceived and executed Indian food , the least I can expect is some water to remove the bad after taste of this experience . Funny finale : I asked for our check and then mentioned that we never got our coffee . They just brought a check without the coffee and did not even bother to ask if we still wanted it . There are many hard working chefs and restaurants delivering interesting twists on Indian cuisine with much better service . This place is not one .
author: Prash B.

description: Panner Peas Dosa was really good. They cut in 4 pieces which makes it even easy to eat. Filling seems to be sufficient and fresh. Even the uttapam with same ingredient was also nice. We also ordered Rawa masala dosa which was also nice (not too oily). Vada pav was just ok, I have found it better in south bay. Overall a nice (although a little pricey) south indian restaurant.
author: Saumya A.

description:
My buddies wanted to get together for a guys night out and picked this place. Three of us decided to meet for dinner on a Tuesday night. Didn't realize there was an upscale Indian restaurant in Filmore district. I wouldn't say it's authentic rather an Indian fusion cuisine with  a bar and club like ambience without the dance floor.

Let me start with parking. The restaurant is in Lower Pacific Heights at the intersection of Filmore St and Post St. There's no dedicated parking for Dosa, so I had to go around the block a few times to find a parking 2 blocks away. Even on a Tuesday night the place was buzzing like it was a weekend. There's a full bar downstairs with a dining area, up the stairs there are few more tables. Very well decorated with tasteful lights and music. Downside, the tables are so close to each other that you can be sure your neighbor knows what you ordered.

We started with an appetizer of Kalamari. This is the first time I have ever had Kalamari in curry paste. The flavor was amazing, but Kalamari did lose a bit of its natural taste like any other fish/meat cooked in Indian curry. It is spicy, but the flavor iss enjoyable for anyone who likes Kalamari. From the name, you can imagine they specialize in Dosa, that is an extra large South Indian thin bread with stuffing. I ordered White Truffle Masala Dosa with Truffle Oil from Alba Italy that was stuffed with potatoes. It was served with 3 types of sauces. The bread was thin and nicely crisped but the stuffing was a bit strong. The flavor was spicy and yummy. We also ordered Hyderabadi Chicken Biriyani and Spicy Basil Prawn. The Biriyani had a decent flavor with a kick of spice, but the prawn did not satisfy the pallet. For drink, I ordered Ginger Ale and the server brought me a Blenheim Hot Ginger Ale bottle, one of the best I have ever had. It was complimenting the spicy food very well, so I ended up ordering 3 bottles during the course.

Overall the food was on the spicy side, but there's a great balance of spices, so it's not something you enjoy and regret later. Even though it was very busy, our server was prompt in bringing anything we requested. Had a great meal and a good time...looking forward to coming back in future.
author: Ash A.

description:
SF Restaurant Week, part 4: Discovery Menu at Dosa on Fillmore

At first, I wasn't interested in even looking at the discovery menus for Restaurant Week.  I knew I wanted to go to at least 4 restaurants this time, and the $85 put me off.  Well, I looked at the menu at Dosa on Fillmore.  My roommate and I looked at each other and then it became the "I'll go if you go" situation.  So we went!

We started with a sparkling wine to go with our appetizer.  I ordered the petrale sole porichadu.  The sole was fried to perfection and went well with the winter chutney, which I think was made from squash.  The side salad had hints of coconut and other spices.  It was a great way to start the dinner.

For the second course, I ordered the khageena dosa, which had scrambled eggs, ginger, ghee, and cilantro.  The dosa came with coconut chutney, tomato chutney, and lentil soup.  I really liked the lentil soup.  It was fragrant and spicy, and went well with the sweetness of the carrots and red bell peppers.  I wasn't a fan of the tomato chutney.  I preferred the coconut chutney with this dosa.  Which, by the way, was delicious.  Despite all the ingredients, like ginger and cilantro, it didn't overwhelm the flavor of the egg.  It was overall a balanced dish.  The wine that was paired with this was a chardonnay that was very fruit-driven and not buttery.  My roommate's white wine that went with her Winter Uttapam had no flavor.  I thought she was crazy at first, but I tried it.  And it really did have no flavor.  It was the weirdest tasting wine I've ever had.

I got the paneer and almond kofta for the third course.  The dish consisted of two veggie meatballs made up of parsnip, butternut squash, and potato buried in a curry sauce with coconut rice on the side.  The meatballs were drowning in the curry sauce.  I think it would've been better if it was just poured on top.  It seemed like a lot was wasted when I was finished.  The coconut rice was aromatic and softened the spiciness of the curry.  A red wine was paired with this dish.

And for dessert, I ordered the banana almond date cake, that was paired with a sherry dessert wine.  It was okay.  The cake itself didn't have a lot of flavor.  It relied on the banana and the spiced cashews for it.  But I think it was that way because it was paired with the sherry, which was very sweet and strong.  I actually preferred the kumquat fruit tart that my friend ordered.

Oh, and the waiter was very nice on giving us extra papadums.  They were delicious!!

Would I go back and pay full price?  Yes, but only for special occasions for dinner, or lunch.  The décor merits a fancier dress code, and the dinner prices reflect that.  There's a casual South Indian restaurant I go to in the Mission where you get more bang for your buck. But Dosa is definitely worth trying if you need to impress anyone.
author: Vira P.

description:
Let me first say that between the Fillmore and Valencia locations, I've visited Dosa at least 5 times. The food and the venue keeps me coming back. But last night I had my worst experience at the Fillmore location, so much so that I'll probably won't be returning for a while. I made a reservation for 2 at 9:15 pm on a Saturday night. It was really easy to get a reservation through yelp, and I specifically chose the Fillmore location because I know there are more seats available. We arrived maybe 10 minutes early, and were seated close to the time of our reservation, to be expected. 

Our table was on the second level, which initially seemed nice because it's a more intimate seating arrangement. There were about 7 other parties being serviced. We reviewed the menu that the hostess gave us for about 20 minutes before any other staff approached us. When we were finally offered drinks, we were already ready to order our entire meal. 

Our order was: 
Gin & Tonic
Ginger Ante cocktail
Spicy Basil Dosa
Chennai Chicken
Channa Bhatura


It was ordered to be all eaten together and shared family style. Within about 5 minutes of ordering, the Chennai Chicken was served to us which was very fast! We waited a few minutes before trying it, assuming that the rest of the food would be arriving soon. None of the other food came immediately after so we decided to just dig in. By this time, we weren't served any water, or papadum which is typically served as an appetizer. We decided to wait for the rest of the food, as the chicken was spicy and would have complimented our other dishes. Water was finally served maybe 10 minutes after the Chennai Chicken and our cocktails shortly after.

It took literally 45 - 50 minutes to get the next dish, Channa Bhatura. The server actually mentioned that it was confusing on which table the food was to be served. During that time, the waiter not once came to check on us! Not one time. We had finished our waters, and cocktails long before our second dish arrived. We even had to call the waiter over to ask when our food would be coming. The table next to us seemed to be experiencing similar service. At one point a waiter asked if they were finished, since they had been sitting there a while with empty plates. But it turned out they hadn't received one of their dishes as well!
