Another 5-10 minutes after our second dish was served, the table next to us finally got their last dish, along with our last dish! They told the server that the dosa dish was not theirs, and we had to flag him down before he left with our dish! To top it all off, our last dish "spicy" basil dosa was the least spicy of the 3. We discovered that it actually was the Potato Dosa dish, not even what we ordered. 

Huge fail of a dinner service. We were seated at 9:11pm and left close to 11pm. All the food was delicious, even the wrong dish, but the service and time management in the kitchen was just awful.
author: Lauren L.

description:
4.5 STARS

I don't eat Indian food as much as I want to.

Why?

1. Hot flashes.
2. Bubble guts.
3. Poopy poops.

Sadly, my body and muffin top just doesn't agree with the bold and fiery spices.

Knowing that we were going to Dosa, I came armored with my pink bff. You know how it is, the older you get, the more you become a walking CVS. Lactaid, tums, pepto, beano, aleve, benadryl, dramamine, emergen-c, etc. I even have preparation h. Puffy eyes, begone!

Having been to Dosa on Valencia, I already knew what to expect: trendy and full bar. Of course, the latter being the most important. This Dosa location is massive with two levels making it a perfect place for dates and/or large parties. 

I'm no South Indian food aficionado so I can't speak for the authenticity but I will say, I didn't have the sweats or skid marks during/after (like I usually do from the spices). Not to say, the food was bland because it wasn't, it was flavorful without assaulting the tastebuds with spices and heat. It's pricey though for Indian food (we spent $80 pp including one cocktail) but the quality is top-notch with service to match.

Do start dinner with one of their unique, Indian inspired cocktails. Kinda pricey at $13 a pop but where in the hell will you find a cocktail with housemade hibiscus masala necter, coconut milk and birds eye chile? Um, no where. The creamy Peony (gin based) cocktail was damn delicious and stiff: http://bit.ly/1BKakyU so I recommend this one. 

Our group of 8 decided to order several apps to share and then go with the 3-course tasting menu for $42 (yah we eat a lot). This definitely the way to go as the average price of entrees was $26. They don't skimp on the portions either; the girls left with doggybags. 

For our shared apps, we ordered the Bhatura ($5), a gigantic fried puffy wheat bread: http://bit.ly/1to5x2j and the White Truffle Masala Dosa ($13.50): http://bit.ly/1q12snB. Both are must trys! The Bhatura was crispy, soft, and airy; great for dipping with the chutneys. Not authentic by any means, the White Truffle Masala Dosa was filled with mash potatoes: http://bit.ly/1muFQqP and had a great earthy flavor.

For the tasting menu, I started with the Kale Pakora: http://bit.ly/XFmlGt which is kale dipped in a chickpea batter and then deep fried. It was a little too heavy for me so I shared it with our group.

For my second course, I choose the Lamb Keema Dosa: http://bit.ly/1l0NhKY. I really enjoyed this course; kinda like a deconstructed crepe. The paper thin dosa was super light and crunchy. Tear off a piece, top it with the ground lamb, and enjoy. The tomato chutney added heat while the green coconut chutney helped cool things down. 

Having had the Prawn Masala at their Valencia location, I knew this was going to be my third course. It was as delicious as I remembered it. The four large prawns were meaty and sweet. Loved the delightfully creamy masala sauce that was robust and spicy but not overly so. They made for great leftovers since the spices developed more overnight. 

The Indian fusion desserts looked too enticing to pass up so we ordered the White Chocolate & Turmeric Pot de Crème ($9): http://bit.ly/1l0QiLo and the Fresh Coconut Custard Cake w/ infused curry leaves & coconut cookie ($8): http://bit.ly/1tsqJ6o to share. I can't comment on the pot de crème since someone hoarded the entire thing to himself. Hmmph. The coconut custard cake had a flan like texture. It had good coconut flavor but I wish the bottom crust was crunchier. 

Service was phenomenal (so rounding up my rating). Our super sweet waitress, Ilem and the busboys rocked! Usually with large parties, service sucks donkey balls. However, not at Dosa. They were very attentive, quickly cleared out empty plates, kept our water glasses filled, and food came out very timely. When it came to packing our leftovers, they put the rice, masala and raita in different containers. The ocd in me thanks you!

As I mentioned earlier, Dosa is a very trendy place. The upscale décor is stunning and the amber and red color scheme is inviting. If you want to impress a girl (or guy) with something l-o-n-g, this is THE place to bring her. I'm talking about the dosa here, you pervs! ;)
author: Cherylynn N.

description: It has awesome interiors and great service too. Menu has limited choices and food is average and overpriced​. Value for money is missing.
author: Abinash S.

description:
Wao is the word I had when I took first bite of my dosa here. Not only their ambiance is awesome but their food is just beyond good. I have visited here several times but my recent visit during SF restaurant week forced me to write a review. I tried their restaurant week menu which was fantabulous.
The beet croquette in the appetizer was very good( any non beet lover will also love it) so was the madras chicken fries.
The paneer dosa is the evergreen best dish here. It never disappoints. Took chicken vindaloo for the main course which was also good but I recommend trying dosa's  more than anything here.
For dessert got Rasmalai, omg it's one of the best Rasmalai I ever had, hint of rose flavor in it was making it really yummy.
author: Mimansha B.

description: Excellent quality cuisine - we enjoyed the Masala Dosa very much - we don't get the opportunity to enjoy southern Indian food often - this was a pleasure.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Nice decor, good ambience. Dosas are very tasty, but served a bit cold. Sambhar excellent. 
Lamb Frankie - amazing flavor and super-tender. Salad served on the side was wilted :-(. One expects more from a place like this. Still, it was ok and could be re-visited.
author: s n.

description: Was amazing! Went here for a work trip dinner and everyone was incredibly impressed. Great atmosphere, amazing waitstaff and exceptional food.
author: Emily C.

description:
Food was great but very pricey,
Beers are outrageously expensive,
Service was horrendous.
6% Healthy SF Mandate, they are surely making a profit on this charge.
Most restaurants only charge 2-4%
author: Peter H.

description: Dinner before a concert at the Fillmore?  This place is perfect!  We came here and experienced excellent service and great food!  We are vegan and gluten-free the menu is marked with options both options here (and more options).  In addition, our server made recommendations which he requested kitchen modifications to make vegan for us (including dessert!).  We cannot wait to return here!
author: DeliaDana Z.

description:
Pros
Holy Flavortopia!
Gorgeous ambiance (great date spot) 
Recommend: Kale Pakora, Masala, any of the Uttapam! Gin and Tonic was amazing, Peony was good but really sweet

Cons
Expensive but well worth it

Overall Thoughts

Wow, just wow....
author: Eddie W.

description: The stars are for the decor ambience and service. The food.....not so much. Our expectations were high considering the hype surrounding this place. Everything was way too spicy. The sambar rasam and the chutney were way too Spicy. I've had better dosas at sarvana bhavan. The masala chai was pre-sweetened and felt like made from a premix. The madras coffee was like warm. And everyone on our table bet that the Ras malai was from Haldirams! I don't think I'm going back. The bar is extensive and well stocked.
author: Ashish G.

description: A bit on the pricier side, Dosa is a dosa lovers' delight. But to me, their Pani Puris are heavenly. With the jal jeera served in shot glasses and crispy melt-in-your-mouth Puris, I savored each and every bit of it with relish. The restaurant is packed on weekends and you might have to wait to get seating and it also takes a while to be served. So if you're someone who is in a hurry on a weekend, you might want to go someplace else. Coming to their Dosas, I had their Spicy Basil Masala Dosa and boy it was spicy - just the way I like it. I specially loved the spread of basil sauce on the dosa which set my tongue rolling with the spiciness which I had been craving for long. Will go back just for their Pani Puri and Dosa!
author: Anjana U.

description:
We shared some great dosa, curry and uttapam at the restaurant. The atmosphere was nice, new, modern. The three of us sat at a high table as there were no regular tables available.
South Indian moons uttapam was a good choice to try all the 5 types of uttapam.
author: Kat G.

description: Quality ingredients, perfectly seasoned, well executed, innovative food. Plus the ambiance is fantastic. Love this place!
author: Jöne P.

description:
I have been quite regular at dosa and I LOVE the food here. I went to dosa Friday night and thought of visiting again since I had a friend in town craving some Indian food. 

We got seated on our table and got our menus and then for about 10 minutes our server didn't even stop by to see if we had questions on the menu. The server seemed new since I am quite regular here and I hadn't seen him before. 

Then he came to get our table to get our order and I ordered 4 items. He didn't note anything down and just went away. 

I ordered: 
- Idli Sambar: Good idli, good sambar. Overall solid dish. 9/10
- Rava Masala: Very crispy. Perfect texture. 9/10
- Chole Bhature: This was the weakest dish. The chole lacked flavor, lack of salt and was slightly sweet. Meh. 2/10 
- Paneer and peas uttapam: We waited for this for about 15 minutes and it never showed up. When I told the waiter that we've been waiting for a while and we still haven't finished it, he repeated saying "oh paneer and peas dosa"? I'm pretty sure at this point he hasn't put in an order for it, so I asked him to just cancel it since we didn't want to wait more. He just walks away and doesn't even apologize. 

Then he just comes back with the check and asks us if we want desert after he has put the check on the table. We ordered the Rasmalai which is my fave and was good as always and the chai too. 

He comes back with the updated check. No asking if we are ready for the check, no checking in on how the food is. 

3 stars only for the food and because I have been here in the past and sat at the bar and had a great experience. 

This was my second time at a table at Dosa fillmore with a bad service experience. However, the last time the manager noticed it and fixed the situation for us. She was great! I was hoping I'd get a chance to see her today and give her my feedback in person. 

Dosa I love you. Please fix your table service. I'll be back, but only for bar service next time. 
The bartenders are awesome, friendly and wayyy more attentive than their table staff.
author: Priyanka P.

description: I liked the drinks but the food was only OK but worse yet overpriced. I liked the environment OK. It just seemed overpriced and overrated. I am glad I only went in for a sample to test things out before going all in. I know now better to keep looking. Nothing wrong with this place just nothing great either.
author: Bill B.

description: I've been meaning to try this place for a long time. The fact that it has a star made me want to try it more. The place is pretty nice, slightly dated decor. The service was not great at all, which was a shame. The food however was excellent, and the price was reasonable as well. I'm not sure I'd come back with the service issues and lack of attentiveness.
author: Jonah K.

description: We come here about once a year when visiting SF.  Amazing every single time.  The paper thin DOSA is phenomenal
author: sarkis v.

description:
5 stars all around. They fell low on my list because I felt that service over my last 2 visits was lacking but they've really picked things back up. We went about a week ago with 3 other friends and ordered their chennai chicken which was perfectly fried and flavored. We also did their fish entree and their prawn entree, both of which were great. 

Their drinks are always good so I like going there for drinks even if I'm not eating as I live not too far away from them.  Go, if you already haven't. It's worth it.
author: Sean K.

description:
I LOVE LOVE this place!!!! First of all, I never make a reservation bc the best spot in the house is at the left corner of the bar. I've been here twice and it's completely worth it. The food is AMAZING and the people who run this restaurant are kind, funny, and just a pleasure to be around. 

I always order the samosas. Trust me. They are so yummy and crunch with the sweet sauce and then this chutney sauce. It's my absolute favorite dish on the whole menu. Comes in four, and is perfect to share with another person. 

Also delicious is the mango lassi. I've never tried mango lassi until this place. It's almost like a smoothie, but with a yogurt consistency to it. I would get the sweet one. It's divine!!!

The lamb dosa and chicken curry were also really savory. My weak tastebuds thought they were too spicy, but if you're a normal Asian person, you'll be able to handle it. A dosa is like a flat crepe that isn't sweet. Just look at all the pictures. You dip it in a bunch of sauces and meats. Yummmmm.

If you still have room for dessert, try the pistachio cake with chocolate, pistachio, and coconut. It's a tiny piece, but really the right amount to end a really satisfying meal.

My favorite bartenders are Bret and Jesse (the guy who Seth Rogen looks likes). Even though it's crazy busy at the bar, they always manage to talk to us. I ask them for the best places to visit in SF for food and they're always more than happy to share. Rocky, the floor manager I believe, makes really pretty drinks. There are a lot of non alcoholic drinks, and he he uses spices, herbs, and flowers to decorate them. He regaled us with how he likes to run 12 miles a day, but won't walk anywhere. Annie, a server who is a Harry Potter fan like me, is really sweet. Lastly, there is a new chef from New York, I believe his name is Aroun. Everyone was still getting to know him, so I might have gotten it wrong. He's the one who specially made the samosas for me. You're so awesome!!! Got to chat a bit with him about how NY was so different from SF. He thinks it so relaxing in SF........I need to go to NY. =)

Thank you for making every experience at DOSA a fun and tasty one! I'll be back in that corner soon!
author: Vivian X.

description:
One of the best dining experiences I've had! Took advantage of the $40 Restaurant Week deal. 3 starters, 3 dosas or curries, and 2 deserts. The flavors were superb and the service was good. Ambiance feels a bit upscale yet still causal. Serving sizes are on the small side but the taste of everything I tried made up for it all. I will definitely be back. Here's what we ordered:
Starters-
Beet Croquettes 
Chennai Chicken 
Lemon Chile Scallops 
Dosas-
Lamb Keema Dosa
Mixed Mushroom & Truffle Oil Uttapam
Goan Prawn Masala w/Rice 
Deserts-
Rasmalai
Pistachio Barfi
I wasn't a fan of the deserts much but that's mostly because I don't have much of a sweet tooth. My sister did enjoy them though! 
I'd eat everything again. Can't wait to try more of their menu.
author: Claudia M.

description: I don't like the sambar they gave with the paneer dosa. And the dahi vada too bad with all its masala. The paneer dosa did not taste awesome either as the waitress said but it was costly for what it worth.
author: Jennani J.

description:
Jesus, the prices keep rising here and I've noticed the quality has gone down. Their gin and tonic is one of my favorites since the first one I had with good ice cubes some years back. AT $12 I thought it was pricey. Now, the choppy ice they use isn't as good, and it's $14, plus $1 for tax and $1.5 for tip. That's $16.50 for one gin and tonic! It would take some 200,000 million people in India who make $2 per day one damn week hard labor to pay for this luxury-- and you need two to get any kind of worthy buzz. For God's sake! The papadum was soggy stale last time I was there paying $16.50 per drink-- but it was "free" I can't really complain. And I've noticed some of the apps like the squid just don't taste as good anymore. The dosa are still great, especially the truffle. But as this type of food costs a buck or two in India, I'm becoming increasingly adverse to this place. Sure I'll get talked into going again, but with regrets.
My advice here: stick solely with the apps and dosa, and get your drink on before.
author: Brian J.

description:
Sigh. It breaks my heart to have to lower my review of this place because this was my favorite place to go for special occasions, but it's sadly gone downhill. Food was still high quality, but the service wasn't anywhere near what it used to be, they changed their menu to be much smaller, and alas, the overall magic is gone. 

We were sat in a cramped table for 2 squished in between 2 other parties, took us 35 mins to get a drink, and the server charged us on the bill for something that we ordered but they never brought. 

Still has gluten free options, but I stupidly trusted the menu and didn't tell them I had celiac, and got severely glutened. 3 stars for the high quality food, minus 2 for the rest. :(
author: Lindsay W.

description: Items on the menu - the best!  Taste of those items - superlative!  We enjoyed a wonderful meal at this restaurant on Fillmore, just the right portions and you leave the place with such a good feeling!  However, please wash those windows (on a regular basis as also the floors)  and put something on those chairs so, the person/diner seated does not slide!!  I moved 6" when the server bumped into my chair!!!
author: Chitra J.

description:
Its unfortunate that I had this experience in one of my most recommended places. Another great restaurant bites dust, Dosas just remains as a hyped up place which was once good but today just stands up as a over hyped and over priced restaurant which just missed the bus.

We waited for 15minutes to be seated while we saw many tables empty. The reason being that many tables were reserved. When we were allocated a table, I was asked if 1hour is enough for me since they have a reservation for that table in an hour. !! 

The server forgot the sequence of our order. The orders in itself took way too much time to make.When we were done, it took 15 minutes for the server to get the bill meanwhile the kids got impatient and I wanted to leave soon, but the front desk informed us they cannot bill us the server has to bill us in a separate terminal, the front desk refused to help, the servers were too busy serving tables than to bill us and let us leave! 

They have way too many tables , too less servers. At the end of the day, it is not the way I want to be served when I am paying 70$(+10% tax+ $4 service fee +tips) for 3 dosas and a starter !!
author: Amby N.

description:
I came here with some friends a while back and I have to say the place some pretty approachable Indian Food (this is coming from someone who rarely eats it) or could stomach it for that matter (very similar to Cherylynn).

These items were what I tried:
Happy Hour Chutney Sampler (https://www.instagram.com/p/BAdsJThnh6X/?taken-by=foodoofus)

Taco "Frankie": (https://www.instagram.com/p/BAds5afnh7e/?taken-by=foodoofus)

The Chutney sampler was my favorite. The sauces were all equally appetizing (the best one was the mint in my eyes, refreshing with a hint of coriander kick). You can argue, this is the equivalent of splurging on salsa chips at a taqueria spot.

The Taco franking was also full of spicy flavors but I couldn't shake off the coriander and tumeric notes. 

Overall, the ambiance and the food, I would give this a 3.5 but rounded down to a 3 because it's not my jam.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Great venue! We went for primarily vegetarian dishes and everything was delicious. Slightly on the spicy side but in a good way. 

The sliders were surprisingly tasty and full of flavors. Especially, considering the fact that the patty is primarily made of rice. Who knew rice could get my blood moving!

Thank you Dan for setting up our large group!
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Dosa is not just a restaurant but a culinary experience. I've eaten Indian food many times before but this was undoubtedly the best I'd ever had.
My husband and I stopped for lunch, this was a great time to go since it wasn't uncomfortably packed with people and prices are lower for their lunch menu.
Our waiter was very attentive and helpful. We asked his advice for choosing from the menu and he suggested 3 wonderful dishes. I imagine he could have steered us to any 3 on the menu and the result would have been the same, memorable and delicious.
There were plenty of Indian patrons in the restaurant which is always a great sign of how authentic and good the food is.
I would highly recommend coming here. Although a bit more pricey at night, I can only imagine how special and memorable an evening here would be. Between the incredible food, great service and beautiful interior it would definitely be a memorable experience.
author: Leigh C.

description:
A gf and I stopped by in June of last year for Dine about town (DAT) but ended up ordering everything a la carte. I wanted to try a bunch of things so we decided maybe a la carte was the better choice. I love the standard chicken tikka masala, but I'm not very versed in Indian cuisine. We discussed various dishes with our server and ended up ordering the following:

-Chennai chicken ($11) - Yum! Crispy, moist and tender! 
-Dahi vada ($10) - I wasn't sure what to expect from this, but it was a nice contrast to heavier and spicier dishes. Cool and refreshing. 
-Lamb kofta ($15) - I love lamb! And in meatball form?! How could I say no!
-Duck vindaloo with side of Lemon rice ($24) - I love duck! But since it's a fatty bird, I found the sauce a little too oily. The lemon rice went great with it though! 
-Uttapam: Mixed chile ($11) - So I ordered a dosa but ended up with a uttapam. If I had realized this at the restaurant, I probably would have said something. But I didn't find out until I got home. I did enjoy this though! Nice and spicy! 

Given that this restaurant is called Dosa, I really wanted to try a dosa! But since I'm not super familiar with Indian food, I didn't know what we got wasn't what I ordered. I still enjoyed the dishes regardless. This just means the gotta come back for their namesake dish!
author: Elena N.

description: Overrated and pricey. I have consumed a lot of Indian food over my lifetime including South Indian food.
author: Bob M.

description:
We ordered the chutney sampler, paper dosa, spicy mung masala dosa, salty lassi, and achaar.

Chutney sampler came with (oily) pappadum and 4 different kinds of Americanized chutney. Paper dosa was also very greasy. Spicy mung masala dosa was not bad, but also very greasy. Achaar was inedible. Overall, decent dosas but unfortunately grossly overpriced.
author: Jia Jun C.

description: I love DOSA. Definitely one of the best Southern Indian food to eat at. It has a huge space and an upstairs too. They are known for their dosa's and their drinks. Also great wine selection too. Anything you order, you won't go wrong. Everything I've tasted = DELICIOUS. The service is great too. I would recommend doing family style so you are able to try different dishes.
author: Jenn L.

description: Great Indian food in a hip chic atmosphere. Excellent service. Great ambiance. Now on my San Francisco favorites list.
author: Mickey C.

description:
I've tried out Dosa in the Mission so I knew kinda what I was getting into when I went into the Indian restaurant.

I only ended up eating here because the Ramen Festival was horrible and this place wasn't too busy when I went yet and I was able to get a seat at the bar to eat my lunch.

I picked Mini Masala Dosa w/ side of Soup $14.  I got some FREE papadam chips - I liked them fine.  Soup was a served hot & was spicy - I liked it.  Mini masala dosa was fine too.

They have that SF Employee Mandatory Healthcare fee.  Before tip my bill was $15.83.

Charged it.
author: Ann L.

description:
Amazing Indian food! 

I would recommend the channa battura it's perfectly fried not soggy and masala channa is so good.  (If you like your food spicy defiantly say that mine lacked spice!) 

I would also recommend the peas and paneer dosa. It was such unique flavors to eat in a dosa but it went together so well. Their sambar also was really good. However it did lack a bit of spice
author: Jasmin W.

description: The first South Indian restaurant I tried out in San Francisco. Came here with my father in August 2017, and we loved the ambience and the great food. Definitely a great restaurant to experience.
author: Vishnu S.

description: Their burgers were really delicious, we tried different varieties of dosa and all turned out to be great
author: Shruti C.

description: Went there with a party of six with reservations. We got there 15 minutes early and they were able to seat us right away. Once seated, the food was amazing! There was not one single bad thing that we had.
author: Maia G.

description:
It is a good place with a good ambience and good food. The 'Sambar' by which I typically judge a South Indian restaurant was really good. It had the flavor of the 'Sambar' typically made in the Nilgiris district in Tamilnadu, India. The texture was a little too thick but the taste was good.
The rest of the food was good but nothing to write about. 
Overall, it is a good experience as long as you are going for the good ambience with good food!
author: A C.

description: Best Indian food in San Francisco. My favorite place and will definitely visit again for the amazing food. I wouldn't mind flying to San Francisco just to have food here.
author: Suman F.

description:
I used to be a big fan to this place. But last night we ordered Chicken Korma and it stinks :( Additionally, all the person who eat this got diarrhea the whole night :(  It looks like food poisoning. 

Pretty bad service
author: Harish D.

description: I don't even LIKE dosas, but I came here and I LOVED IT!!  First off, any Indian restaurant that has dope cocktails is already a favorite... but this place just exudes class and is totally on trend.  It would be a great place for dinner and drinks with a group of girlfriends.  I came for lunch and it was easy to find parking on the street nearby.  We were seated promptly and had great service throughout.  For food, we actually were given the brunch menu.  We shared the Chennai chicken and a chicken frankie (split 4 ways) for the table.  The chicken was good but spicy, and the frankie was on point.  For an entree, I had the Roasted Chile and Garlic Dosa.  The stuffing isn't overwhelming and the accompanied chutneys and sambar were delicious.  The serving size is appropriate without being too much for each person.  The drinks are amazing!  I had the Ginger Ante, and I loved it!  It was a perfect addition to my garlicky dosa!  Would be back here in an instant!
author: Reena P.

description: We has dahi vada and the dahi vada was nowhere close to standard. The vada was too hard and there was too much salt in the yoghurt. The ambience and the other food we ordered was good, but the dahi vada just doesn't fit in.
author: Siddharth Y.

description: Great place for Dinner for two or groups! The food was amazing with great drink paring! Would definitely come back for seconds!
author: ski b.

description: Admittedly, it's possible that I may have a rather unsophisticated palate when it comes to Indian cuisine. Then again, maybe the DOSA menu is just too carb-heavy for my liking. Generally, spicy food is what floats my boat, and DOSA does not disappoint when it comes to spice.  I think DOSA may be especially preferable to those whose proclivities are for South Indian cuisine over North Indian.  This past weekend we had the lamb keema dosa, the cauliflower rice, and the dungeness crab appetizer (e.g. crab in mini puffy-bread balls).  The crab appetizer was a favorite at our table. DOSA excels with crab, as it is amazingly fresh and from right off our very own Pacific coast. That said, whenever I've dined at either of their two restaurants, I've  always left with a craving for salad. The menu is just too carb loaded and lacking in vegetables and greens. To be fair, I've given DOSA the ole college try-- having dined twice at the Valencia location and twice at the Fillmore location.  After trying various Indian restaurants throughout the Bay Area, I realize now that I prefer more  traditional Northern Indian food than Southern Indian food.  In short, I'm more an Amber India gal, than a DOSA gal. Also, we've experienced weird seating allocation situations at the Fillmore St. locale. On my first visit, we were a party of 10 and the bill was $900.00. That's to be expected in this town...but the real shocker came when management asked us to hurry up because they really 'needed' to flip our table to the next party. That was a rude ending to the party.
author: Baby J.

description: Great food as always...just a minor "glitch" with credit cards but to her credit the server corrected the problem. One thing that we didn't like was the loud music: just tarnished the dining experience. Also, a dish we ordered was unavailable [the Smoked Artic Char] so shrimp was substituted.
author: Kenneth L.

description: I called half hour back and checked for walk-in for party of 5... they said we can wait for the communal table and they said they don't take reservations for communal table... when I reached there they said they can't seat my party as they have reservations for communal table as well... not only that, the person in the front desk was damn rude... she treated us like shit!!! We have been coming to Dosas at Fillmore for years.. but this is the worst service ever...if the manager is reading this review, the person who treated us like crap was wearing a cognac leather jacket...
author: Ram S.

description: Although a tad on the pricey side, the food was very good.  I had a choke bhatura which was so big and really good.  My parents had a masala dosa and they approved the authenticity of the chutney and sambar.  Had a great family time!
author: Sej D.

description:
Dosa on Fillmore is a very good restaurant if you are not experienced in South Indian food (or Indian food in general). Ingredients are fresh and tasty, ambience is nice, drinks are good. Service is spotty but not horrible, especially given how busy they are. But what makes a restaurant a good restaurant is at the end food and unfortunately what this restaurant does not deliver is... good South Indian food.

If I was someone who has never had South Indian food, I'd probably rate this restaurant higher, but as someone who knows this food, who knows good dosa, I was utterly disappointed. None of the dosa we ordered had proper spices, sambar tasted more like tomato paste than anything else, chutneys were all too mild and flavourless except the mint-coriander one. 

Considering how expensive the place is and the wait you'll have to get through, I'd say it's not worth it. Sure, it looks good but looks is most of what it has.
author: Bengisu K.

description:
Masala dosa was decent, but could tell it had been sitting out for a while.
Portion size for south indian moons was disappointingly small.
A bit too noisy for my taste.
author: Vivek N.

description: Lamb dosa and egg dosa are on point. Nice selection of alcohol.
author: Rajiv S.

description:
Honestly! Found this place just average! Went there twice on invitation but yeah...may not go on my own. 
I'll begin with what I liked. The Chennai Chicken and Idli Fries are awesome! Both come with interesting dipping sauces. But you can't fill you tummy on appetizers right?! 
The main course is where I was kinda disappointed. The lamb Keema dosa was average. The dosa that came with the keema was almost cold. The egg curry for brunch was average. Didn't enjoy the flavors. The Chicken Dum Korma is almost like Egg Curry with a better flavor but Gosh was it spicy as hell!! I was hiccuping at the first bite. The Chicken was good, the rice not so good. Plus a huge portion! No prizes for guessing I gave up midway! 
Nah I'm not going again!
author: Meet G.

description:
There was a cockroach roaming around my table. The concierge saw it and didnt do anything about it. 
Food was below average. Dosa batter was sour.
author: Aparna S.

description:
Food was excellent. I would recommend trying paneer and peas dosa, Vada paav. Better to make a reservation as it gets very busy specially on the weekends. Our waitress was very nice and pleasant.

I would have given it a 5 star rating but gave 4 because of 2 reasons
1) Restroom was not clean. Sink and the floor needs to be cleaned more frequently.
2) Our salad order was forgotten and then it was sent after the main course.
author: Akshat N.

description: Great food. Amazing ambience and decoration. Always busy - so get a reservation or be prepared to wait!
author: Nitesh D.

description:
Delicious food, really nice atmosphere, friendly and knowledgeable staff. 

Upstairs seating is really nice and intimate
Ask for help ordering if unsure, some dishes can be very redundant
Food is made to be shared!

Loved the lamb sliders and the dal. Dosas were good and felt we could have skipped uttapam. 

Overall really nice dining experience.
author: Sarah G.

description: Among the 3 best Indian meals I've had in the US, arguably at the top. Recommendations: Idli Sambar, Masala Dosa, Masala Tea
author: Archit K.

description:
We heard amazing stuff about this restaurant  and decided to check it out. 

Tried the tasting menus. 
Picked:
Chicken samosa :-)
Lamb slider :-) 

Paneer peas Dosa :-|
Some uttapam :-|
Chicken curry rice :-|

Green prawn curry something :-( 

It could be because, I live in the west bay very close to a lot of authentic Indian restaurants and hence I had high expectations. They took pride in introducing themselves as 'Tamil Nadu authentic recipes and chefs' but PLEASE!? The food was so Americanized, is all I can say! 

Decor was definitely great, for an Indian restaurant. Parking was a pain until we found a Japanese mall parking lot across the road.
author: Sowmya S.

description: Great ambience. A great Indian upscale place in FiDi San Francisco. The seekh kabab and dosas were delicious! The desserts on offer were simply brilliant!
author: Tanushree C.

description: Must try vada Pav and Dahi vada . The cocktails have a Indian touch with ingredients like cardamom. Great ambience. Highly recommend it to anyone who love good food .
author: Vrutti V.

description:
An upscale South Indian restaurant best describes Dosa on Fillmore (and probably Dosa on Valencia).  I've eating my fair share of South Indian cuisines in San Jose and Brick Lane London so I can say I'm somewhat familiar with the spices and tastes of said cuisines.  Now, most South indian dishes are vegetarian and full of carbs so prepare yourself before you eat.  For example, masala dosa is one of the popular dishes which consists of a somewhat paper thin crepe rolled up with lentils inside the middle.  The lentils would qualify as protein since it has some amounts of it.  Samosas are basically smaller rolled up dosas with a lot of filling inside.  Well, I would describe them as hot pockets.

Besides dosas, there's uttapam which is basically the same batter as the dosas but in pancake form.  I ordered the mixed mushroom and truffle oil uttapam and the South Indian moons where the chef chooses five mini ones to make.  I was a little disappointed where one of the five was the mixed mushroom and truffle oil uttapam.  Either the chef should have changed it up or the waitress should have warned me before I ordered it.

If you're looking for non-vegetarian and possibly less carbs, try the Hyderabadi Chicken Biryani.  It can best be described as chicken fried rice but with a lot more spices.  I thought the chicken was pretty good where it was moist and the spices drew out the flavor in the chicken.  Have a sweet mango lassi to wash it down.  Lassi are basically yogurt drinks and they come in Mango, Sweet, or Salty.  Stick with mango unless you really like yogurt but in a drinkable form.

- South Indian Moons (5 uttapams chef's selection)
- Masala Dosa
- Veggie Samosas
- Hyderabadi Chicken Biryani
- Mixed mushroom and truffle oil uttapam
- Sweet Mango Lassi
author: Ronald L.

description:
198. Came here for a friend's birthday.  Probably the classiest Indian restaurant I've been to.

If you come here without trying the dosas, you're doing it wrong.  This was my first dosa experience, and I'm not gonna lie, the dosa was much bigger and longer than I had thought.  My order came with some lamb and ended up having enough for a second meal.  Mmm.  Not the most authentic, but if you're a first timer, this place would be a good intro.

There is also another location in the Mission, but that place is much, much smaller.  Come here instead for a shorter wait.

__________
My 2¢:
- First timers: Get a dosa, obvs.
author: Katherine C.

description: So overpriced.  Yes, good food and great neighborhood.  But still.  Unless you are a high powered tech exec, don't go here or you will break the budget.  The prices match the neighborhood which includes some of the most expensive real estate in the country.
author: Mod B.

description: I went to Dosa on Dec 31, 2017. They have special menu for new year @$90 / person. But it was not worth it. Appetizer was okay but mai n course was horrible. Biryani has lot of salt and spices. Pakora has lot of salt. Dosa, 4th course, was worst dish which should be the best. I paid $246 for 2 person which was totally waste.
author: Ashish K.

description: Yummy food. Great service. They even were handing out a delicious sample that I would have never ordered but ate and found out that I love it! Lots of drink options and specialties as well.
author: Karen B.

description: My first time here and I loved it so much that I'm writing a review. The food was amazing; the waiter was fun and helpful; overall it was a great experience. We were seated quickly and given a basket of yummy papadum, which we later discovered that they refill for free! I came here with my sister and we shared an appetizer, a side, and a dosa which left us surprisingly pretty full. We ordered the Sprouted Mung & Paneer Salad first. It was delicious! The sweetness of the cherries complemented the slight spiciness of the salad. For the main course, we ordered the Spicy Basil Dosa and a side of Vada. The dosa and side each came with a bowl of sambar. The dosa was crispy and still quite warm and the masala inside was fluffy and perfectly spiced. The chutneys perfectly paired the dosa. The vada was a bit plain by itself, but eaten with the sambar was tasty without being overpowering. Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend to anyone!
author: Charlotte I.

description:
I don't know if it was an "off night" or if it's always like this. We had a reservation at 8:30 p.m. but we weren't seated until 9 p.m. The staff at the entrance was very friendly though and did apologize for the wait.

The restaurant is beautiful. Loved the decor. The menu is so long, it is difficult to pick!

I had heard such great feedback on Dosa but I guess I picked the wrong dish. 
I ordered the assortment of 5 uttapams "South Indian Moons". 

Even if it was described as "pancakes", I didn't expect to have actual pancakes in my plate. I didn't know this dish even existed and I expected more veggies on them, more flavor... I tasted only the pancake for each variety.

I had a bathura on the side, thinking it would be like a thick naan. Wrong again, it was another (bigger) pancake!! LOL!

My husband had a dosa, which was huuuuge. He liked it!

For dessert, I had the indian gelato with cashews. Two scoops are served, it was pretty good.

The wine options are quite expensive, no white wine bottle under 40$!
We had one of the cheapest ones there and it was quite good, though.

Our server was not super friendly but he was attentive to when our glasses were running low.

I would rate my experience 3,5 stars, overall.

I'd love to come back and have the Vegetarian Thali (only available on weekends at lunch) and try other dishes (without pancakes this time!!).
author: Leslie S.

description:
Been here for third time.
Such a lovely place.
Food tastes Amazing.
Chennai Chicken and Fried Idly are very good for Appetizers. 
I tried Lamb Chops, Chole Batura, masala Dosa and Chefs recommended Set Dosas.
Last but not least Yogurt Rice.
Every piece of food tasted amazing.
author: Siva Sankar G.

description:
I'm not too familiar with Indian food at all. I'm not opposed to it (even after an ill fated try years ago), I just haven't sought it out. But with the crew heading here, I was happy to give it a try again.

I love a good tasting menu, so I was happy to see one. Especially being unfamiliar with the food, it was nice to try a bit of everything. I ordered the chicories and Asian pear salad, the sweet potato dosa and the hyderabadi lamb. 

The salad was okay, but not mind blowing. Although I could have eaten a whole bowl of the fried goat cheese balls they had in it! The sweet potatoes dosa was good. I know that this dish is supposed to be a lot of dough and a little bit of the main "stuffing" but I wanted a little bit more potatoes! 

The lamb was awesome though! It was probably the right amount for a main dish, but it was so good I wanted more! And it came in this dish with a bunch of thick sauce. It just made me want more lamb! It was also so tender. I just love lamb, and they did this right!

A fresh modern atmosphere and great service made it a fantastic evening to catch up with coworkers!
author: Rachel C.

description: Thanks Christine, Gil and Steven for the terrific meal. Made my friend's birthday dinner special! And thanks Anjan for stopping by to say hello. It's great when the owner takes time to come around and check on guests!
author: Brett M.

description:
First off let me start by saying I only review when I don't have a great experience at a restaurant so highly rated. I was extremely disappointed from start to finish at DOSA. 
1. My party and I made it on time for the reservation but had to wait a good thirty minutes to be seated. If I am taking the time to make a reservation a few days in advance and make it on time you better believe I expect to be seated as soon as my party arrives.  
2. I'm shocked to see how much someone can charge fore mediocre food and service. Being a South Indian myself this food was not worth the price and the trip at all. Ironically the meat dishes had more flavor than the rest. Let's just say the dosas were not the star of the show. 
3. The highlight of my night was when the check arrived and I noticed a charge for serving cake per person. This was my sisters birthday and so a bought a few cupcakes for the party and made sure I called ahead of time to find out if that was alright with the restaurant and was reassured if I served the cake myself I would not be charged per person. This being the case I was approached by the manager who came to clarify things with a very rude tone. He insisted he spoke to the person I spoke to and she said otherwise, fine by me but i am not one to make up something I wasn't told. Anyway the point is not the money but the attitude of the manager! Absolutely no etiquette. He spoke rudely to me in front of my guests at the table was extremely insistent on the charge. I didn't want to cause a scene so I paid the extra amount. 

All in all I would never return. The service, food and management has to be worked on. I have not left a restaurant feeling more angry than happy and this will be the first. To all my South Indian mates seek out a better South Indian restaurant where you don't pay an arm and a leg for "white washed Indian food"
author: D A.

description:
So disappointed with my recent visit. This was my favorite south Indian place. The sambhar and red chutney were EXTREMELY SPICY! the waiter could not change it. The paneer dosa and masala dosa were okay. The idli was not too soft. Would prefer the Jay Bharat dosa over this now. Please bring back the less spicy versions! :(

PS: NEVER order the panipuri here! By far the worst I have eaten.
author: Adwait A.

description:
The food was OK. 
We got a chicken franky, which was chettinadu chicken stuffed in a wheat rumali roti. 
Egg curry + kerela parotha - The egg curry was decent, but the paratha was meh. I can't tell for sure, but I think it is heated up frozen kavan paratha! 
Service was very slow, we had to wait for 30mins+ for the main course.
The staff was very nice and cordial as usual though. :)
author: Mrinalini K.

description:
Service was good, but the food was mediocre at best.  At least the vegetarian small plates and the dosa. I had the Vada Pav and the truffle dosa. While the Vada Pav was spicy had a zing to it there was nothing extraordinary about it. The truffle dosa was super disappointing, no hint of truffle at all! Scam. And at $15 you wonder why you even ordered that. The sambhar was way too thick and the red chutney was ketchup? Such exorbitant prices for a dosa? Cmon guys you can do better! 
I would treat myself to Udipi for half the price!
author: Trisha H.

description:
As the name suggests, don't order anything except plain old masala dosa. We tried a bunch of dosas, except masala dosa, rest were very ordinary or not good. But then, how many stars will you give a restaurant that screws up masala dosa.

We went for dinner. The worst part of our experience is that tables are so close that you have minimal privacy. In many parts, when people are sitting, there is not even enough room to walk.

In summary, dosa - ok, other dishes - less than ok, ambiance - not worth the price.
author: Urjaswita Y.

description: South Indian Cuisine, nicely presented, tasty, delicious.  Dosa of mushroom with truffle oil, great lamb dish and a sweet cheese with rose water for desert.  Annie our server was knowledgeable, efficient and personality plus.  Will return!
author: Gail M.

description:
We went with our entire family including kids to this place.

If you are Dosa Lover and looking for a good dine out experience, then avoid this place. Let me explain.

The staff is very arrogant. May be they prefer white skinned people as we could see the difference. 

They ran out a lot of dishes. Common!!! Wish they told us while we were waiting for 45 min.

Definitely not coming to this place again.
author: Sujay M.

description:
I visited this place for lunch with a friend. Being a hard core bangalorean ( The dosa haven of India ) this place still did not satisfy my craving for authentic Indian dosa's. They had a wide variety of dosa's which were a 1 time try for me. There was something missing in the sambar which put me off. 

I might no go back for the dosa's, but I would for something more special. It's the 'Rose Infused Pavalova'.  The crispy meringue, the extremely light rose infused whipped cream, paired with pistachios and fresh berries was hands down the best desert I have had in 2016 !

It's a must try !
author: Vathsal V.

description:
This review is for the poor service we experienced. 

We were brought to a table and I asked the hostess if we could sit in another booth that was also open - she said, "I'm not sure, I'll be right back."  Didn't see her again. 

We're at our table, and after 5-6 minutes a man silently puts 2 waters on the table (one of the glasses was literally only half full), and walks away. We wait for 7-8 more minutes for our server - nothing. Finally I flag down a busser and ask him to get us our server. It turns out to be the guy who brought us our waters. He stares at us, and silly me, I'm expecting some sort of "Hi", or "Hello, how are you". All we got was "are you guys ready?"

He drops off our food, and doesn't even bother to check in and see how it is/how we're doing, nothing. What's even worse is that he definitely wasn't as stiff with the table right next to us. 

Food was nice, but I don't like being served with an attitude like I'm some sort of inconvenience.
author: Garima T.

description: Southern India food, back in India is mostly positioned and available as value for money, Common Man's food. So going into such a place, you have modest expectations in terms of service and experience, but high expectations in terms of flavors - cause that's what the southern cuisine is all about! DOSA turns this over it's head! I am so happy to see someone create a modern, enticing, superlative take on this cuisine, where service and experience is front and centre. We enjoyed the ambience, service was pleasing, jazz music was great, cocktails were fantastic, ... And the food was pretty decent too! It was subtle in flavors, but fortunately for me that's how I like it. Overall great place to enjoy the usual Southern cusine, I. An uplifted manner, for evenings when you are feeling it! Definitely recommend, and once again - thankful that someone created this experience.
author: Prashant B.

description:
Con: the table was tight. But to be fair, we were a large party. 
Pro: the food was delicious! Sambhar has more of a dal taste than I'm used to on South Indian cooking but still yummy. 
The mushroom & truffle uttapam was outta this world. Highly recommended. Kids liked the idli and paneer & peas dosa. Rava dosa was also well made. Crispy on the outside, but foldable - perfect consistency.
author: Urvi K.

description: Nice place, I went there after I saw it on a tv show. Food is quite spicy, or is it just what I ordered? Sure it is Indian, and judging by many Indian patrons its probably pretty authentic. So the hot dishes is expected. Yet after tasting 3 dishes the heat was overwhelming. Still, I would recommend this place as food is interesting, innovative and different. The service was good and very attentive even thought it was very busy. Mare a reservation in advance, so you don't have to wait. And try the bar drinks, they are unique and amazing.
author: El J.

description:
This review is from lunch on 7/2/17.

We had a reservation for 1:30PM.  We arrived on time and were told by the hostess our table would be ready shortly.  The Fillmore Street Jazz Festival was taking place at the time so the street outside the restaurant was crowded and very loud, there was also a constant cold breeze coming straight in to the only waiting area provided.  We asked if the front door could be closed because of the noise and temperature and they're response was "No. We cannot close the door." with no apology or further explanation.  

We were seated at our table at 1:50PM.  Our server arrived and only mentioned that she would be bringing waters soon.  There was no explanation of the menu, which at Dosa I think is helpful for most guests.  There was no offer to take drink or food orders.  We were able to order approximately 20 minutes after being seated.  The one saving grace is that when the food came out it was delicious.  However, the next time we saw our waitress was after most of our party was finished eating when she came by to check that the order came out correctly.  That's contact that should be made with the table shortly after the food arrives, not when everyone is done eating.  It took another 20 minutes after we had all finished our food for the offer of dessert and for the check to arrive.  We had cards out, on the table, ready to pay because at this point we were clearly ready to leave, but still had to wait another 10 minutes before a different server  picked up our check to be processed.  No wonder it took them 20 minutes to seat our reservation, they have no clue how to move tables efficiently in and out of their restaurant.  

Other frustrating things that came up;  At 2:15PM they started playing very loud music (possibly to block out the loud music they were letting in through their open door).  My $3.50 small cup of coffee was never refilled.  One entree came out 5 minutes before everyone else's did. 

This is our fourth time at Dosa.  The previous times were great, which is why we kept coming back.  I've worked in the restaurant business and I am pretty understanding when it comes to service, but this was too much.  Essentially every step of the way they managed to provide terrible service and never apologize for it.  The cherry on top was watching the manager stand at the host stand for the entire 100 minutes we were in his restaurant.  He never walked the dining room floor, never checked in on tables, and never offered assistance or guidance to his staff who clearly could have used it.  The food was great, but not great enough to make me overlook how atrocious the management of this restaurant was.  Sorry Dosa, we had some good times, but this is the end for us.  


TLDR

Pros: Great food

Cons: Everything else
author: Cameron S.

description:
I ordered "moons" in uttapam section. There were 5 very small Uttapams . I would say 2 inch in diameter. Suggestions to management 
- it's not sufficient for a 26 year old, 6 feet, grown up person for dinner
- if you are not going to increase size of uttapam, please include it in starter section and decrease the price
- good ambiance doesn't make sense if I am not able to fill my stomach.
- I had to eat at curry up now after I ate here because I was hungry. 

First time I went here after viewing yelp reviews. Total disappointment. Never going back.
author: Old A.

description:
Great food! 

We ordered Vada Pav, truffle oil masala dosa, kofda. Vada Pav is the best!

Definitely will visit again and try more.
author: Yuhuan T.

description:
WOW!  way to tickle my taste buds Dosa!

This has always been on my SF restaurant list. My friend lived in walking distance and I would always see the fancy chandelier, which made me immediately say "YES, I am going to try this restaurant one day!"

Lo and behold! I finally arrived.

I am used to the usual Indian food like Chicken Tikka Masala and Naan.  Boy was I in for a delightful awakening.

I had no idea where, what, and who to order on this menu.

In the end, my friend and I shared, which all I highly recommend!

Watermelon, paneer salad- very very interesting texture and flavoring

Corn and curry leaf Soup- very tasty and with a spicy kicker at the end of each bite

Summer vegetable Curry- really tasty and great with the rice!

Spicy Basil Dosa-  YUM!  The sauces are unique to each other.  You are supposed to eat it with your hands, so get ready to get down and dirty!

Bottom Line:  you can't go wrong with anything on the menu, cute fancy spot especially for a date night
author: Michelle T.

description: High end prices for fast food. Drinks are very pricy even for San Francisco.  Food and service was good enough but when my meal arrives two minutes after ordering I question why I am paying premium prices. Our app never arrived - lost in the rush I suppose.
author: Jeffrey O.

description:
The best Southern Indian in San Francisco (or rather, the best Indian in San Francisco).  They have Halal  meats, the space has some sort of environmental certification and it's chic and sophisticated looking.   I've never had a bad wait person.  

They have a great wine list, reds that compliment the spice of their food.

Love Love and Love the dosas. Keep in mind if you don't want one filled with things, you can get a plain one on the side which I love.

I do wish they'd use better salt in their lassi though . . .table salt . .ick, I wish they used Himalayan salt instead for it's health benefits.
author: Cinnamon Z.

description: Nice looking restaurant. Great ambience. Food was average at best. The dosas and accompanying sambar and chutneys were not the best in town. Places in the South Bay like Madras cafevare much better tastewise. But if you are going for upsacem dining experience with moderately good food this is the place to be.
author: Renu I.

description:
Love the white truffle dosa here. Drinks are tasty as well.

If you're looking for a little bit of heat and meat, my boyfriend really enjoys the chicken korma.

Tip: The korma and dosa actually pair quite well together! Spoon some korma over that dosa. When they make it good, the old-fashioned here is perfection!
author: Aleyna S.

description: One of the best South Indian restaurants in Bay Area! Had dosa and uthapam, both were excellent. Service is also pretty quick and polite.
author: Manav T.

description:
Dosas, where have you been all my life? I don't know how I've made it this far into my love affair with food of all kinds -- including PLENTY o' Indian cuisine -- without knowing that these amazing, giganto, flavor-filled crepes even existed!

The illustrious Tiffany N. took us baby CMs under her wing while in Frisco, and by gum, if this lady doesn't know her stuff. Dosa on Fillmore is a real treasure. Not only is it a beautiful space, especially if you seated up on the balcony portion we did, but everyone from the hostess staff to the busboys were friendly, accommodating, and offered their advice and suggestions without hesitation. Since I don't know of a place in Northern VA that serves dosas (yet! I'm making it my mission to find one!), obviously that was what must-order for me. But before we got to that, as a table we shared some appetizers that are making my mouth water all over again just thinking about them!

The North & South Samosa dish was a fabulous way to highlight the difference between the two types of Indian cuisine. I'm actually not really sure which was which (bad Gretchen...) but one was your traditional potato samosa, and the other was more like a triangular spring roll, flatter and crispier with vegetables inside. Both were equally delicious, especially with my favorite tamarind sauce all up in thurr.

The lamb meatballs and a chicken appetizer dish that I can't remember the name of were also incredibly delicious. The meatballs are pretty spicy, so be forewarned, and the chicken had a good zip to it as well, but came with a yogurt sauce that cooled everything down to  be nice and mellow. Mm-mmm.

Okay, so onto the main event: the dosa! I got the paneer & peas dosa, which actually doesn't come in a single bigger-than-your-head shaped monstrosity but is broken up into three deceptively proportioned looking crepes. I say deceptive, however, because it was still an incredible amount of food! Melty cheese, smashed and  whole peas, all wrapped up in a fluffy crepe... I'm sure it's no stretch for you to imagine exactly how delicious the entire thing was! I appreciated our waitress's tip to dip into all three sauces at once. It was like a flavor 'splosion in my mouth!

I also got a chance to steal from--I mean, share with--my neighbors, so I tried the roasted garlic dosa as well as the crispy paper dosa. Both were, again, delicious, and I really liked the traditional masala potatoes that came inside the paper. I will be going back to Dosa on Fillmore in a heartbeat the next time I fly back to San Francisco, you can bet on that!
author: Gretchen F.

description: Somehow 40 minutes means two hours with many open tables.  Hostess tries to keep you around to taste the bland food.  Portions are small, dosa is tasteless, and all items extremely overpriced.  The water had bugs floating in it. Service was the worst I've ever experienced. Took away the plates without asking.  Try somewhere else.
author: Jessica J.

description:
Love this place! 

Their Paneer one is the best :) The interior has a nice ambiance and great service.
author: B P.

description: My wife and I had an awesome dinner here. The idli with sambar was fantastic. We also enjoyed the prawn curry and the dosa we had
author: Adam E.

description: Like this place a lot for Dosas. Kind wish they'd bring back the more traditional Indian dishes they used to have though. It's nice to eat at the bar, solo or with a friend. Very cool decor. Can get loud. Eat upstairs if you'd like to cut down on noise!
author: Tilly D.

description: I recently visited this place again and I am hugely disappointed by their food, ambience and taste. Firstly we were served oil dipped fries(complimentary) but unhygienic and vada pav was not served hot, and it was very sour.. We ordered 2 pavs and they were served in a single plate conveniently !! Vada sambar was not even worth mentioning.. Vada was probably week old and too rubbery. I would never recommend this place.
author: Vidya M.

description:
Spoiler alert: this review is specifically about their bar program (and not their food - which is awesome, btw).

I came here yesterday for happy hour (available daily from 5pm - 7pm). My friend and I saddled up at the bar and ordered two Bengali Gimlets (Tanqueray gin, lime juice, curried nectar, and served up). This cocktail is pure awesomeness in a glass. It's about as perfectly balanced a drink as you're going to find. It's not only refreshing, but it totally captures the spirit (pun intended) of the restaurant's stylish Indian roots. One Bengali Gimlet goes down smooth. And after two Bengali Gimlets, you'll definitely be in a happy place and ready to chow down on some dosas and Chennai Chicken. 

While at $8 a pop, it isn't exactly the cheapest happy hour special in town. But they do offer a variety of affordable Indian bites to pair with your beverage (prices range from $4 - $8). Plus, it's hard to beat the sexy, electric vibe of Dosa. We arrived at 5:30pm and we were the only ones in the place. And within 30 minutes, the bar/restaurant was packed. Couples were dining; singles were flirting; drinks were being shaken; aromatic food was being savored; people were smiling. This is just an enjoyable setting for drinking and dining. Totally worth checking out.

P.S. - great first date spot!
author: Kevin B.

description:
I was blown away by the quality of food at Dosa. I have been to the Valencia location and had a good experience there, but this one is off the charts. When I first tried to get in here, I couldn't get a table since it was packed to the brim. So got a reservation (*pro-tip*) and went here a week after. Dosa was so worth the effort.

I tried the Hyderabadi lamb chops and the rava masala dosa. The hyderabadi lamb chops were incredible. Really well made with a tamarind sauce on it. Amazing. The rava masala dosa was pretty good too. Won't rave about it since a lot has been said about the Dosas here already. 

For dessert I got to try the Kulfi and Rasmalai. zOMG. This is where dosa hit the ball out of the park. If you haven't yet, please do yourself a favour and try the Kulfi here. It will blow your mind, for sure. 

Give this place a shot if you haven't (or visit again if you have :D). Aaand get the Kulfi.
author: Leelakrishna N.

description: Dosa is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco!  I eat here every time I'm in town.  Please open a Dosa in Los Angeles!
author: Terri D.

description:
Dosa On Fillmore is definitely not your typical Indian restaurant!

It's classy and modern with a friendly staff and excellent unique food.  My first visit was with a large group, so we ordered family style and shared half of the menu items, so I definitely got a great taste of what they have to offer.  I didn't taste anything I didn't like by the way!

During my most recent visit, there were just two of us and we sat at the bar. While they offer some awesome looking cocktails and the bartenders are super fun to watch as they prepare them, Tiffany and I opted for champagne and wine respectively.  We also shared two appetizers: Grilled Calamari and the North and South Samosas.  Tiffany went with a signature dosa for her main course and I ate every last drop of the Vegetable Curry with coconut rice.  I left crazy full; it was flavorful and filling!

If you like Indian cuisine but are looking for a more upscale ambiance and diverse drink menu to go along with it, Dosa is for you.  Just make sure you make a reservation ahead of time if you have a large group.  And if it's just one or two of you, the bar or community table are awesome... maybe you'll meet a new friend while you are there?!
author: Gabi M.

description:
Great ambiance really nice place.  Our server David was very good and attentive. 

We started with the fan favorite chennai chicken.  It was very flavorful.  

We then moved to the thali with lamb and the masala dosa.  The thali was an explosion of tastes wonderful flavorful yet not overwhelming. 

The dosa was also very nice. 

There are many Indian people that come by but the food is not a traditional Indian. The delivery method is not as a typical Indian food rather is more westernized.  Which means you will be treated to great quality with great service.
author: Amber L.

description: Finest food, and this is the 3rd time I am visiting here i.e. almost every time I visit here from LA
author: Kanak S.

description: South Indian food is usually tough to introduce people to because the flavors are really different, but I love how Dosa makes it such a fun experience! It's a great place to bring people who haven't had dosas or south indian food before. The white truffle dosa used to be my favorite, before I tried the spicy basil one! I liked that much better. I think the white truffle dosa at Rasa does more justice to the truffle, so if you are looking for that flavor, I would save it for there. Ambiance is also wonderful, it's so bright and clean inside. The drink menu is another thing I love about Dosa. I love how they indianify your typical drinks. Overall, I would definitely recommend checking it out if you're in the area!
author: Megha M.

description:
On a short getaway out of town, my wife and I were told to try this place as it came highly recommended. I'd actually give this place a 4.5 star rating if that was an option. Here's the rundown...

Ambiance:
Has romantic vibes with dim lighting. There is a bar on the right side when you walk in with some high table seating. Otherwise, most of the seating is normal table setups with dark wood furnishings. The chandeliers were also very pretty. 

Service:
Our server was friendly and offered great descriptions of the food options. He gave his favorite dishes and was upfront about how much food would be good for the both of us. No pressure to order alcohol or dessert. He along with the bus boys were attentive to check in on us and keep our drinks refilled. One slight knock would be that the food took a bit longer to come out than what we'd consider normal. 

Food:
Every dish was delicious. We started with the Vada Pav, which are tasty vegetarian sliders made with a potato based patty. We then shared the White Truffle Masala Dosa and the Chicken Dum Korma. Both were great, but if I had to choose one to have again it would be the Chicken Dum Korma. The curry reminded me of Tikka Masala but with a lighter flavor. The dark meat chicken was so tender and juicy with flavor. 

Final Thoughts:
We'd definitely eat here again when in the mood for Indian cuisine. I'd be curious to try the other Dosa options on the menu. One thing to note is if you want a soft drink, they are served in bottles so there are not free refills.
author: Michael S.

description: Food is ok. Service can be better. Kept waiting for everything. Charged gratuity by default even when the group size is 5... I thought standard rule is to charge gratuity when the group size is 6 or more. Quality and service degrading day by day.
author: Hiral S.

description:
I really enjoyed the food at this place. They have an allergy menu so from the start I knew what my options were. That said, keep a copy of the regular menu too so you can read the descriptions b/c the other menu doesn't describe the dishes. 
My friend & I started with the chutney appetizer and the shredded duck. Both were delicious!  The chutney is served with pappadum so it a great gluten free choice. The duck is spicy and greatly tasty. We got the raita to go with it. Then we got chicken korma and a side of lemon rice, great choice and perfect side. Finally we got our dosas. I'd never had one and was surprised when it arrived. I loved them!  They were rolled up one was stuffed with potatoes & white truffles the other was plain and you dipped it in a nice lamb dish. 
I'll be back to try more menu items.
author: Heather S.

description:
I have heard so much about DOSA during my time at Berkeley and since I moved to SF, that I knew I Just had to try it soon. Some girlfriends convinced me that it really was the best south Indian food in the city and that it was absolutely worth a visit - so we made a reservation for around 9:30 pm with no issues on a Monday night. First of all, I wasn't expecting how beautiful the restaurant was! Way nicer than any of the south Indian restaurants I've frequented to in the bay. Anyways, on to the food. I'm north Indian and I've always been a huge fan of only North Indian food. My parents however LOVE South Indian food, so it's their mission in life to take us to as many South Indian restaurants as they can to convert us. Never really worked, but I'm willing to bet that if they took me to DOSA, I'd consider eating more South Indian food. 

Starters: Vada pav (aka vegetarian sliders) - think of the fluffiest, most delicious hamburger buns you've ever had and multiply by 100. The bread was to die for and I would eat just that over and over again. The bun was stuffed inside with a potato type patty, and the dish came with oil and a powder of some sort (I wish I knew what this was). Basically the concept was to mix the oil and powder to make a sort of flavored, spicy sauce. We each had one but I wish we had more - they were amazing! I'd come back just to grab these. 

Chutney platter: In most South Indian restaurants, or north even, you don't pay for chutneys. They're complimentary, almost like ketchup or hot sauce. DOSA, being fancy-smancy and all charges you for sides of chutney so we got the chutney platter, to see what the buzz what all about. The chutney platter came with 4 chutneys (spicy, sweet, coriander and one more that was a little bland so I can't place it) and pappad (think crispy, thin chips).  Overall, a good appetizer but probably wouldn't pay $5 for it again (call me cheap, oops). 

Food: My friend and I spoiled our dinners because we couldn't wait until 9pm so we ended up splitting the spicy basil dosa. This was delicious! The spicy flavors with the basil worked amazingly and were definitely different than usual dosas I've tasted. I also enjoyed the potato stuffing that was inside - it tasted fresh and rich, and paired with the chutney/sambar, everything came together amazingly. One thing I loved about all components of the dosa was the quality of the ingredients - everything truly tasted fresh and not like it had been lying around and made in bulk (like I feel when I eat at some dosa eateries). The only thing that did not impress me was the sambar - that did not taste as fresh or as flavorful as I hoped (I wish it was spicier). However, still not a bad sambar and given how amazing everything else was, it wasn't a game changer. 

Drinks: I wish we had not drank earlier or we would've indulged in some of their amazing cocktail options...Mango is the new black!? Definitely will have to come back to try some of these drinks! 

Verdict: Definitely try this place out! You'll be surprised at how beautiful the restaurant is and if you're like me, and don't like South Indian food much, you just might have to make an exception.
author: Anu P.

description:
It has been a while since my visit to Dosa On Fillmore in early March, but I didn't want to skip a review for the place since it was one of my favorite dinners during my last San Francisco trip. Definitely worth a revisit next time I'm in town. 

Dosa does upscale Indian right. The food is great, the environment classy, drinks excellent, and yet you don't feel completely robbed after paying the check. In my opinion, you can't go wrong with the tasting menu, a three course meal for $35. Add on the wine pairing for just $18 more and you will be served pours that are practically full-size and perfectly complementary to your courses. 

I'm a little hazy on the details of each dish I had but I know the samosa I started with blew away the samosa I had during my lunch at another restaurant earlier in the day. The second course is a choice between some uttapam and dosa variations; I had never tried either before but the the dosa I ended up ordering was absolutely delicious. The lentil dipping soup served alongside was the perfect accompaniment. The whole thing reminded me of an Indian version of an American favorite: grilled cheese and tomato soup. My third course was some sort of spicy boneless chicken which was also very nice. 

Just thinking about this dinner makes me smile because I was also in great company. What's better than sharing an awesome meal with awesome people?
author: Michelle C.

description:
Overrated piece of crap. 

We ordered the South Indian moon dosas - got 5 of them, only 1 was palatable. Dahi vada was a messy goo. Vada Pav was better than the other two dishes. Totally overpriced nonsense.
author: Rocking V.

description: I love this place a lot as they have variety of food and Indian spice just so unique. For the place setting and ambience, the price is decent for me. I'll definitely recommend this place if you would like to hang out with friends and spend some enjoyable dinner in this restaurant
author: Unyo N.

description: A little off with the hostess not a good way to start... The food was very good! Get the halibut:)
author: steph b.

description:
While I had dined at the restaurant's other location on Valencia and been blown away, unfortunately, this wasn't the case last night. 

To be more precise, my wife and I had a reservation for a table at 5:30, arrived on time, and weren't seated for almost twenty minutes. 

When we were finally seated, we weren't even acknowledged by any of the staff for another 10 minutes+. 

When we finally were, our server was detached, seemingly going through the motions of her job and just didn't seem to care greatly if we were there or not. In addition, things arrived willy-nilly and just seemed to drift out of the kitchen.

To be honest, this is often an issue for restaurants that have a great menu, have worked hard on getting their cocktails right, but have neglected to fully train their wait staff in the full dimensions of their role in the overall scheme beyond simply noting what has been ordered and delivering this information to the kitchen. What a bummer!

On the bright side, the food was amazing and the cocktails were great, although my wife and I will probably not be returning since there are so many other restaurants that have the whole package together.
author: Lance P.

description: They have Jain( no onion, potato, garlic) Uttapam which is great. Liked the taste, unfortunately they don't have Jain sambhar. It's pretty expensive probably because it's SF, but overall service and ambience is great.
author: Yash D.

description:
Good place with great Indian food. The decor is great. It has an excellent bar and the service is pretty good. This is a good recommendation for people who want to try authentic Indian food but worried about the spice. They keep the spice on a lower side but the authenticity of the dishes remains the same. 

The service is good and place is busy and crowded.
author: Stawan K.

description:
My feelings about Dosa on Fillmore are mixed. The pros: the ambiance and the interior design of the place are fairly pleasing. The place is upscale, posh, and has a swanky feel. It's a great place to grab drinks with friends. The cons: the food at Dosa has never wow-ed me. I haven't had anything I particularly disliked, but everything's been middle-of-the-road okay. My biggest complaint is that the food is pricey (especially given that it's not amazing). 

All in all, if you're looking for delicious flavorful Indian food in SF, look around because there are tons of other great options. If you're looking for a nice swanky place to get a couple of drinks, Dosa isn't a bad option.
author: Dalia Y.

description:
Loved the place, didn't feel like a really high level decoration or ambiance but food I ordered was great. I ordered thali to try out various things and every item in it was super tasty. Very flavorful, not spicy or bland. Loved it.
Appetizer soup was great.
Masala dosa was OK.
Filter coffee was great, got refills, didn't know you can get refills on filter coffee.
Over all great experience.
author: Honest O.

description:
Our group split the bill between three cards and each one had an extra $2 added to the tip. When I discovered it was not only my card that was overcharged, I knew it was not a mistake and they had blatantly added more tip to the card.

The food was delicious but this issue leaves a sour taste in my mouth.
author: Simone P.

description: The Vada is so hard and the Dahi is way too salty. This is not how the dahi vada taste. They need to learn how to make dahi vadas and then the item should be back to their Menu. The look and decoration is not all to make a restaurant good, its all about food. I can cook better sambhar than they do.
author: Tina M.

description: I love the twist on South Indian food they have here! The names of the dishes are punny and relevant
author: Swaja K.

description: I will give not more than 2 to this place! I ordered Paneer Dosa and asked to make a bit spicy. I literally got one stuffed with harbanero peppers.....just burnt my mouth!!!
author: Dhara P.

description:
This review, unfortunately, isn't for the food -- it's for the incredibly classy service. Last night, my girlfriend and I were seated upstairs. We spent a good 15 minutes trying to narrow our selection down. A tough job when everything sounds so amazing.

With the help of our server Annie, we finally made some choices. We placed our order, but immediately received a surprise phone call... My girlfriend and I had to leave, and quick. I ran after Annie, apologized, and asked if we could still cancel our order. Just as I did, our first batch of chutneys arrived at the table. I offered to pay, but like a total champ, Annie said it was no problem and let us hurry off sooner rather than later.

We'll be back to make good on that meal.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Food was good, no doubt! - idli fries, chill garlic dosa and truffle dosa were the highlight of our order.

Taking off one star as they seated our party of 8 on a table of 6 and even when we requested to be reseated there seem to be no action taken. Host acknowledged in the beginning but after a few minutes it was just business as usual. Would have appreciated some empathy...
author: Abhi A.

description: This place is extremely overpriced.  My wife and I got a lamb curry and a halibut curry and she got an apple cider and we ended up paying over $90.  This would be a 4 star review if we had to just pay $40 which is what that meal was worth.
author: Sam S.
