description: One of the worst dosa I have ever eaten in my life....and to top it off the hostess who signed us in was so rude. My daughter and i both suffered a case of tumny ache and LMs after having dinner there. I would give it a negative star if possible...never ever going there again....yuk!
author: Payal B.

description: We always look forward to our Dosa visits as we enjoy the trendy ethnic ambience, food with a modern twist and good service. For starters, the vada pav is excellent if you want enjoy spice, potatoes, and bread. The flavors go really well together. The spinach pakora is also addictive- with the perfect amount of crisp and flavor. For mains, we always get the Truffle oil masala dosa which has a familiar yet distinctive taste, and comes with chutneys and sambar that are also very good. We enjoy their seasonal dosas as well, which are innovative recreations of the traditional masala dosa. Mango lassi is also excellent here. But reserve a table to avoid a long wait, and sometimes finding parking can be tough.
author: L C.

description: The dosas are just incredible. The tomato chutney is flavorful without being overly spicy, which I find many indian restaurants tend to do. The sambar has the perfect balance of spices to complement the crisp dosas. Paper masala is my absolute favorite!
author: Kay S.

description: The food was great but the service was horrible. Our server was rude and make snarky comments all night.
author: Lauren H.

description:
You will not be disappointed!  

Great service,  incredible food!  A vast menu to pick from.  


I had the sliders, and one of the Dosa's (can't remember which one...)
author: Brian W.

description: This was our go-to spot for celebration dinners. But, slowly they broke our hearts by taking away the Kale Pakora and putting fresh Lima beans on an already perfect Chana Masala. I tried telling them about it on their Facebook page, and they have an automatic reply set to get back to me within 24-48 hrs and it's been a month with no response! What gives, DOSA? You used to be great
author: Karen K.

description: The food was below average. This place does not have authentic south Indian food and in general (if I'm not comparing the food with that at other south Indian restaurants) the food doesn't taste good. It's overpriced and the taste doesn't make it worth the money. The only decent thing about the place is it's ambience.
author: Kanika C.

description:
This may have been one of the best meals of my life. The atmosphere is exciting, and sultry. The lighting is perfect, and the service is outstanding. 
We ate family style - We tried the Chennai chicken as an app, and this was a show stopper for me, I think I'd have to say my favorite part of the meal. Tangy, sweet, and so unique. We also got their fries. Im a fry snob. I seek the best. And these fries- left me aching for more. They are so delish.
My mom, who is from Iowa - got the chicken masala which everyone agreed was the best main dish. They made it less spicy for her, and it was perfect. Although I think it would have been great with the original amount of spice as well. We got the dosa sampler which came with all these different dipping sauces. It was tasty but nothing to write home about. 
The waitress suggested this puffy bread - which I will dream about til I die. It was sweet, crisp, and so tantalizing. I've never had anything like it.
I will never forget this meal, and if I ever come back to San Fran, this is the first rez I'm making. Thanks Dosa. I Love you.
author: Sara V.

description:
So chic and sexy on the interior! Would be a good place for happy hour but we came for dinner. Get a few dosas to share, some rice dishes, apps, and you're set. Drinks look yummy, too, but as the responsible DD I went for the non-alcoholic South Indian Monsoon (ginger, citrus, mango). Very tasty.

Every dish we ordered was delish (thanks to the Indian food expert in our group): Brussel Sprouts, Chennai Chicken, Chicken Koram, Sunchoke Kofta, Spicy Basil and Rava Masala Dosas, and a Bhatura. Plenty of food for 4 hungry adults to share. If you're wondering what to get, ask the helpful staff.
author: Susan H.

description:
This is my fav restaurant in San Fran and one of my favorite restaurants in the world. 

So here's the deal. It's clean fresh Indian food with a modern take. Every single thing on this menu is mind blowing. 

I live in la and order Indian food on the reg and everytime I fantasize about Dosa. 

Dosa, if your listening please move to La!
author: Ray S.

description:
We had an excellent night at Dosa because of the food and certain people there.

The food was magnificent, so our compliments to the chefs.

What really made our evening sparkle was our waiter Davis.  Everything about him was genuine, including his well-timed attentiveness and his concern for our enjoyment.

His service was excellent and he took care of us with a very natural air and a minimum of fuss over any requests, all of which put us very much at ease.

The service was so good that at the end we asked to speak with his manager.  When Michelle came to see what we wanted to say, we immediately saw why people like Davis work there.

Michelle was perfectly lovely and very easy to talk to.  She spoke of encouraging her crew and thanking them for the hard work they do.  We were surprised to learn Davis had only been at Dosa for two weeks, which spoke well of her selection skills.

Thanks also to the two barmen who were asked to make us fruity cocktails definitely not in the menu, and who concocted a couple of delicious drinks.
author: GreatAlfredini A.

description: Dosa is one of my favorite dish amongst Indian cuisine and their dosa is very authentic. One of the best dosa in this world. It is one of those rare fancy Indian restaurant where most of the staffs are not Indians. They have two floors and the top one can be booked for events too. I usually order the classic masala dosa and vada pav. They have good cocktail selections and everyone should at least try the Bengali Gimlet. I absolutely love that cocktail. Their chutney sampler is good too but their pani puri is not so great as I expected it to be. The potato inside the shell has no flavor or spices which is definitely not an authentic pani puri recipe.
author: Nujhat Nashia R.

description:
Overpriced meal and meh service.

Service: Waitress had no energy at all and spoke with a really soft voice. Didn't explain very well and just didn't seem to have a great demeanor. The guys who brought us the food had no idea who ordered what and several people at our table had forgotten what they ordered which caused some confusion, this happened a few times. There was one employee (manager or perhaps owner?) who was pretty nice and attentive. 

Food: had the 'tasting' menu with the calamari app, paneer second course, and lamp chop entree ($48) and a shere khan cocktail ($12). Also with the meal was some spicy crackers and colored dipping sauces and some giant puff bread. Cocktail was the best thing I had honestly, it tasted great. 

The calamari came with a portion of calamari in a curry sauce, salad, and a piece of onion naan. Both the naan and the salad were pretty bland esp the salad but the calamari was pretty tasty although probably too spicy for most people.

Panner course: paneer with peas wrapped with a crepe type bread. Comes with soup. I liked the soup, the paneer was all right but I wasn't much a fan of how it looked. 

Main course: lamb chop with potato and something else. This was the main disappointment, a single rib of lamb, hardly a good value at all. I ate it in two bites and was kind of a sad panda. 

Overall the food was pretty uninspired and quite expensive. I'll take cheaper indian food at Saffron Grill personally.
author: Andrew P.

description:
This place never fails to disappoint, and is fabulous for vegans! Just let the waiter know you'd like to make the dish vegan-friendly, and he or she will accommodate you!
 I enjoyed their caramelized onion uttapam! It is crispy and light (no potato masala). 
Dosa's sambar is delicious and thankfully not a pool of oil. Their red and green chutneys are tasty as well. 
The winner of our brunch order though was the vada pav. It is sweet and savory at the same time because of its delicious tamarind paste. I absolutely loved it. 
This place gives a good twist to South Indian food. I love absolutely everything I've tried on their menu and I would highly recommend it to anyone, regardless of their experience with eating South Indian food.
author: Shalini P.

description:
My husband took me here for my birthday dinner and it was a great experience! High-quality food, clean restaurant, and great service all around. I'm South Indian and the food was definitely authentic & first-class. We got the dahi vada as appetizer (and it was pretty good) and dosas for dinner. The condiments (chutneys + sambar) that come with the dosa are also absolutely delicious! I highly recommend getting dosa at DOSA ;)

It was a really great place & experience but didn't completely wow me (hence 4 stars instead of 5), but definitely a place we'll go back to!
author: Sweta A.

description:
I love Indian food, but I guess I never knew that it could be taken to such an elegant place! First off, the space is gorgeous, with romantic lighting and soaring ceilings. They serve delicious wine at the bar or with your meal, and even offer a wine pairing menu if you so desire. 

My friends and I came in unfamiliar with a lot of the menu but were told we absolutely had to try a dosa (duh). We went with the white truffle variety because, really, when something comes with white truffle, how do you say no? I liked it a lot - the texture was perfect, but I found it a tad salty. 

The highlight of the meal was the lamb dish, recommended by our super informative and friendly server. It was cooked absolutely perfectly! We also had a vegetable side that I can't seem to find on the menu now - it may have been a seasonal item, which featured brussels sprouts and was kind of forgettable.

I was truly impressed by the lamb dish as well as the beautiful ambiance and attentive service. I will absolutely come back here again... I'm just waiting for the next opportunity!
author: Christina P.

description:
We had very height expectations based on recommendations and reviews. 

We made reservations for NYE and ask if the menu was spicy. The lady said they could accommodate the menu to be mild.  

The food was ok, but not outstanding. 
But the main course was incredible spicy. I am ok with spicy food but this one we were not able to eat it much less to enjoy the experience. 

After paying $125 per person I expected much more!

Will not recommend or go back!
author: Juan B.

description: Great ambience and friendly staff.  The food isn't the best, there's more authentic south indian food out there.  I don't think I'd be back here unless I want to come to a place with great ambience.
author: Nira P.

description:
A friend chose this location for his birthday dinner. We were able to get a reservation at 6pm on Saturday night for a party of 8. Even though we arrived 15-20 mins. early, the staff was very welcoming and they were able to accommodate us. We were seated even before our entire party arrived. 

Dosas are delish here! I'm used to eating sweet crepes for more of a dessert-like snack, but Dosa on Fillmore proved that I can happily enjoy a savory crepe for a dinner entree as well. This was my first time trying dosa of any type (I should really expand beyond curries and naan for Indian fare) and I was very pleased. 

{food}

For a seasonal fall flavor, I say go with the PUMPKIN MASALA DOSA. The pumpkin masala with ginger and cinnamon created a really unique taste that you don't usually get with Indian food. Even my Indian friends were intrigued and impressed with my dish. I like how it came with an extra side of pumpkin chutney along with the sambar (lentil soup) and tomato and coconut chutneys. With the Bay Area weather turning a bit crisp and chilly outside, the spicy soup and warm dosa made for a very satisfying dinner. And the description of the portion as "the size of a large plate" is a bit of an understatement...I am pretty sure the dosa was the size of my face. 

The UTTAPAMS were also yummy and a couple of my friends chose the SOUTH INDIAN MOONS to get a selection of five different flavors to try. The texture was similar to potato latkes. I personally prefer the thinner, crepe-like consistency of the dosas. 

{drinks}

All the SPICE ROUTE COCKTAILS are pretty tasty. They are on the smaller side but they pack a nice punch. I've been in a tequila and spicy cocktail kick recently and went with the HIDEAWAY (the tequila, ginger, spiced agave, and birds eye chile caught my eye). I am still a fan of sweeter cocktails and also enjoyed my friend's MANGO IS THE NEW BLACK (rye whisky and spiced mango nectar made a great combo). 

{dessert}

I loved the soft vermicelli noodles and beets swimming in condensed milk in the PAYASAM & RED BEET HALAWA. It was a light dessert and reminded me of sweet dessert soups you find in Chinese restaurants. The RASMALAI was also a light dessert with cheese in a cream sauce flavored with spices and rose water. I preferred the sweeter flavor of the Payasam. Both desserts were quite large and we split them between our party of 8.

Things to note:
- You can take the 38 or 38L from Geary/Powell if you're downtown
- If you're coming with 2-3 other ppl, I would take Uber or Lyft to save time and avoid the crowded buses
- Close proximity to Japantown if you want some daytime activities before/after eating

I would definitely come back again if I'm in the Japantown area!
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
Took my uncle and girlfriend there on weekday. Wasn't expecting to be too crowded for late night dinner but had to wait for almost 25 minutes. Hostess was super nice. Ambience is great and so is the food presentation. Cocktails and indian wine were good as well.Dosa and uttapam were great. Madras coffee was so-so~was expecting lil frothy! 
I was very disappointed with dum Biryani. Over priced, no flavor, served luke warm~one chicken was burnt and chewy~ definitely it didn't have any dum in it! Scallops looked way too skinny  and the sauce simply felt like uncooked tikka masala! The worst part was when I ordered whole wheat paratha and turned out to be one of those store bought frozen parathas that I used to enjoy during my college days! I made sure  with my server if it was whole wheat and she said it was!!They should definitely try to serve fresh parathas. 
Will be back to try some more dosas since they tend to specialize only on dosas!
author: N B.

description:
This place is not an authentic South Indian place!
Either the dishes I ordered were not upto the mark or it happens every time like this.
Ordered:
 Idli Vada Sambhar- 
  It was just not the South Indian type of sambhar.. Idli and Vada were good.

Chana Bhatura-
Chana was full of cinnamon spice and sweet. Nothing like a Punjabi Chana masala.I feel they change their recipe every time. Bhatura was very sweet(which is not meant to be)

Vada Pao-
This just assured me that I should not come back here!
Vada was a mixture of sweet and spicy.(which wasnt authentic at all)
Vada Pao is meant to be Spicy please!

Those looking for Authentic Indian Sambhar of South India /Chana masala Bhatura of North India/ Vada pao of Maharashtra--- I would not recommend it.

Those looking for Indian food with Californian blend--- Might try your luck ;-)

AMBIANCE-Really good.
SERVICE- Very good :) (A smiley only for the service)
author: Sonia J.

description:
Dosa Dosa Dosa

The restaurant is beautiful! So elegant with warm lights and inviting colors. You don't get bored looking around. Made a reservation about 40 minutes prior to getting there and was seated pretty quickly upon arrival.

Started with the idli sambar small plates. The delicious bowl of sambar is super flavorful and the two idli's peek out at you, ready to be devoured. Warms you up and excites you for more food. I loved the "thuriya" green beans in there that pop into four you eat the insides of. Reminded me of the noms my mom used to make.

I decided (after much contemplation) on the roasted chile and garlic masala dosa and boy was that a great choice. I love garlic, I love heat, and I love complex flavor. This dish had all of that. I nominate this star of the show.

Other honorable mentions:

Quinoa "thinnai" uttapam
Raita
(double- you will eat all of it) chutneys
Masala dosa

The potatoes and cashews were on point, authentic, SPICY, and delicious. 

Towards the end of our meal, the guy taking our plates spilled chutney all overrrr one of the jackets on the chair. Manager was super nice and comped a dessert and promised to cover dry cleaning. Totally appreciated that.

So awesome they have a menu that provides alternatives for dietary restrictions.

It's not cheap, but it's worth it when you want a filling, quality meal you will be reminiscing about for hours.
author: Shereen A.

description:
Food was excellent and unique - as always. Service was a bit slow this evening for no obvious reason. (Restaurant was not too crowded.)

As usual, it can get a bit loud - not too loud to have a conversation but not quiet and cozy either.
author: Robert W.

description:
So yummy!  I love a good dosa.  Crispy on the outside soft in the inside.  Dosa definitely makes the best dosas in town, hence living up to it's name.  If I ever want a indian food fix with a nice atmosphere, this is it.

As you walk in the door, you smell all the spices.  The hostess was very courteous and directed me the the bar while I wait for my girlfriend.  The decor at Dosa is very calming.  They also have a full bar.  The chairs at the bar are much more comfortable than the main dining chairs.  If I have one suggestion for them, it would be to update the chairs.  

The menu is extensive.  We were there for lunch so we didn't order too much.  We shared a white truffle dosa and the weekend special Thali.  Both were very good.  The Thali gave me all sorts of fixes from sweet to savory chutneys to yogurt.  If you are thwre on the weekend, this a a must have.

Parking is always a challenge here so leave enough time to find parking.  The bathrooms looks too.

Overall always a great experience.  You want   Good indian food with a nice ambience, this is a must.  Bon appetit.  Until next time, ciao!
author: Dee Dee L.

description: We just had the South Indian thali and mind = hyper blown! All 12 items were made so well!! It took 20 minutes for us to get the order but the wait was totally worth it. Will come here again very soon with more people!
author: Sharanya A.

description:
They were busy when I visited, despite being a Tuesday night.
The ambiance and service were excellent.
This is not a traditional Southern Indian Restaurant, the interior is modern and the menu inventive. 

Ordered the following:
Poori Bread - Excellent
Chutney Sampler - Good but would prefer more interesting flavors - It paired very well with the Poori though
Bhel Puri - Excellent
Lamb Kofta (Meatballs) - Excellent
Prawn Masala with a side of Coconut Rice - Excellent
Truffle Oil Dosa - Unusual flavor for Southern Indian Food but Excellent
Chicken Biryani - The only dish I did not like. Biryani should be in the comfort food category - for me the topping was too heavily spiced for this type of dish and I love spicy food.
Pear Tart Thing - Excellent
Chocolate Chilli Mouse - Was not quite what I expected - it is more cake-like with a small amount of mouse on top. It was Ok, but I preferred the Pear Tart.

Overall a very pleasant dinner. Could have been 5 stars if not for the over-spiced Biriyani.
author: David T.

description: Okay, the food here is amazing amazing! It's bit overpriced with some of their items but overall the food is great. The service is okay but I would still go back for the food.
author: Lady R.

description:
Excellent paneer and pea dosa. Great sambhar and chutneys to accompany. Flavors were modern, and rooted in traditional authenticity -- I like their interpretation, and appreciate their comprehensive attention to presentation, traditional flavors, style, and catering to their audience's palate.

With that said, I think I was dressed too casually (khakis and a track jacket?)  to appropriately pick up take out at this swanky place because I felt a little dismissed and condescended to by the gentleman in front who handles reservations. The arrogance left me a little taken aback. Ultimately, while the food was excellent, I probably won't go back, just out of self-respect. But you should. Maybe they'll like your wardrobe better!
author: Nishant T.

description: Amazing Indian food. Very authentic yet fancy. They even have small plates which are in between appetizers and an entree. It's a perfect amount of food if you like trying different things. This place gets very crowded. I recommend making a reservation. If you get there right when they open you might snag a seat at the bar. I'll be back!
author: Laurina S.

description:
The food here was really really good! I don't have a chance to eat Indian food often but I loved the flavors of the food here. 

Our server was extremely knowledgeable and was very helpful with picking entrees.I would highly suggest you order the South India Thali! It is an assortment of several different dishes in one. This plate is also great for sharing. The Lamb Frankie was good but so spicy! 

If you like flavorful and spicy food I would definitely suggest this place.
author: Alyssa K.

description: Was with a group of friends visiting SF for the first time. For appetizers, we got the Chennai Chicken which is boneless natural, air-chilled chicken marinated in Straus organic yogurt, coriander & cummin. That was delicious. For entrees, I got the Late Harvest Uttapam which was okay to good. But mt favorite was my friend which was Quinoa Thinnai which is Quinoa & lentil batter with Thai chiles, ginger, fresh curry leaves and cilantro. All in all, the food was great and we were full by the end of the night
author: Jaafar L.

description:
Food is great. A new life to Indian fusion. A good variety of North and South indian. Don't go there on a weekend night. We had to wait 30 minutes with a reservation. Service is average.
The manager did apologize and send in free appetizer.
author: Saravanan V.

description:
My husband and I went here for dinner on a Saturday evenings my after spending time in union square enjoying the holiday lights. Did not take reservations but we did not have to wait and were seated right away. 
The drinks menu is good, they have some nice cocktails- I ordered the #sarinotsari drink and loved it while my husband tried an IPA beer. 
For starters we ordered the chettinad fish fry - the fish was very well seasoned and deep fried and the masala was tasty however I found it a little too hot for my taste. 
For main dish I ordered chili garlic dosa while my husband ordered the spicy moong masala dosa. Again the chili garlic dosa was too hot and spicy for me and I couldn't go beyond the second bite. My husband has a better tolerance for spicy food so we exchanged plates. He loved the spicy dosa despite sweating and turning red with the heat. 
I am Indian and used to mild spicy food but both the dishes were way too spicy and hot in my opinion. I wonder how non-Indians who have very low spice tolerance find the food here (or it could be that my choice of dishes wasn't good considering my spice tolerance). The moong masala dosa however was very good, loved the potato filling and the side chutneys and sambhar. 

Service is good and quick. My advice would be to go for the non spicy dishes. The place is upscale and has a nice ambience - there aren't many upscale Indian restaurants in the whole of the Bay Area. Definitely worth trying if you like southern Indian food.
author: Vidisha S.

description: I have been going to DOSA since they opened. I am basically a paleo eater and find there is a lot I can eat on this menu. It's comfort food. Fun place to meet friends. They have great drinks.
author: Studio R.

description:
Service: 5/5 - very friendly staff, our waiter was always there to check up on us, and the food didn't take more than 15 minutes to prepare. 

Food: 2/5 - where it matters most dosa falls short. We got a veggie samosa, lamb sliders, and some paneer wrap (can't remember the name). None of the dishes were that great. The lamb was good but very greasy. The other 2 plates were kinda meh. The samosa was especially disappointing. 

Location/ambiance: 4/5 - lots of places to explore nearby. Dosa is right in the middle of Japan town + there are lots of stores and bars if you go up Fillmore. The ambiance is also great. Spacious, upscale, and very nice decor.

Price: 3/5 - I don't mind how expensive a restaurant is if I feel like I got my money's worth. 3 small plates and 2 drinks ended up being around $90. Not super expensive but not cheap either. But for the quality of the food I don't think it's worth it. 

Summary: Dosa wasn't bad per se but with so many better Indian restaurants in the city I just can't justify ever coming back here again.
author: Ali A.

description:
It was a south Indian Food Craving Night.
But this place was an utter disappointment. It was a casual outdoor night and we made reservations for 8:30. We were right on time but it took their about 10 mins to get us seated. Reservations means you reserve a table.

We got seated and we were served some papadum. We were quite confused as to who out server was.
The waitress came to out table after 10 minutes. 

Food: We ordered, Sole fish, Dahi Vada, Idli Sambhar and Masala Dosa.
The fish was good served with salad on the side. The Sambar was my favorite as the sweetness on Sambhar reminded me of the sambar you get in india,
The Dahi Vada was a disappointment as the Vada was quite hard. I could tell the Vada was stale even though the presentation was quite good. The dosa was nice and crispy.

Service: The service was the worst part of the restaurant. More than talking to the customers the staff was talking to each other. There were about 5 different waiters who came to our table. The staff was quite unfriendly. Service makes a big difference in the experience of the customer. 
Dosa's management really needs to work on training their staff.
author: Kirandeep K.

description:
great place, really good ambiance and drinks for an Indian restaurant.
Good service but the receptionist messed up our validation so we had to pay 3 bucks each for our 3 cars that night! :(

The food was good- a bit pricy but good..
author: Bhoomi G.

description:
Such an excellent restaurant, Indian food refined and massaged with a buddha bar ambiance. 

Winter tasting menu leads relentlessly toward the spectacle of Dosa's lamb chops. 

Plus there's the Idli Sambar soup with free refills. 

Finally the Taj Mahal of drinks, the Bengali gimlet.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I went with a girlfriend and we had the $40 Family Style Menu
It was SO AMAZING. We were WOW'd by every single dish. I think the only dish that wasn't completely over the top spectacular was the chicken curry but it was still good.

My favorite was the Mung Bean Salad and the Korma Curry! 

gotta go back for a full size dosa next time!  and btw TONS of GF options here!!
warning, some of the dishes are on the spicy side for those of you who are spice wusses like me. I drank LOTS of water!

We also had an AMAZING waitress - Claudia.
She was SO helpful - as we were newbies to Dosa and had no idea what to order.
She was so attentive explaining the dishes before we ordered and even after they came to the table (all the different sauces etc)

Thank you Dosa for being my new FAVORITE GF restaurant.
It was a little more pricey than I"m used to but I definitely felt it was worth the price.
author: Win H.

description:
I have gone to DOSA before and always loved the food. I almost always get the meat dosa and some kind of curry and rice.

This time, we had bhel puri - which was perfect. not too sweet and not too wet, just right. we also had idli sambar - the sambar comes in a giant soup like bowl and they just had the green and red chutneys. it was great, but I missed the traditional white chutney. we also had the chennai chicken which was very tasty. 

finally, we had the plate of mixed uttapam and the lamb rolls. These were not that great. The lamb was okay by itself, but the roti it was rolled in was soggy from the curry and it was not very tasty. But maybe I am just a Calcutta girl used to my perfect egg mutton rolls. 

The uttapam was interesting. It was a collection of 5 mini uttapams chosen by the chef. I love uttapam and the idea of having many small ones to sample was perfect. Having said that, I probably only really enjoyed 2, the rest were just okay

I did have a big heartburn for a while after!

Service was very slow. They did not write down our orders and I think they forgot the rolls. We had to keep calling them to ask about when the next thing was coming. Music was a bit on the louder side.

In summary, nice place decent food. not superlative, but not bad at all
author: Prerona M.

description: Best South Indian food I've had in a while! Try the mixed chilly Utthapam (it's superrrrr spicy) and the garlic chili dosa. Excellent food and service! Can't wait to visit again.
author: Divya S.

description: My go to place for great Indian food (I lean more towards South Indian), a nice ambiance and cocktails. This is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. I am giving 4 stars because I think the service is hit or miss. But at the end of the day, I think DOSA is amazing!
author: Megan B.

description: Over rated place. I prefer authentic India food and this is the hybrid palette. More suited to a Western fine dining experience. If that's what you are looking for then it's great. Otherwise your money is better spent elsewhere. The dosa is average...
author: Uday K.

description: Food is good except that we have had to return the dosa and coffee a few times because it was served cold. BUT giving you a table is totally dependent on the mood of wanna be polite staff at the front desk. Two people walked in at 11.30 am for brunch when the place was totally empty and the woman ( in a very pretentious accent) said they weren't taking walk ins that day!!!!! Why??? Coz by god's grace they had enough reservations so everybody else can go to hell... ( she obviously didn't say that but certainly implied) . Have been there with a reservation and have to wait at the bar atleast 30 minutes. Would not recommend as a place for weekends.
author: Neha K.

description:
We live in the Mission and go to the Valencia Dosa often but last night we saw a film at the Kabuki and thought we would pop into this location. The menu is much more extensive. That being said I got a favorite - the paper dosa - but did try a chicken samosa. My husband got the paneer and pea dosa. I also had a fabulous cocktail - their twist on a gin and tonic that included tonic infused with fig and cardamom - wow. 

The best part was the exceptional service. We walked in and it was Friday night. One of the hosts kept his eye out on the bar (first come first serve) for us but we ended up at the community table. Our server was a delight. Gracious, caring and top notch. She was truly a gem. She was busy but still took time for a chat. Both she and the host were truly exceptional.
author: holly B.

description:
Whatever I ate (calamari, tomato salad, mushroom utapaan) went RIGHT through me at my next place out and about!!!
I have never had such an emergency in public, almost literally s*** my pants. Thank god the one bathroom was open.
Will not go back because of that. 
But, one star goes to our informative, attentive bar tender. Kudos to him! He was cool, calm and collected on a busy Friday dinner hour.
author: Kitty O.

description: This upscale southern Indian restaurant has a great selection of many delicious dishes. Start with one of their signature cocktails and the chutney sampler with your papadum. Next, the lamb sliders are the best thing I've had here. Sharing a dosa and uttapam rounds out your meal for two.
author: Kevin S.

description: Fantastic dosas as well as other menu items including Chennai chicken, Lamb, and Frankie rolls.  Excellent freshness, food quality, and preparation. Place is always packed but worth a wait. Keep it simple and get the traditional Dosa, can't go wrong.  Great for gluten free eaters with many options.
author: Shariq H.

description: I heard good reviews about the place and went there for Friday night dinner with my wife. Food was awesome and very close to Indian taste. Even though the food was of high quality and taste, the service was really bad. I ordered 2 appetizers and a lime soda ( which was not on menu, but suggested by waitress). We also ordered the sparkling water. It came right away. But lime soda took 15 min. After that we added the main course to the order. Even after 20 min we didn't get the appetizer. Instead we got one main course item. I told the waitress we want the appetizer first. After 10 min again the guy from kitchen got a main course item. I got angry and asked them why there is such a chaos and I am not satisfied with their order management. The waitress apologized for the chaos and made both appetizers on the house. After that, we got the appetizers and shortly main course. Finally, we ordered a dessert and Masala Chai. After some time a waiter told that, masala chai takes longer time. So I cancelled it. The dessert is another disaster. We ordered pistachio. They gave a spoon for it. It was so hard that, instead of spoons, we asked them for knife and fork. Also, the waiters were not frequently checking upon us.
author: Sunil A.

description: Great Dosas. Most of the menu is not traditional-- everything has an interesting, local twist. Definitely worth trying. The Fillmore location is larger / classier looking than the Valencia location.
author: Nick R.

description: $30 plate with nasty tap water?! I swear I get better water at Denny's! On top that, the service was horrible! I informed 3 people that I want a refill on my coke since that's the only thing drinkable, only  to wait 15 minutes and finish my dry food without liquid. BYOW(bring your own water) and don't expect service. Management: step your game up, don't overcharge people and be cheap when it comes to water
author: Mike J.

description: Every time I come to.Dosa I leave full, in the best way. The sauces are exquisite and they source delicious natural items, fused together to delight the tongue. Yum.
author: Zara S.

description: Dosa on Fillmore is pretty darn good, but do you see the three $$$ for this place?  It's cause you don't get a lot of bang for your buck.  I enjoyed the white truffle masala, not so much the chicken korma (which was inexplicably expensive).  But overall, I'm excited about this place.  It's pretty apparent that they care about quality.
author: Angel S.

description: I really enjoyed this restaurant. It was nice to experience different Indian cuisine than I am usually able to get. The service was great and the prices are really reasonable for the quality.
author: Andee S.

description: Ordering on yelp doesn't work. They are always too busy. Got calls from yelp to say can't reach restaurant. Also they require reservations for communal tables as well
author: Viral C.

description:
This place has literally been on my bucket list since I moved to SF 3.5 years ago. Even having visited South India, South Indian food is a bit foreign compared to the traditional North Indian curries that we are all used to. I decided to give this place a shot this past weekend for brunch.

THE DRINKS: I tried one of their "spice" cocktails and my boyfriend had their version of a bloody mary. Neither of us were particularly happy with our drinks. I applaud Dosa for trying to do something different with their cocktails but they went too heavy on the spices. I should have just stuck with a normal mimosa. They don't offer any unlimited mimosa option which is disappointing.

THE FOOD: We started with the idli sambar (veggie version) and poori. Both were excellent! The poori reminded me of a Mexico sopaipilla and I dipped it in the idli. Then we both got uttapams - my boyfriend an egg one and me a mushroom one. The bf felt that the uttampam masked the taste of the eggs a bit too much. I was a big fan of my mushroom one though - I'm vegan and they were able to modify. Both came with an interesting mix of sauces.

This place is also super vegan, vegetarian, and allergy friendly which is great.

Prices are definitely a bit high but service is good and I would definitely come back. Portions are pretty big so I had leftovers to take home.

Thanks Dosa for helping me branch out from my typical samosas, channa masala, etc. etc.
author: Sarah S.

description:
5 stars just because of Kevin!! What a pleasant and fun person! The best to have around when you're enjoying such great food. He made great suggestions, kept us entertained, made sure we were taken care of, and kept us very happy :)

Food is always good! Keema Dosa and chennai chicken are the way to go. 

Just make reservations so you can have an overall pleasant night :)
author: Shireen J.

description:
Fantastic food.  This was our third time to the restaurant.  Our first was during Restaurant Week 2013.  Great three course meal with wine pairings - I'd recommend trying it out during Restaurant Week (f.k.a. "Dine About Town") if you have yet to try out this restaurant.  Our second time was shortly after that - we had been blown away by the quality of the food the first time, so my husband and I booked a date night at the location on Fillmore.  Once again, AMAZING experience.  This past time we went with another couple.  I think this was my favorite experience thus far, as we opted to do family style and ended up being able to try several different dishes.  

Here's the items we tried:

Shredded Duck (5 stars) - spiciest of the dishes we tried (which I loved, as I'm a fan of spicy foods); the flavors were so well balanced and complex, pairs perfectly with the sauces (which helped tame down the spice).

Fresh Seafood Vada (4.5 stars) - so fresh and light, with a great kick of spice.  

Chutney Sampler (4 stars) - All of the sauces were spectacular and full of flavor, with a range of spiciness.  All of them were great.

Sweet Potato Dosa (4.5 stars) - This was my favorite dosa of the evening.  The sweet potatoes were so soft and creamy, and I loved the ginger flavor.

Spicy Basil Dosa (3.5 stars) - This was in my opinion not as good as the sweet potato dosa.   Still good, just didn't have the same creaminess, and I preferred the flavor profile of the other dosa better.  Wish we would have gotten the white truffle dosa instead of this one, as we've had that before and it's fantastic.

Tamil Lamb (4.5 stars) - Such an excellent dish.  Once again, great flavors/spices, and the lamb was oh so tender.

Prawn Masala (5 stars) - The best dish of the night.  The coconut sauce was to die for, and the prawns were perfectly cooked.  And the coconut rice that came with it was excellent - went back for thirds on this dish ;)

My personal favorites were the shredded duck starter and the prawn masala.  But honestly, every single dish was fantastic.  

A must go if you haven't been.  Can't wait to try out the DOSA on Valencia, which is a short walk from where I live.  The location on Valencia is more "cozy" and small whereas the one on Fillmore is more trendy and kind of an "experience."  Both have their own charm - just depends on what you're feeling more in the mood for :)
author: Rachael S.

description: Our waitress was seriously overworked, which resulted in seriously sketchy service and mistakes with orders. The food was OK, but do you really want dosas w/ truffle oil? The effort to go culinarily "global" strikes me as pretentious. Oh, and the "market salad" (some greens carelessly thrown together) would have been a mistake at any price, especially this one. Makes me yearn for the simple places that dot NYC's Little India.
author: Bob G.

description: First time we ate at this resturant. The lamb chop is spicy hot which overwhelmed the meat. The price is too high and the quality of food so do. Somehow they dictate their own tips without my knowledge BAD!
author: Bee L.

description:
I really like this restaurant, and I feel as if in some ways, this location is more successful than the Mission location. First, the space is much larger. It's elegant without being overdone, and not fussy at all. Think high ceilings, large banquettes, and generous tables. The space is really quite beautiful. 

Next, the food is just excellent. I like the Mission location's food too, but there are more offerings here--super appetizers (samosas = yummy), generous dosas with tasty fillings, delicious curries, and elegant entrees. Their salads are good, too. I've enjoyed several and have never been disappointed. I *love* the keema dosa, but the potato-based fillings are excellent, too. Even better, everything is so reasonably priced (between $12 and $15 per dosa or uttapam; it's between $20 and $32 for the entrees, which I've never felt the need to order because the dosas are so darn good!). 

Each time I've been, my servers have been friendly and knowledgeable. I've also had some stellar drinks from the bar (an excellent sidecar and some very good wine). Add easy parking at the Kabuki to the mix (which is harder at their Valencia location despite that parking garage on 21st), and this is just a winning space. I will be back--many, many times.
author: Lis B.

description:
There are no shortage of Indian restaurants in the bay area but Southern Indian food is surprisingly different to find. Whoever came up with the business idea to bring the staple southern Indian fare to such a trendy spot is just pure ingenious. DOSA is truly one of a kind in the city (not counting its sister restaurant Dosa on Valencia of course).

The restaurant is huge. There is a spacious bar, communal tables, lounging area as well as plenty of tables in two floors. Even then, the restaurant is a complete full house on the weekends. Reservation is not too too difficult to come by. Just need to call a few days in advance. Walk in or same day reservation might be possible but do not count on it. You don't want to wait for 45 minutes do you?

The food was good. Very authentic in taste with much welcomed Californian twist featuring many locally sourced, farm fresh or organic ingredients. I can't say it was the best Southern Indian food I have had in the area. I could still name a handful of restaurants that would beat them in taste and price. However, none of those restaurants match this level of service and quality. You are paying extra for the service, excellent wine list and a nice ambiance. Let me tell you, it is totally worth it. 

The tasting menu is great for first timers. The portion is adjusted smaller so you get to try more things. Otherwise, just one order of their dosa could easily fill you up.

I love the energetic ambiance but the tables were a little too close together for comfort. It is a fun place to bring your date to but not a place you could enjoy a more intimate and private conversation.
author: Mona W.

description: We stopped in here before doing the Escape for the Room game for appetizers and drinks.  The thing that stood out the most was how helpful the people working here were.  They were very fast and friendly and accommodating.  The food and cocktails were delicious.  I especially loved the spicy chicken and samosas.  I loved the sauces they brought out as complimentary as well - especially the cilantro one.  Thank you to everyone who was working that night in the bar area.
author: Amanda K.

description: Absolutely delicious! My girlfriend and I came here for dinner while vacationing in the city. We chose family style dinner. You get to pick a certain amount of options from different categories including dessert.  I highly recommend getting the scallops and upgrading to the lamb, they are both excellent! Try their ginger beer cocktail too! The staff are very friendly and the restaurant is very clean and the decor is very nice! A must try!
author: Josue R.

description:
Ate here on a Monday night with my girlfriend and the place was packed, which clearly that says something about the quality of the food. My girlfriend is South Indian and so with pretty high standards to begin with, this place met all expectations and then some. We ordered the Paneer and Peas Dosa which was amazing. The quantity and presentation of the food itself is something to be spoken for. We also ordered the Lamb Keema dosa which was subpar but and may have been better if it wasn't served on the side of the paper dosa. 

Along with the main entree, we had three appetizers: the Chennai Chicken, Dahi Vada, and Idli Fries. All three tasted great, but we especially enjoyed the Idli Fries because of its unique texture and twist on typical finger food. We would definitely recommend this place again and say it's a must-visit for anyone looking for fusion Indian food.
author: Anand D.

description: This place was on my friends' list of places to eat. Great ambience and shorter wait time than initially told. Food - vada pav was great (esp. considering I grew up eating them in Mumbai); dosa/sambar was very spicy. And we didn't order the fiery hot rasam! Mango sorbet was yummy as well. Caveat - I am that Indian who cannot eat a lot of spicy food! Would love to go back but will definitely ask for less spicy sambar!
author: Subba K.

description: My 15 year old son and I had lunch here about a week ago and I was very pleased with this place. The food was great! The dosa was perfect. Although, I felt they could have had a bit more filling inside the dosa. The prices were fair. The inside of the restaurant was clean, open and very nice. The staff were all friendly and professional. I can't wait to go back.
author: John K.

description: Came here with some teammates after a tiring day of work - we had reservations at the long table next to the bar which was convenient. We had many dishes that were vegetarian since many on our team don't eat meat. We started off with complimentary chips that came with 4 sauces - my favorite was the green one that had a kick to it. The samosas were delicious with the green sauce! Since everything was pre-ordered before I got there, I am unable to share the name of each dish, but I have photos that are attached! The second appetizer was almost like fries, but it was a fried vegetable (couldn't make out what it is) with chili powder all over making it quite spicy and crunchy. We started our course with pancakes that were all vegetarian - 5 pieces with each a different ingredient: mushroom, tomato, etc. I dove into the soup that came with the dishes which had a kick to it but it was sooooo good! Probably my favorite dish next to the chicken curry with naan! There was also a crepe that had lamb or pumpkin in it, but I didn't try the lamb and thought the pumpkin tasted a bit bland, but sauces and that bomb soup came with it so it made everything alllll better! The meal was delicious and very authentic with prompt service! Definitely worth a visit!
author: Amanda C.

description:
Overrated, service is good. Food is not up to the mark
Nice decide and location. But the dosage are too crispy and not what u expect. Pander Frankie was a disaster, made with tamarind chutney. Someone tell them that Frankie is not a chat item.
author: Vamsi G.

description:
Excellent south indian/north indian fusion fare that is consistently good. I have been here a few times now and never been disappointed. Service is quick and they have a nice bar as well. It's not cheap by any standards but most nice places in SF aren't!

Reservations are a must!
author: Kabir S.

description: really tasty biryani, nice atmosphere,  except a sloppy drunk put a damper on the evening. will return for the food.
author: Steven D.

description: Dosa was good but oily. The Madras Coffee was okay. Good for one-time only experience
author: Smr K.

description:
Thank you Dosa on Fillmore for having an amazing selection of vegetarian-friendly dinner and brunch options; for consistently adding new menu items (appetizer salads and dessert mostly); for employing happy people; for making my go-to drink (the Divya cocktail) perfect every time; for staying open late when every other restaurant in the area has been long closed; and for always keeping my taste buds satisfied.  

Keep up the excellent work, and I will keep coming back.  Bring back the banana creme pie, and I will never leave :-)
author: Gev M.

description:
Upscale restaurant. We went during lunch hour but on weekend. You are in San Fransisco, so feel lucky if you get parking easily and close by. Most spots around are pay and park by meter. 
There was around 30-40 minutes of wait time. After we get a table, first thing we realize, yes ambiance is good but the place is too much crowded and waiters are steering through the narrow spaces between two tables. The food was ok - ok. Nothing special to mention about it as compared to price and quantity.

Bottom line - Have had better 'dosa' at other places than here...
author: Gaurav N.

description:
Okay, first things first... giving credit where credit is due... the food was amazing. Every single dish was delicious, aesthetically pleasing, and served hot. From a flavors/textures/yum factor, this place is WAY up there.

But the service... God... the service...

Now understandably, it was a challenging day. There was a Ramen Festival about 10 feet away from their front door and as a result, the street was closed off, there were people outside everywhere. We get that. Also, because of said event, traffic was nightmarish. It cost me almost $20 in an Uber to go 1.8 miles to Dosa today, a drive that would normally be about five bucks. And we hopped out and walked the last block, because that last block would have taken us another ten minutes in the car. Fair enough.

But our party of eleven trickled in as best we could under said circumstances, as people were helplessly stuck in gridlock and/or desperately seeking parking. Like everyone else at the restaurant, we were doing the best we could to get there and get seated.

And the restaurant just wouldn't quit bugging us about when our party would arrive. Now, we had 8 people there out of a party of eleven. Food was being ordered. Cocktails were being ordered. We weren't only NOT squatting, but we were still a large party ordering a lot of food and spending a lot of cash.

But part of the reason lunch took so long, and actually the part more responsible for the delay than our transportation issues, was that EVERY time we wanted to order more of something, or someone new arrived and had to order, it took FOREVER. Half of our orders had to be placed again, 15 minutes later, on three separate occasions because someone on the staff dropped the ball. Reminders were not handled gracefully. Coffee was never refilled, until the third time asking. A few times we (very politely) asked the staff to take new orders, were told to wait, and never returned to.

Delicious food, good location, reasonable prices, and beautiful aesthetic. But why didn't anyone bother to train the waitstaff to wait tables?
author: Sean B.

description:
I have been dying to come here since moving to the area.  I booked a reservation for Valentines Day a couple weeks ahead of time.  When we arrived we were seated right away, even at 6pm this place was PACKED.  The bar area is large and on a non-holiday would probably have plenty of seats.  

They were doing a tasting menu that night for 58$ a person, but I already had a bunch of plates I wanted to try and not many were on the tasting menu.  To start out I had the gin & tonic- it was delicious!  I forget what was in the tonic but it was homemade and totally delicious!  The cocktails are expensive, I felt like the gin & tonic was worth the 12$ but looking around some of the other cocktails were super small and would have been a little disappointing.  They also had a lot of wines and the selection was pretty good.  

We ordered a ton of food:

Lamb Sliders- 5 stars!  This was the best dish of them all.  I wasn't really wanting to order them but then decided at the last minute.  IT came with 2 sliders and then a ghee (butter) and spices which you mix together to make a paste.  We dipped our sliders in the paste- OH MY GOSH!  So Amazing!  THe bread was delicious and fresh and the lamb was so tender and perfectly cooked.  WE both seriously considered ordering several more of these!

Duck Flatbread- Duck vindaloo on top of uttapum...very delicious but small portion.  Not really flatbread more of like half an English muffin size.  The flavor was good and perfectly spiced.

Truffle masala Dosa- I was really excited about this dish.  The different sauces were SOOOO good.  I also like the Dosa, it is HUGE!  I could smell the truffles as soon as they sat it down! I loved pulling it a part and making combinations of sauces, so delicious!

Vegetarian Meatballs- I forget what this dish was actually called but it was panneer,squash, and almond "meatballs" in a creamy korma type sauce.  I ordered in with coconut rice.  I loved it!  It definitely had some spice- I would say I am medium wimp about spice and none of these dishes were uncomfortable to me.  We got a side of fry bread and it was the perfect combination.

Lamb dish- Again I forget the name, but it was the lamb dish (NOT the lamb chops).  It was tender lamb pieces in a dark vindaloo sauce.  We ordered it with the lemon rice and it was a really unique combination.  The lamb again was cooked to perfection.  This was probably the spiciest dish of them all but again nothing too awful.

Overall the service, drinks, food, and ambiance all together is a definite 5 stars.  Its pricey for Indian food but when considering the quality of the food you are getting I think the price is justified.  I cannot wait to go back and try more dishes!!
author: Kate F.

description:
Oily food and Deceptive Billing

Had visited dosa recently with couple of friends for lunch. We ordered a couple of dishes such as dosas - masala dosa and Rava dosa. All the items were very oily - there was oil all over the plate and on our hands after the meal. We have been to several South Indian restaurants and never had such an oily experience while ordering dosas.

Also be careful about their billing practices - as for any group over with 4 or more people they will try to get DOUBLE TIP (20% SVC charge added on bill and on the credit card statement will have another column for gratutity). Actually the service charge is same as the gratuity but they are trying to deceive the customer by using different terms so they end up double tipping.
author: Reliable R.

description:
First of all, it's a pretty classy place. In most cases, when I'm craving for Indian food, I would prefer a place that is bustling with noise, peoples' chat and so on (I grew up in Bangladesh and I value this sort of lively noise :) ). But if you want to enjoy Indian food in a classy way for a special event, this place does a pretty good job. We were a group of 5 people and thus got to try out many different dishes. For appetizers, I thought Vada Pav was EXCELLENT. It's like a slider with spiced potato patty inside. As you can imagine, the way you make the patty is the most crucial thing here and I felt one can't do better than this! But my only negative feeling was the slider bun was a bit too oily and I felt a little bit of discomfort when I was holding it. But overall I would give A+ on this dish.
My friend tried out Idli fries. I tried only one of those. It was descent. I think it should have been spicier inside. I felt it was a bit blunt. 

For the main dish, I had Paneer and Peas Dosa. It was really good. The paneer was crunchy and along with the chutneys, it was marvelous. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Make sure you have this with both the coconut and the tomato chutney together. The samber, that came along with this, was also excellent. It was spicy as it should be and the thickness of the curry was optimal. BTW, when you are having dishes like dosa, upattam, just avoid too much use of silverwares. Indian foods, especially foods of this kind, are meant to be eaten by hand and if you need to concentrate too much on the fork and knife to have these delicate dishes, your mind won't have the time to savor the taste :)

After all these, we had the legendary Madras Coffee. I didn't know much about it but my friend, whose family is from South India, commented, "you judge a South Indian restaurant by it's Madras coffee". It was my first time having Madras coffee, and being a huge fan of coffee, I must say, this is one of the best kind of coffees I have ever had. So, if you come here GET this coffee. But there is one thing I think Dosa can improve on. They gave the coffee in British style cups and that made the coffee lukewarm. Even though I really liked the coffee, my friend's parents (expert on Madras coffee) and I think it would have tasted MUCH better if it were super hot. They also explained to me that in India, people serve this coffee on metal cups in traditional ways. Given the classy level of this restaurant, I think Dosa should put effort to serve this South Indian signature coffee in more traditional way!

For dessert, we had Rasmalai, Panna Cotta and House-made Gelato and Sorbet. Bangladesh and India are known for their famous sweet dishes and when I was in Bangladesh, rasmalai was my MOST favorite sweet dish. If you don't try rasmalai in your lifetime, you will regret even after you die and the rasmalai at Dosa was EXCELLENT. The sweet cheese patties were optimally soft, juicy and when you pour that in your mouth, you just feel that juicy cream coming out of the patty. Just close your eyes and fill that moment! 

While the rasmalai was great, we all felt the panna cotta was terrible mostly due the "spicy" taste in it. In India/Bangladesh, all the desserts are known for it's sweetness and adding sambal chili in the panna cotta just ruined it. When you pour it in your mouth, you don't fill the spicy taste first but as you swallow it, the spiciness kicks in the throat and it's just weird and just ruins the dessert mood. The gelato was good but nothing special. It was more like a "Kulfi" in Bangladesh/India. But lastly, I would just say that, if you come here and crave for dessert after you meal, just go with the rasmalai. You can never go wrong with it, especially when you are at Dosa.

As far as the restaurant environment goes, it was pretty nice and relaxing. I really liked the overall design, decoration and lighting of the place. It's also duplex and from top it looks beautiful. My only complaint was some of the camera photographs hanging on the walls. Most of those are pictures of poor, struggling working people in India and even though the pictures represent the true picture of the majority in  the Indian sub-continent, I just felt hanging these pictures in a rich-classy restaurant like this with dazzling lights and bars were insulting to these people who struggle to get two meals a day on in their real life. This just didn't feel right to me.
author: Ishfaq H.

description: Food was amazing, though the bread was a little greasier than normal. Service was spotty and a bit pushy in suggesting drinks, etc., though the water boy was attentive!
author: SK L.

description:
Limited variety but great food...  This place has best lamb biryani in USA... 
wish they open more branches in other cities...
author: Jaipal R.

description:
6 discerning eaters: prefer organic, some wheat/gluten intolerances, one can't do eggs, one avoids meat when able, blah blah blah...
And we were ALL totally satisfied & impressed with their patience, service & communication. We had new twists on several old favorites and it was down right Delish!! Can't wait to take my son & hubby!! Or just another group of picky girlfriends ... Cuz I know everyone will enjoy it!
author: T-Cooki C.

description: I love the uttapam and dosas at this restaurant.  They aren't too heavy, yet they are full of flavor.  They also have some very interesting cocktails.  The ambiance is great!
author: Herb G.

description: Our first visit to DOSA and it exceeded our expectations.  The Vada Pav was the best vegetarian patty I have had.  We had the roasted garlic and chile, rava masala and lamb keema dosas and the mixed mushroom and truffle oil uttapam.  All were delicious but the uttapam and the roasted garlic and chile dosa were the standouts.  Sean, our server, was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and provided excellent service.  Best Indian food we have had, we will be back.
author: Cindy N.

description:
Food could be better. 
This place looks fancy BUT why it is that bad smell??

Like cheap corner restaurant. 
Tables are like in canteen. 
This place is definitely good for huge companies (10ppl)

Not recommend for romantic evening. 
Smell is bad. No smell is terrible.
Food is ok but price...
author: Marianna P.

description: Was excited to try but when we sat down and had to wait 20 minutes to order any food or drinks. Had three orders of the free Papadam delivered, so I wish the busboys were the waiters. Finally ordered two appetizers and then another long delay so we left. Hard to review their food when they don't take your order. They were nice and apologized but service was bad. Might have been training new people that night which could have impacted ability to get to the tables.  Manager offered to provide some freebies like desert but we did not take her up on it as we were still hungry for dinner first. She was nice but hard to overcome the waiter, Richard's, poor service. Will not be returning to try again. That is a shame as it looks like the food is tasty based on the ratings.
author: Mark L.

description:
I enjoyed the unique variety of dosa options on the menu. 

Must try:
-vada pav
-spicy mung masala
author: Mansi K.

description: I went here for the first time with my friend. Restaurant looks really good from outside and it feels more simple when you get in. It is dark inside and you may think that its romantic bit it's really not because tables for two are next to each other. So literally you can hear what you neighbors are talking about. The food was really tasty and good. But its sooo over priced!
author: Jessie P.

description: Had a quick lunch here on a weekday. It was more upscale than I realized. It was a really nice space. Service was great. They had a ton of dosas. I had the sweet potato and it was really good. They give you four dipping sauces. Each were very good.
author: Jen G.

description:
This is a type of restaurant, you would love to take someone on a date as well as family dinners. The vibe you get as soon as you walk in is I need to dress up! The ambience is so beautiful that you yourself want to dress up. For me the ambience won the heart because it is rare to see Indian restaurant with high ceilings and have double floors. 

Appetizer: idli and Sambhar- it was delicious. Sambhar had that spicy and sweet flavor. I honestly think it was the best south Indian sambhar I have had that had full on south Indian touch. Every other place, you can taste the flavor have the twist of either punjabi of gujarati to it as per the chef. Idli was moist and perfect. Chutney for me is what lacked flavor. For me it was blend. I would suggest to add little more spicy flavor to it. 

Entrees: We wanted Hyderabadi biryani but they ran out of it. Hyberabadi Lamb Chops, Karaikudi Chicken Korma and Habanero- Mango Dosa. Each of the dishes definitely hit the spot. Lamb chops were so tender and perfect. The potato vegetable was spicy and tangy. It went well with lemon rice. The chicken Korma was sweet and spicy and mixing with lemon rice burst mix of flavors in your mouth. Habanero mango Dosa was spicy and tangy. The potato filling was perfect. 

The restaurant is worth eating at. Service is good and very attentive.
author: Jenesha M.

description:
Yum. I'm a sucker for high-end Indian food. The decor is immaculate, and the food is great. The service is a little slow for such a high-end restaurant, which is the reason for knocking down a star. The spicy garlic dosa is (shock) SPICY. Make sure you eat it with the potatoes. I had to get a lassi (which was excellent) to help with the heat. The bhel puri was ridiculously good and beautifully presented. 
A little expensive, but well worth it
author: Samir K.

description: The food was okay, way overpriced for what it was and the portions were pretty small. I hated the fact that our water tasted like dirty tap water. The atmosphere is supposed to be romantic (lights dimmed aaaall the way down... darkest restaurant I've been to) but the tables are arranged way too close together to get any privacy. I mean, the people next to us seemed to be distracted by our every move and anything we said. It's an upscale restaurant and my boyfriend and I definitely got a few glares for being able to afford to eat there. Altogether it was just a really uncomfortable experience that the okay food definitely didn't make up for. We left this place feeling bad about spending so much money on such a mediocre time.
author: Vaishali R.

description:
This review is a long time coming. I could have really given5 stars soon after my first visit to this place, but I opted to wait instead. Now that I have been here several times, it will do justice. 

Decor is really great with good (not great) music playing in the background. 

Service is fine too. The servers don't get individual tips here, but they share. Which is great, but that does give the same amount to a person who did not do well. 

Coming to food. They have great selection of cocktails which in my opinion are over priced. $12 dollars for drink is fine, but the amount should live up to the price that we pay. It really comes like just u get a tasting of the cocktail in those many dollars. 
Initially I was impressed with their food, but soon after I noticed that the goodness wasn't consistent. I ordered a veg kofta which was way too salty, and one of the days the sambhar was too thick. When they say they changed menu they simply change some ingredients here and there which is more seasonal. In my opinion Dosa on Valencia serves better dosas than this place. I would love to see a major spin on the menu that they have now.
author: Deeba A.

description: It's tough to get a reservation here, so we ended up sitting at the bar for dinner, but WOW! We had an amazing experience and were so impressed by both the food and cocktails. The menu gives you specifics on dietary preferences (dairy free, egg free, gluten free, nut free and vegan) so ordering with any preferences at all is so easy -- and actually really enjoyable! The white truffle masala dosa was probably our favorite menu item. For cocktails, try the Steph Curry or Peony, award-winning signature drinks on the cocktail menu. The space is large and airy with walls of windows and high ceilings. Definitely a place we'll be going back!
author: Rachel N.

description:
The ambiance of this place is fantastic. The decor, the music, the entire atmosphere was great. We were seated quickly (had a reservation) and was greeted by our waiter. (1 stars) 

Our waiter was a little odd to say the least. He would always mumble and it took 35 minutes to get a glass of water. 

Let's move onto the food. The appetizers were good and had a great kick to it. We had the lamb sliders as well as a chicken dish (name escapes me). (1 star)

The entree was where I and my date completely regret coming. The food was absolutely horrendous. We immediately asked for the bill and left to a different, but better Indian restaurant. The waiter concerned, asked why we asked for our check early. I completely being honest told him the food was horrible. There was no taste, extremely oily, and was cold. I have had dosas from other places, so I know how they are supposed to taste. 
We paid the entire bill (no need to comp the entrees) hoping they read this and hopefully experiment with better chefs. I really wish I could have a better experience here, but I WILL NEVER BE BACK. I'm sorry, but I have lost all hope for this place.
author: Shaneel A.

description: No bueno. BF and I had dinner here a few nights ago and both got mild food poisioning from one of the chicken apps. Will not be returning.
author: Lauren T.

description:
I have to start with the fact that I usually don't leave bad reviews for business. It's ether good or nothing. But not this time!

Pros:
Very Nice Decoration
Very nice bar
Nice Wine verity
Large food menu
Very High quality Lamb meat
I tried some kind of Lager beer that was pretty good

Cons:
Absolutely overrated place - 2 Glasses of wine + 2 Beers + 1 Entrée + $5 Yogurt that I never ordered + tax + 20% tip that was charged upfront = $100.55 REALLY??? Why???

No tap beers at all

All the food is ridiculously spicy (HOT!!!)

The most plane rice I ever had

Potatoes that came with my meal were ok or maybe even less than ok

The service was pretty good but with a bit of attitude

The rest of the food that 6 of our other friends ordered tasted almost the same even though they were completely different dishes and again SPICY, TOO SPICY, WAY TOO SPICY !!!

I'm not the biggest fan of spicy, but I'm ok with eating spicy food like other Indian, Thai or Mexican. In our group of 8 people absolutely no one enjoyed their food.

I think I've been before in Indian buffet with a better food.



I'm FOR SURE not coming back there ever again and would DEFINITELY not recommend it to anyone else to try it out
author: Ernest S.

description: Mango harbanero dosa and idli fries. Hella good. Saffron Icecream paired with prosceco. Perfect.
author: Deepika S.

description: Coming from an Indian girl who has had real authentic Indian food, this place does not live up to good Indian food standards. This is an Americanized version of Indian foods, which is why it looks interesting. They have different food options that you would not see at a normal Indian restaurant. They don't have many curry options but they have a wide variety of dosa flavors. The food was very very bland, and the service honestly sucked. When we asked our waited for salt, he looked very confused and brought out a plastic container with salt in it. When asked if the restaurant carries salt shakers, he responded with "I can't find them right now"- this is the first restaurant I have ever been to in my life that does not carry salt and pepper shakers. The decor, in my opinion, was super offensive. There were pictures of kids in the streets and close ups of old people who looked sad. What is the point of these pictures??? It was depicting India in a very negative way and people should not photograph poverty for use of decoration. I would not go back to this place and do not recommend to people looking for real and GOOD Indian food because this place sucks.
author: Divya K.

description:
I cannot begin to tell you how bad our experience was at this restaurant! I don't understand the glowing reviews other yelpers are giving this place, nor can I understand the massive crowds it attracts.
First, the waiter. He seemed nice and friendly enough at first but when we said we didn't want alcoholic drinks the service dropped off. We explained that we wanted to go with a tapas style dinner, but when he recommended dishes we didn't like because of the ingredients, didn't give us good advice.  We rarely saw him throughout our time at the restaurant. He didn't check to see if our dishes arrived or if we liked them.  Part of this was because he was waiting on the entire second floor, but he seemed to have time for certain "favorites" like the guy next to us.
Next, the food. We eat Nepalese, Tibetan and Indian food regularly. This was an attempt to modernize and reinvent Indian ingredients in a novel way, but the food did not have the favors billed. Seasoning was heavy handed on the idli fries. A complementary dish of pappadum arrived without any chutneys, for which there is an additional $5 charge.The lemongrass scallops-2- arrived in a sea of Campbell's tomato soup with a few sad arugula leaves and no lemongrass taste. The chef must have been embarrassed because he hid them under a cone of naan.  
I see that someone else had a similarly bad experience three days ago and her review was dumped. 
The manager did comp us on the idli fries but never came over to apologize. We had to hustle the waiter to pay our bill. Glad we live where we can get terrific East Asian food.
author: Barb L.

description:
So I previously wrote a tiny review just saying it was ok.  Yelp decided to remove my review.

On that note I will say that the food and the experience were just ok.  Everyone was nice enough but I felt like I was just there.  The food was interesting.  The spices overpower the food.  I adore Indian food and am always up to try new places.  But I don't think we will go back.  That's what I meN by it was just ok.
author: Elsie T.

description: Good South Indian Food. It is clean and has a good service. This place also has a good ambiance, but we went on a weekend and the tables were put too close to each other.
author: Manushri S.

description:
Since one of my friends really wanted to have the chocolate-hazelnut dosa, we made it a point to visit Dosa in San Francisco. But we ended up at the wrong branch since that's available only at Dosa on Valencia. 
We'd already had a tough time getting a parking spot on Fillmore so we stayed back to eat at this one instead. 

A few of us were apprehensive about eating here considering the Indo-Americanized food and it's steep prices but sat down nevertheless. Ordered vada pav, masala dosa, spicy basil masala dosa, spicy moong dosa and uttappam. 

Vada pav was delicious! 
Masala dosa was very tasty too. The potato curry and coconut chutney were top notch, whereas the sambar and tomato chutney were not. 
Uttappam was served in small portions which looked weird and apparently tasted odd too. 
Spicy basil masala dosa was not as spicy. 
Moong dosa was okay-ish. 

For dessert and later, we had rasmali and masala chai. 
The chai was pathetic - nowhere close to Indian chai. 
Rasmali was super creamy and delicious. 

Definitely worth coming back.
author: Stingaph G.

description:
This place had some good things going for it, and then some neutral things.

Good:
- Restaurant is very aesthetically appealing, in all ways
- Great menu, everything looked really good and it was hard to narrow down
- Papadum. yum.

Neutral:
- Dining companion and I ordered different dosas. His marsala dosa came out big and overflowing the plate, and my paneer dosa came small and tightly wrapped. Wish we had known this difference up front.
- Paneer dosa seemed slightly dry and lacking in texture. Even when dipped in the sauces, it still seemed to miss some kind of structure or relief from the soft texture. It was good and tasty, just wished for some structure or crunch.
- Side order of poori was average, small portion for price

Meh:
-We ordered, and our food was out in 10 minutes. We had timed it with a movie at kabuki but then we had, 45 minutes to kill. Our reservation was at restaurant's opening time but we felt rushed by it coming out so quickly (though I didn't feel though that was the intention, waiter acknowledged its speedy arrival).

Overall experience was good, mostly due to setting and ambiance.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Tasty and flavorful food can not make up for poor service! Save your money and go elsewhere!

I used to come here periodically many years ago and had felt then that there was a service bias toward a certain clientele (read white affluent) that I was not a part of. I love the food and the Dosa's are amazing, but I had stayed away for years because I moved away and I never felt welcomed. I recently came back for a celebration dinner, give them another try, but was disappointed again.

Here comes the rant:
1) My party arrived shortly after opening and was seated promptly but no waiter or service staff greeted us until a good 10 minutes after being seated. There were around 5 seated tables at the time.
2) There was not a single moment when a waiter nor service staff offered any of their complementary pappadum's. I had to ask for both plates and padapum's after our family style orders have arrived. I was annoyed that the tables next to us appeared to have been provided padapum's and plates promptly even though they were seated after my party AND was served by the same waiter. Those tables were asked frequently if they wanted refill padapum's. We got zero asks! This has happened before many times. If you don't want to offer them for free, charge for it! Don't eagerly offer it to some tables and not for others!
3) FRUIT FLY's! Occasional fruit flies were flying here and there. One landed in a alcoholic drink. Yes, this is the Fillmore but come on, the door is not open right? How are you handling waste in the kitchen?
4) Overall slow service from the start. Things seemed to flow a little better after I flagged someone down about the fruit fly, maybe they wanted to kick us out.

I keep asking myself, why do I feel unwanted? Conscious bias? Unconscious bias? Is it because I don't look like I would tip well? The answer is that I could tip well if treated well. I was not treated well, so I tip poorly here.

Goodbye Dosa! Never again!
author: H L.

description:
I love how beautiful this place is and not to mention how amazing their staff is. 

I came her for a birthday dinner, and the staff was so accommodating. Not to mention they make the best recommendations for those who do not know what to order. Not only on food, but on bottles of wine that we ordered as well. I love their selections!

Definitely recommend anyone to try to this place. Dont know what to order? dont worry their staff with help you!
author: Mimi T.

description: We love the food each time we go to Dosa. The mushroom uthapam and chilies uthapam (very spicy but one of my favorites) are awesome!
author: Kruti J.

description: This place is just awesome ! We had idli fries, spicy Mung masala Dosa and spicy basil Dosa. They were just awesome . The service and ambience impeccable. !
author: Neha S.

description: Good idly fries, veggie sliders, Rava masala dosa and truffle oil masala dosa....dahi vada were not good
author: G D.

description: We had a great time at Dosa! The bartender was friendly & helped with the drink orders. His specialty was the Steph Curry, quite a hit. The waitstaff was so friendly & made good recommendations. The decor is very pretty. We shared everything. They had a tasting menu but my son was familiar with Indian food so we let him do most of the choosing. The crazy bangalorean, a balloon of light airy tastiness was a hit. The salads were delicious. The lamb chops were excellent. We enjoyed many other dishes. All seven of us were delighted.
author: Mary D.

description:
This restaurant was sold to us by people who frequent it a lot as "the best Indian in the bay" - and this might have been an overshot.  The atmosphere is urban-chic and it's certainly a swank stop for Friday evening drinks with friends or colleagues.
