The music and ambience was nice and the servers were excellent.  I have had some amazing-to-die-for Indian food in New York City and Washington DC and it seemed like the hype was about the sort of Japantown-chic vibe of San Francisco and the "different" Indian food rather than ridiculously amazing food.  

The food is south Indian, so it has menu items that you don't typically find in most Indian restaurants.  We had a couple different Dosas, uttapam, a chicken curry with coconut rice and a garbanzo dish.  And all of it was certainly tasty.  But I have to say it was quite spicy to the point that you couldn't taste the delicious flavors - one of the people we were with loves uber-spicy food and he was uncomfortably red and sweating and needed to order a Lassi right away! Not really the reaction you want on a Friday evening out!

The biggest issue I had was the price - it seemed to be quite expensive compared to other Indian restaurants.  As a last note, there were six of us seated at a table, and there was barely enough room for us.  We were squeezed in so tight that it wasn't totally comfortable to hang out for a couple hours.  I would rate this place as just okay.
author: Liza W.

description:
Must haves:
Hyderabad Chicken Biryani
Mixed Mushroom & Truffle Oil Uttapam

Drinks:
Peony
Wry Rajah
author: Shahin P.

description: Good south  Indian food that is reasonably priced. Menu is fairly decent with plenty of items and food tastes good.
author: Piyush K.

description:
Just had a super rude experience with the hostess. 
There were two hostesses working (one person was asking the other hostess a question) and when we went up to ask a question, she said "um, there's a line" in the rudest way possible. There was not a line. 

Then when she told us what the wait was, and we expressed dismay that it was much much longer than when we called 10 minutes ago - she said "well things change." Well duh... but you didn't have to be so rude about it.
author: Ann T.

description:
So I have been off yelp for a while now but I had to make a comeback only to let the yelp world know that this place is absolutely amazing. 
I walked in very casually in my work out clothes with family and the owner Anjan was at the door welcoming guests and seating them.. I saw the place was filled with corporate big wigs in their suites and ties and initially I felt a Lil out of place but Anjan immediately made me feel comfortable and seated us in the mezzanine for (which by the way is so spacious and gives you a feel of an open air restaurant) 
We had already placed our order to Connor our waiter for the night and were waiting on our drinks. Anjan saw us going through the menu and walked right up to us and said he could take our order if we are ready. Common now in the world we live in its impossible to see someone of his stature to be so humble. Totally impressed. 
I could go on but let me rate the experience 

Ambience - very casual / semi casual no on bothers you or judges you

Staff - very friendly and quick service 

Food - instead of westernizing their taste to pamper blant Caucasian taste buds they stick to the authentic taste and no riff raff about presentation. Though their presentation is above any restaurant I've visited in the valley.

Price - very reasonable considering the location and ambience 

One again a big shout out to Mr. Mitra  for the wonderful experience. I wish he had more locations down south Bay near san jose and the Silicon Valley 

Also I am huge fan of their dosas at whole foods in Cupertino.
author: Joshua R.

description:
Had a fabulous time for dinner last Friday 8/21. This is my 3rd time since they've opened their doors. We had their 3 course sampler and that was very delicious! 1st course was their Petrale Sole and it was just a teaser for sure! 2nd course was their rainbow Dosa with 3 different dipping sauces, simply amazing and for 3rd course was a lamb chop (ONE lamb chop). I had to be nice to share it as it was simply amazing! Previous to the sampler, we also ordered their calamari and their lamb burger sliders...LOVE it!  And for their dessert simply amazing Pistachio Panna Cotta! 

Service was just amazing...very fast and they all work with flawless synchronicity!  Everyone were very knowledgeable with the menu, that's impressivle!

I would have given them 5 stars but they need to be on top of their game especially for a fine dining restaurant. The crew need to keep up with cleaning their décor such as their pendant chandeliers...saw dust bunnies on the cables for customers to see...not so par. Just a suggestion for management to keep their crew on top of their game. I'm not being picky but after all, it suppose to be a fine dining establishment since their menu prices are on the high end side, treat this establishment as high-end, as well.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Dosa continues to spicily satisfy. As somewhat of a regular, I've gone through my share of dosas and uttapams, and if you're new to the restaurant, that's where you really have to start. 

But otherwise... damn the namesake and try some of their other dishes, like the rather excellent peppercorn chicken I had at lunch the other day, or the coconut cilantro fish at dinner. Or go traditional on weekend brunch with their fine rendition of thali (really a great way to get sudden exposure to the varied flavors of South India).

Whether I've gone in the day or night, the place stays lively (almost bursting on Thur/Fri/Sat). It's super to see a now "older" restaurant keeping its charm and substance, but staying modern; a good sign that Dosa is going to be (if not already) a San Francisco institution. 

Locals note: I now live a block from this location so I'm expecting to use the bar quite a bit, itself with its own sense of spice and flair!
author: Nish N.

description:
This is a great place for Indian food. We tried the Chennai Chicken, Dahi Vada, Rava Dosa, five moons uthappam and the quinoa uthappam. We had Steph Curry for the cocktail and some filter coffee.

All the dishes and cocktail were probably among the best tasting ones in the Bay Area. The ambience is great and the staff is very friendly. They even charged my iPhone.

The background music has an unique feel to it. There was some pop music mixed with Indian Bollywood tunes played at an optimal volume where you can still maintains dinner table conversation without having to shout over the music.
author: Sudarshan S.

description:
I've been here a couple of times now and I've loved the experience each time. The ambiance is amazing, with a lively setting and a classy decor. 
The idly fries are my favorite - I thought it was a very novel idea. The dosas are absolutely yummy. 
I would love to go back here again!
author: P J.

description:
You had me at habaneros.  Yummm yummmm. 

On a sunny summer morning in June, 2011. A bunch of girls walked in to this beauty. We all cheered, ate ,marveled over our food ( I was the ONLY non Indian person in the group) and flew back home happily after.

Yum! Dosa is pretty magical. It's not what you expect from an Indian restaurant yet it has everything you would expect. I love their dosas (obvi), chaats and even curry dishes. The service is always fantastic. Spice level- true to the cuisine. As a spice fiend, I hate Americanized spice levels. 

Dosas- pretty damn magical! All perfectly cooked, fluffed, flaky and tasty. We had Masala dosas, 
Regular plain dosas 
Truffle dosas!  
Pani puri - these little things are my favorite to eat. You get to break the little balls of puff pastry, putt condiments and spice water in. And eat it.  I get to play with my food before eating it? Double score. So yummm
Chenai chicken- tasty tasty!
Oh and that one time last summer ( June,2013) my sassy waiter brought me exactly what I wanted. Extra spicy mind blowing Dosa! So spicy, it was laced with habaneros. It was so spicy, nobody at the table except me could eat it!

 Respect you fellow blazer wearing person. Respect for blowing my mind. ( He was fierce in his velvet blue blazer- I had my non velvet blue blazer on. Of course we got along. ( He was a restaurant manager perhaps?) My fellow brunch people had to cool down with lassi and bloody mary to get that spice out.  Teehe. It was pretty mind blowing though. So hot! My friends always say I know way too many Indians. I do. And I love their food too. 

Having tried a few too many restaurants and home cooked dinners/feasts , I can easily say Dosa kick ass. It was right up there with being my favorite indian restaurant. There are many in the bay area but I have always returned here on my visits. Not planning to stop that anytime soon.
author: Latifa S.

description:
This place doesn't really need a review, but there you go. We got the spicy basil dosa, an amazing twist to mysore masala dosa I feel. Worth ordering. The mushroom and truffle oil utthapam was pretty good too. The better part of the meal was the appetizers though. We got the vada pav and idli fries. The chutneys made both appetizers out of the world. 
They say you meet interesting people at interesting places. We had a nice light hearted conversation with out table neighbours who kindly bought us desert at the end. All in all a pretty good dinner date!
author: Rangoli A.

description:
All-around fabulous dining experience! Dosa is the real deal!

Note: because of it's popularity in the Bay Area, try to come here for week-night dinners or make reservations in advance. If you're up for the wait, you can never go wrong ordering cocktails at the bar to start. 

Would highly recommend Dosa to friends planning to visit the Bay Area.
author: Michelle L.

description: Slightly overrated place. Rich, quality food lacks authenticity. Good service. A little noisy than the normal SF restaurant
author: Akshay D.

description:
Really nice interior, the inside is very classily decorated, two levels of seating, dim lighting. Went for dinner in a Sunday night, did not have a  reservation, but we were quickly sat at a table upstairs. Service was great, the waiter was extremely patient with how long it took me to order as my friend explained the menu to me.

Ended up ordering the mint lemonade and the vegetable dosa, so different than when I was expecting, but so good. I liked dipping the dosa into the soup and the sauces, and the veggie potato mixture inside was delicious!!!

Would definitely come back and try more dishes.
author: Javi Alexa A.

description:
Food and dining experience great - bar - awesome... If u want to be served by a sassy b*tch.

We were airing for the third person in our party to show.  My friend and I sat at the bar for a drink.  While looking over the menu, I saw the Ginger Ante (rum, ginger nectar, ginger ale, like).  I love Moscow Mules, so I asked, "is this the same idea as a Moscow, but rum instead of vodka?" And with much sas, the response was, "no, it's completely different.  The ginger ante is based off a dark and stormy.  Dark and stormy was created back in (insert date he said).  So that's what it's like." 

I responded, "I never heard of a dark and stormy , but it seems like it's the same ingredients as a Moscow, just with rum?"

"No, completely different, as I said, it's like a dark and stormy (still not explaining wtf a dark and Stormy is).  A Moscow Mule was invented later l, in the 1950's in a country we don't mention here (guessing he didn't know where Moscow is), but yes, if you must, I guess it's like a Moscow mule rum instead if you must think of it that way".  Idk if the history lesson was correct, but at least the drink turned out delicious.

Then it got worse.  My friend asked him to make her a drink - or "invent a drink" for her liking.  

"I'll invent you something off the menu, and you're going to love it. I'm going to make you a Peaony.  My fired noticed the description and saw coconut. 

"I don't like coconut..."

"Don't worry, you're going to live it, it's out number one drink here.  If you don't like it , I'll make you something else."

Well, she didn't like the drink or his attitude.  I thought it tasted good, but then again, I don't mind coconut...

When the server came to get ha to seat us, we asked for another drink instead.  I saw the server and bartender speaking.  He was in disbelief. " tell me she didn't like the Peony" and threw his hands up in disgust.

The mood wasn't off to a good start.  The server was awesome, gave great recommendations.  It was my first time having Indian cuisine, and it was a great time with good friends and food.  We left smiling, I had 5 ginger antes :)

I had two more at a bar after , I asked for a Moscow mule but with rum- and the bartender knew exactly what to make! I told him the story and he laughed and called he dose bartender a shmuck! Lol

Bottom line- cool atmosphere , good food, awesome dinner service... And if you like your drinks served with sassy attitude by a bartender that can only make drinks off a menu... Go to dosa
author: Brandon K.

description: First time in San Francisco, looking for different types of foods to try. The food here was great, but extremely poor service. Ordered three items from the menu, but only one came. Later, was asked by the waiter if I was waiting for anything else. I repeated the missing items, waited another 20 minutes but order never came. I was asked by the waiter asked once again what I was waiting for. Waiter blamed kitchen members did not put order through. Nevertheless, I had to speak with the manager several times. Stayed at the resturant for over 3 hours just waiting for my food to arrive.
author: Helen A.

description:
I dont know why people have given such a good reviews to this place. I just did a take out of 3 Masala dosas and Idli (as described by the receptionist idli will be 3 or 4 in count. I was just surprised to see 2 )  after reaching home.  
Food is too costly$$ in comparison to quality.
I would not recommend this place!
author: Vini G.

description:
Truly a top-notch, eclectic fusion experience. Regardless of whether you are an anti-Chicken Tikka Masala kid who grew up on authentic Indian food, like me, or a complete stranger to the world of Indian masalas and "bad with spicy food" (some of the friends I came with), I would highly recommend this restaurant. 

Started off the night with the adorably-named 'Mango is the New Black' drink. The combination of dry whiskey, spicy mango nectar, and spicy agave left a really burn sensation but was also the perfect amount of sweet. I would like to come back and try other drinks here for sure. 

For the main course, we ordered the South Indian Moons (combo uttapam plate), Spicy Basil Dosa, Goan Shrimp Curry, and Chicken Korma. The uttapams very small and cute, but there were about 9-10 pieces (great plate to share with people). The plate had a white truffle and mushroom uttapam -- didn't know this could be a thing!! The Spicy Basil Dosa was also SO delicious. The sauce was basically a traditional mint and cilantro chutney with an Italian pesto spin. It was spread all over the Dosa, not served on the side.  

The shrimp and chicken items were tasty but next time I will veer away from these traditional curries and try more of their fusion items - Chennai Chicken, Shredded Duck, etc.

Come here with an open mind and empty stomach...and make it a mission to try as much as you can. I'm sure you will leave feeling absolutely delighted (although your pocket will feel a little lighter... it is totally worth it!).
author: Arushi S.

description:
I was first introduced to the restaurant by the bf over a year ago. & since then I have been back numerous times. I kid you not- THIS IS HIS FAVORITE RESTAURANT! We threw his surprise 30th birthday dinner here because that's how much he loves DOSA! 

I won't lie, the menu could be a little overwhelming for first timers. They give these complimentary bombbb crisps to start and they are so addictive! We've tried a bunch of their dishes but their menu is quite large... we've barely touched base on it. 

Some of my faves are: 
-duck tacos (it was too spicy for some of the lads so I had them all to myself lol)
-Chennai chicken
-Samosas
-Prawn Masala
-Sweet Potato & White Truffle Masala

I want to go back to DOSA now after writing this review!!!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I was in SF for an evening and really wanted to go to State Bird Provisions. Silly me, walking in without a reservation and thinking I might be seated. The hostess suggested I try Dosa. I headed down there and found something that was not at all what I expected!

The restaurant itself is really beautiful, with unusual, large-scale proportions. 

The service was fantastic. At first, I suspected our server was going to be completely overbearing, but he turned out to be fantastic. We were overwhelmed by the menu (not your traditional Indian restaurant fare, because it's Southern Indian, I guess?), asked him for suggestions, and he walked us through the menu in detail, pointing out his favorites and also the dishes that were popular among guess.

All the food was intensely flavorful, beautiful, had a nice amount of heat without being too spicy (we had a couple of non-spice eaters in our party).

When we sat down, they brought us a bowl of papadam. We were expecting some sort of sauce or something for dipping, but none was brought. So we dug in. It was really flavorful, with whole cumin seeds, and completely addictive.

For four of us, we ordered two small plates and three larger dishes.
Shredded Duck: A caramelized onion uttapam with duck vindaloo topped with tiny greens and some shredded watermelon radish. Beware, it's very tiny. However, it is highly delicious.
South Indian Bhel Puri: An amazing salad of puffed rice, green mango, beets, potatoes, tomatoes, onion, cilantro. Everything is cut up into tiny pieces and is impossibly light (like, the weight when you spoon it onto your plate is nothing), crisp, and an amazing combination of flavors. Served with two different chutneys; one was green and chimichurri-esque, and the other was tamarind and sweet.
White Truffle Masala Dosa: A huge, light dosa, crisp on the edges and softer in the middle, wrapped around mashed potatoes. The whole thing was buttery and redolent of white truffle. Super simple, but so delicious.
Winter Uttapam: A thicker version of a dosa, almost like a frittata, with the toppings cooked into it. This one had sunchokes, potatoes, spinach, sundried tomatoes, trumpet mushrooms, and caramelized fennel. It was tasty, but with that line up of toppings, it wasn't as flavorful as I expected. The three sauces it was served with were all delicious: coconut chutney (mild), tomato chutney (a little heat), and sambar, this incredible soup that I ate straight out of the bowl. That may have been poor form, but it was totally worth it. 
Kerala Fish Moilee: Sustainably-caught halibut in a pool of a red coconut sauce that was impossibly flavorful, citrusy, and spiced, over coconut rice. There was this amazing salad served with it with Brussels sprouts, butternut squash, and caramelized red onion. The whole plate was just beautiful. 

I wasn't planning to drink...didn't even really want to, but I couldn't pass up the opportunity to try one of their cocktails once I saw the list. I would've liked to try six of them, but settled on the Peony (Plymouth gin, hisbiscus masala nectar, coconut milk, lime, bird's eye chile). It was beautiful (a recurring theme at this place), light pink, opaque with coconut milk, and with a swath of lime zest on the top. It was balanced and flavorful, not too sweet, and the coconut milk was a nice counterpoint to the spiciness of the food. 

Dosa is totally unlike any other Indian restaurant I've ever been to, and I loved it.
author: Dara M.

description:
My guests and I arrived here promptly and were seated by the host. Having visited Dosa multiple times before I recommended this place to my husband as a must - try even for Indians. However, the service that night made me pledge never to come back there even though the food here is one of the best Indian fushion food in the city. 
  
Reason... our server was awful awful awful.... He was pushy and rude and just assumed that we were newbies to Dosa with no clue. I asked him about the difference between two ginger based cocktails and his response was all our cocktails are different with spices. Well.... that's not what I asked. 
secondly, we just started ordering appetizers and wasn't sure on the quantity so preferred to order less and then choose to order more if required and he was extremely pushy and said we needed to order more. Again, I had been to this place several times before and exactly knew their portion sizes so didn't appreciate his pushiness. Not to mention that we had to ask him thrice before we got poppadum in our table which my guests kid really wanted. I would imagine a restaurant of this caliber should provide special service to tables with children.

We hadn't even had the appetizers served when the same server told us "You better start ordering the entrees... We run out pretty fast". I mean really!!!! It was just 8.30 on a Friday night. I would imagine Dosa knows that weekend nights are busy and preps up accordingly. 

After dinner, we asked the kid if he wanted ice cream at Smittens and yes, he did. Douche Server just hears ice cream and immediately says in a rude fashion "We don't serve ice cream here" Well... we weren't really speaking to you.

WIth this bad customer service after paying a bill of ~$400, I don't think I will be ever returning to Dosa.I would imagine that with these prices Dosa should definitely work on their customer service (stop kiss assing the affluent white clientele while serving Indian food) or else it will be a matter of time when no one will be returning for their food!!! People dine out to get pampered and be treated special. This was definitely not at Dosa!!!!
author: Pooja P.

description:
I loved this SF Indian restaurant. I've only been there once just recently but my experience from start to finish was superb.  Room is grand. Visually it's a stunner with its artistic, unique, low key sexy lighting, high ceilings, hip SF vibe. Space is so clean and crisp compared to many cramped, cafeteria style Indian cafes.

Knowledgable staff was went out of their way to be friendly. You can judge a restaurant in some ways by how they pair food.  And DOSA knows how to pair food.

Ahhh, but the scrumptious food.  Date night or friends night out tip:  Want a perfect snack before going to the Sundance Movie Theatre across the street?  Sit at the bar. Order the spicy,good portion sized, filling VEGGIE SLIDERS ( As a bonus it comes with citrus vinegar kale, crisp chips and delectable chutneys.  Then pair with a PISCO SOUR cocktail  (Almost like a frothy cooling dessert but a cocktail) And their Pisco Sour is made with top of the line Encanto Pisco from Peru. I'm still licking my lips.  

This is Southern Indian food Vs. Northern Indian food.  Both good. The waiter can quickly and knowledegably explain the difference.  One not perfect note: It can get loud so come at off hours if you want intimate Vs festive.

Lastly, for those who've lived in SF awhile, do you recall this was an old Good Will Store? Coming to see the transformation a great designer can remake, is worth the price of admission. From frumpy to sexy, From bargain shopping to out on the town!
author: Marianne F.

description:
Fall Menu Alert at Dosa on Fillmore!!

Coming here for a pre-Fillmore dinner & boy were the fates smiling on us!  It's Fall Harvest Tasting Menu time!!!!!

Mr & I indulged in:

Kabocha Squash - the squash was a bit over-fried & greasy - maybe a tempura batter would have been better suited but nevertheless, it was still tasty!  Came with a spicy garlic tomato sauce as well as a sweet onion sauce - both were awesome.  Paired w/ a sparkling white & was a nice compliment to the heavy, fried squash

Pumpkin & Potato Dosa - tender potatoes schmeered w/ a wonderfully creamy pumpkin curry sauce & served w/ a spicy soup, spicy tomato sauce, MORE pumpkin sauce & a mild coconut - paired w/ a dry Riesling - really cut the spice & added a nice creamy flavor layer to the pumpkin.  This was my fav part of the whole meal - that pumpkin really shone & got an added boost form the tender fall-apart potatoes.  Yum!

Veggie Curry - just as delish as all the times before & packed a nice kick which was immediately tamed w/ their lovely yogurt.  White & purple potatoes paired w/ corn, green beans, peas & I'm sure a whole lot of other things....paired w/ a Malbec & this is where the pairing fell short - we thought the wine was too full & berry to go w/ the curry but 2 out of 3 were definite winners

After crying uncle & getting most of our main packed away, we decided to share dessert & got the Coconut Custard Cake.....wowsers!

Infused w/ curry leaves, this custard was more like a panna cotta - but hopefully there was no gelatin!  Tender, flan-like consistency w/ the chew of the coconut - this was pure awesomeness!

I like how they ask if you've been there before & will happily educate you about the dipping process or order suggestions - friendly crew, fab ambiance, delish food!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Brought here by some friends of mine and I have to say that the ambience here is great.  Loved the music that they were playing at the time and it felt like a pretty posh place overall.  We came in on a Friday evening around 9pm and found it solidly packed, which attests to its popularity.  We were seated after 45 minutes and I ended up ordering the Chennai chicken and the lamb dosa.

The Chennai chicken was tasty and came out in a fairly large sized portion for a small plate.  The chicken was fried and had a slight spiciness to it that gave it a nice little kick.  It came with a side of yogurt sauce, raw onions, and a lemon that added some nice additional flavor to the dish.  I thought it was a solid appetizer.

The lamb dosa was ok and not anything amazing.  It came out with a bowl of sambar, cup of coconut chutney, cup of tomato chutney, and a bowl of lamb.  The dosa was perfectly made, but the sambar and chutneys were not particularly flavorful / spicy and the lamb had the taste and consistency of a bowl of chili.  I was not impressed by the dish and it may be that I should've ordered another dosa.

Overall, I really liked the environment of this place and would come here to lounge at the bar, but I wasn't particularly impressed by the food.  I found it very overpriced for the quality of what you received... but then I've never thought of dosas capable of being fancy.
author: Randy S.

description: We waited for an hour and a half to get a table and it was worth it . The dosa was authentic but the chutneys do need some revision. Do try the chennai chicken . Their bartender is the best .
author: Kowshik D.

description:
I think there's a big unmet need for upscale Indian dining and I wish there were more places like Dosa in SF!

Loved virtually all of the food and most of the drinks.

Tip: GO!

Food: 
- Bhel Puri: nice and spicy
- White Truffle Masala Dosa: this blew my mind, honestly. So creative and so delicious!
- Raita: don't skimp on raita, the food here is spicy and you'll need it
- Prawn Masala: definitely the standout curry of the evening. You have to try it!
- Chennai Chicken: bit like Indian KFC, super delicious!

Drinks:
- Mango is the new black: I loved the name, but this was way too strong for my taste
- Mango Lassi: really solid lassi. Thick, not too sweet, and no artificial coloring.
- Ginger Ante: what a fabulous drink! Kind of like a jazzed up ginger beer.
author: Neha S.

description: Great experience for new Year's eve celebration. Enjoyed the food, atmosphere, service and Bollywood dancing.
author: Natasha K.

description:
Writing this review after giving it 3 tries. One of the most overhyped restaurants in San Francisco.

Not authentic south Indian food. Food lacks flavor and spices. Have tried many dishes, even things like Dosa arent served with key chutneys. The masalas are nothing but mashed potato.
author: Arpit S.

description:
Place and ambience is really good. The waiter was great and so was rest of the staff. I just did not find the food very creative. The DOSA's were just ok . This is a great place if you want to consume south Indian cusine in upscale setting without fixating on pure taste. Drinks etc were fine and par for the course for an upscale resturant.
Chef can let the creative juices flow and throw in some creative DOSA combos which would make this place really great.
author: Vishal G.

description:
Update from my post below: received a very considerate message from the owner. So I bumped up the rating one star for the nice follow up. 

Very good appetizers but food and drinks were overpriced. Though I rarely yelp, the staff were too stuffy and inattentive for me to let it go. Parched for 10 mins with an empty glass and no one nearby, I got up from the table looking for water. This got their attention so they hurried over to refill the waters. I was quite pleasant about it, but they were unapologetic and annoyed. Later, again my glass was empty and we had to call over to the hostess stand for our check. I ended up drinking the rest of my sister's water. I had been here a few years before and had a similar experience, minus the water situation.
author: Jason P.

description:
Had much higher expectations for this place. Came on a Saturday night and the place was packed. The vibe they are going for is trendy but it felt a bit like they were trying to hard.The food was mediocre at best. 

We ordered the chicken samosa (decent) and the vegetarian samosa (meh). The chennai chicken lived up to the hype and I thought it was the one delicious item on the menu. I ordered the paneer and peas dosa and the lamb dosa. The dosa itself was fine but the paneer was incredibly bland, absolutely no flavor. 

The service was terrible. It was a busy night but our main waiter oscillated between forgetting about us and giving us the sense that he was rushing us out the door. The wait staff grabbed plates from our table that we were still eating out of. 

For the price, you can get much better Indian food elsewhere.
author: Ana D.

description: This is one of my favorite indian places in the city! Their chicken and bread both taste really good, and they even have this really good mashed potato like thing with bread! I also really like the fact that it's close to the Kabuki movie theater, so that after a movie is done in the evening, you can enjoy some dinner there! I really think you should check this place out some time soon!
author: Asher D.

description: Atmosphere is very pleasant. Tables are placed with enough room in between. Food is very good and interesting. Dosas are awesome. Wine is good too.
author: Ellen L.

description: Nice place. Ambiance is wonderful, would be a good idea to make a reservation, else you will end up waiting. The food is authentic and flavorful. I've visited the one on Valencia as well but this place is more spacious.
author: Venkat R.

description: Good food, great space.  Docked one star for price.  (Maybe I'm just cheap)
author: Paul W.

description:
This place was phenomenal. Perfectly crafted cocktails and some unique but authentic dishes. I really enjoyed the Mung bean salad with pomegranate and persimmon. It was my favorite dish by far and I look forward to trying to recreate it! The cauliflower and kohlrabe soup was also spiced but not over spiced and the flavors all came together really well. 

Definitely get the mango is the new black cocktail. Coming at a close second is the F1 sidecar. 

My friend raved about the woda sambar. It had fresh drumsticks (vegetable) in it which is pretty rare. I also ordered the lamb vindaloo with coconut rice. The coconut rice was good. Although I like Thai coconut rice more,  my friend who grew up on Indian good said that it was amazing. 

All in all a great experience. I will definitely return on my next trip to San Francisco. 

Note: this place is popular. Show up early and expect an hour wait around 630 on a weekend or around the holidays (I'm guessing). But you can also get a seat  at  
the bar pretty easily before 630.
author: Nina P.

description:
I wouldn't even care to come here if it wasn't for Adrian McCaffrey and Juan santamaria.

This place has some very, very amazing food which obviously comes with a high price but, Juan is simply the star, and I think that if the house only knew, they would have lines waiting out front. This man has not only good morals but also values his customers as if they were his. 

Owners, give this man a raise or promote him if you want your business to blossom. Not only that he is loyal, he is also very-very hard working and always smiles and says please and thank you. To another successful business owner, it means a lot.

Thank you for reading,

Gary Kassimov - President
Gary's Guaranteed Rooter, Inc.
author: Gary K.

description: This place is one of the best places to dine in San Francisco. A must go for Indian food lovers. A few friends of mine had took me here earlier and I started liking this place right from then on. The Vada Pav here is just out of the world. Coming from India and having Vada Pav there in Mumbai and many other places, I can tell you that you could never get a tastier Vada Pav anywhere else. My wife and I also like the South Indian Moons - an assortment of Oothappams. The ambiance is very good and the service is of ver high quality too. If you are planning for dinner, I suggest you make a reservation early in the day or the day before. This place is slightly pricey but worth every buck!!
author: Varun V.

description:
I came here years ago and had been dying to come back for a long time ever since.  The perfect opportunity came into play to have my graduation lunch here.  All the staff was courteous and solicitous for the entire experience. 

Our party of 7 was served upon by AC.  He was every bit patient with some of us who weren't real sure what to order and answering questions about the menu.  For some who weren't too keen on "spicy" he suggested the Papadam with some yogurt sauce.  Good call!

Several in our party ordered a Dosa, but I couldn't get past the Lamb "Frankie".  I asked for extra spicy, and they did just that!  It was yummalicious, juicy morsels of lamb combined with South Indian spices rolled up in roti.  It hit the spot.  I can't wait to come back with my bf and sample some small plates.  

The decor inside is beautiful and themed appropriately emanating South Indian motifs and colors.  -love the lavish chandeliers and as I remember, the lighting gets dramatic and creates a perfect date night atmosphere.

The only thing I would say is despite many people being in the restaurant for our late lunch the drinks came out kind of slow (wine and dirty martinis) or we were drinking too fast.  -guess that's what happens when you're having fun. lol  They were good with keeping our water glasses full though and clearing the table.  -awesome spot and definitely one of my favorites.  

Heck yes, I'll be back!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
This was my first time at Dosa after hearing rave reviews about it from others. Unfortunately it did not live up to the hype, in my opinion. 
Pro: pleasant ambience, good portion sizes.
Con: overly expensive, average food (my husbands lamb was too salty, my branzino was good but had too much of some sauce slathered over it), extremely slow service.

Value for money, I don't think Dosa is worth it.
author: Afua A.

description: I ate here over a year ago while on vacation and I am still thinking about it. This was one of the best meals of my life. If they are still offering the 3 course meal, I would highly recommend doing that so you can try several items. I can't remember exactly what I had but I know the first course was soup, the second had paneer, and the final course was spicy shrimp. By the last course I was so full, I wish I could have taken food home but alas with traveling that does not work. The drink menu is also amazing and very unique. I had some sort of gimlet that was spicy, and it was crazy good. This place is a must visit, and make a reservation it gets packed!
author: Lindsay D.

description:
An Indian restaurant with great service.

Came here with some Indian friends once. Surprising for an Indian restaurant, they don't have a lot of vegetarian choices. Food was pretty tasty, but the portion was small. 

If you want a fancy Indian restaurant with great service, this is your too choice. Considering the price and the amount of foo, I wouldn't come back again personally
author: Ruxin H.

description: I had a great experience the service was excellent the food is very good I suggest that you make a reservation I was actually early for my reservation but they took us right away. Not sure about parking I was actually very lucky I found spot right in front of the restaurant.
author: Ron R.

description:
Wow...we are pretty disappointed. Food was decent but this might be some of the worst service we have ever had, especially at what is supposed to be a fine dining establishment. At $101 for lunch for 2 you would expect more than having to ask for a second drink, ask for the papadam, ask for the check and not even receive a thank you on our way out. We were bounced back and forth between servers and while we saw what looked to be the GM in a grey suit, he never stopped by to check in. 
Needless to say, we will never be back or recommend it to anyone. Bummer.
author: Jessica H.

description:
One of my go-to restaurants in San Francisco.  I've been going here for years and have had the pleasure of introducing a number of people to this restaurant.  No matter who we bring, they always enjoy it, from my ten year old nephew to my 92 year old grandfather.  The food and drink are all delicious.  I especially like the onion rava dosa.  And they make my ALL TIME FAVORITE  cocktail, the Peony (coconut, hibicus masala, bird's eye chile -- you gotta try it if you like sweet and spicy drinks!).  The interior is gorgeous and the restaurant has a festive feel.  It always feels special, even after the millionth time, and it doesn't break the bank.  Dosa today, Dosa tomorrow, Dosa forever.

Edited to Add: I'd be remiss if I didn't mention the "Dosa Date" -- when you grab dinner at Dosa followed by a movie at the Kabuki theater.  My husband and I thought we pioneered the Dosa Date but when we mentioned it to our couples friends we learned that they do the "Dosa Date", too!  I suspect a lot of people do.  Great way to spend a low key Friday or Saturday night.
author: Olivia W.

description: Wow!! Awesome food. Such great ambience and very very yummy food. Dosas are extraordinary. Wonderful service. Uthappams are yummy. Overall this is the best Dosa place in San Francisco.
author: Dheeraj M.

description:
First off, the interior of this place is gorgeous.  They have two cool feathery chandeliers hanging downstairs that creates a lovely modern atmosphere.  There is also beautiful artwork/photography of scenes from India. The ultra uber music with indian mix was a very nice touch.

It was recommended by my Boss (who has been in Bay Area for 20 years and knows food scene) and the ambiance was completely impressing.

The wait staff was amazing and very professional, the starters came out on time (VADAPAV, MINI IDLIS, IDLI FRIED). We were on a road trip from LA and my parents were craving Uttapams and Dosas. The Caramelized Onion Uttapam was very soft and nicely made. My wife had a Thali and others had Vada Pav and Paper Dosa.

My Rava Masala was perfectly made (crispy and crunchy). The deserts were not super good and thats why I am deducting one STAR.

Surely a place to celebrate Birthdays, special dinners or just Indian Food.

Thanks
author: Mehta H.

description: Had dinner at Dosa on Fillmore rather early on Friday evening - definitely a good time to go as the place fills up quickly.  Our table ordered an appetizer, main courses,  and two desserts which we all shared and all were delicious.  The service was professional, warm, and helpful as we were not familiar with menu...thank you,  Sean!  Looking forward to a return visit. The chocolate passion fruit tart was a standout.
author: Pam S.

description: Nothing special. We had a bunch of different dosas. nothing special. Appetizers were really good though. But too crowded and service was bad (messed up order, got delayed)
author: Arjan N.

description:
The first thing that catches your eye the moment enter is the ambience and the beautiful decor. Let's just say that they spent quite a bit of money on the items they have chosen to decorate the place. I won't go into detail with the pieces because I don't want to spoil it for ya. Go see it for yourself. I love the high ceilings and the top floor seating. Although the downstairs area is nice too.  

THE BAR AREA- I must say that they have the most legit bar staff in the whole Bay Area. They are quick and the orders just keep coming in and the bartenders just keep pushing them out. Sometimes we come in just for drinks before our movie next door at the Kabuki Theater and I always love sitting at bar to watch  bartenders. They sure do know how to put  on a show. 

Cocktail drinks- I absolutely love love love the PEONY! So delicious. It has this hibiscus masala nectar and kaffir lime leaf top off with birds eye chili and orange blossom water and of course the alcohol choice is a gin and the coconut milk. Doesn't that just sound so enticing! They have a variety of great cocktails on their menu but the Peony is my fav.

The food- There is a tasting menu which gives you a selection of their popular dishes, three course meal. Wine pairings are also suggested. Other wise they also have full menu of all their wonderful and delicious Indian Cuisine ranging from different levels of heat. I tend to go for all the lamb dishes. Lamb meatballs is the best. 

I love the staff here. Everyone is so friendly and you just know that they all mean business and I can see why Dosa has received so many different awards for their food and drinks. This place has to be my all time favorite Indian Restaurant. The Peony alone is worth coming in for a quick drink. This place is alway busy so be prepared to wait but patience is a virtue because you will not be disappointed.
author: Mr G.

description:
I came here with my mom and some friends when she came to visit the city. I'd never had dosa before so I was a little overwhelmed with what to expect, but it was pretty good. Our server was very nice. Luckily we got a reservation on Opentable so that it wasn't a long wait to get a table. We were seated in a quieter area of the restaurant, which was a relief, since it was so loud and crowded! Only real downside to the service was that because it was so busy, they forgot one of our appetizer orders and by the time they delivered it we were halfway through our dinner and had no room to eat more.

I got the pumpkin dosa which was pretty good. I expected there to be pumpkin inside the dosa, but it was just a separate dip, which was sweet and yummy. Next time I come here I probably wouldn't eat the insides of the dosa--or maybe it was just the pumpkin dosa filling that was boring, just potatoes. My boyfriend got the paneer dosa which came in 3 little wraps instead of the large triangle, and I thought that one tasted really good.

If you can come here DEFINITELY try the peony cocktail! SO GOOD! I had the Mango is the New Black cocktail which was ok but a little watery. My boyfriend had the specialty gin and tonic which he said was also alright, not really like a gin and tonic. But the Peony was sooooooo decadent and delicious and absolutely amazing. Yummmmm please.

Maybe if I came here again we'd just order a couple of dosas to share, instead of everyone ordering a separate dosa.
author: Katie V.

description: Love this place- great decor, service and parking!  Samosas are wonderful, with veggies/spinach and an array of sauces. Dosa rocks, plenty of vegetarian options such as veggie curry, lentils, potato curry dishes.  Friends had the lamb curry, they said was delish!  Fresh ingredients, blend of spices are wonderful...curry is awesome, hot and sweaty, but awesome.  Very unique and tasty cocktails too!
author: Rhondi S.

description:
Extremely Extremely overpriced.

The food here costs about 25 times more than it does in India and in my opinion is a over 25 times worse.

When we (four of us) got there, the restaurant was fairly empty so we requested to be seated at a slightly larger table as we knew we would be ordering a bunch of food including dosas which would take up the place on the small table that they seated us. They refused to do so saying that both the empty 6 person tables had reservations beginning 20 minutes later. When we left 90 minutes later, no one had taken any of those seats and it was very obvious that they had lied in order to save the tables in the hope that larger groups might come in.

I ordered a sada paper dosa for myself, and I specifically asked our server that it be made extra crisp, but when it came only about 40% of it was crisp and the rest of it was soft. 

We also got the kofta, which to me was not worth the the cost specially since they do not even include a bowl of rice with the $20 entree so it had to be purchased separately as did the chutney.

Additionally, our server took his own sweet time to refill water glasses and only did so after being asked to (when I managed to flag him down). 

The only redeeming quality of this restaurant was that they seem to have kept the restroom clean.

Overall, I just don't think that this place is worth as much as it charges and that they need to improve their service.
author: Saagar U.

description:
After getting the Christmas tree and before stopping by the Korean grocery store we decided to grab a quick lunch at Dosa. This was the best decision of the day. 

The South Indian caramelized onion  pancakes were top notch. Full of flavor and spice it's South Indian food you won't forget especially for the price.
author: Jerime B.

description:
4.5 STARS!!! 

My boyfriend took me to Japantown and I immediately thought that we were going to be eating sushi but instead he took me to Dosa. The restaurant itself is beautiful. I fell in love with all the decorations. Very elegant looking to me. 

Our waiter was friendly (can't remember his name) and gave us recommendations since it was our first time there. He was very knowledgable of the menu and was helpful. The waiter gave us this complementary snack before ordering and it was a great way to start the meal. I wish I knew what it was called, but I think it's some type of Indian chip or maybe bread? 

I ordered the chicken xacuti and the mango lassi. My boyfriend ordered the lamb dosa. The chicken xacuti is a curry dish and it was DELICIOUS. The sauce was spicy but not too overwhelming. It's served with coconut rice which is a good complement. As for the mango lassi (yogurt based smoothie), I thought it was average. It was not as sweet as the other mango lassi that I've had in the past. The lamb dosa was delicious as well and it wasn't as heavy of a meal compared to the chicken xacuti. The staff are very quick in regards to refilling water glasses or responding to customers' questions/requests. 

Reason why this place is 4.5 stars instead of 5: Despite the flavorful amazing food, I thought the pricing could have been maybe 2-3 dollars cheaper (at least during lunch time). Also, I thought $5 for a mango lassi was overpriced. I'm used to paying $3 at other indian restaurants. 

Anyway, if you are in the Japantown area and don't have a particular craving for sushi TRY DOSA. The restaurant is gorgeous. The staff are friendly. The food (although overpriced) is flavorful and packed with a lot of spices. Go out and try it! 

I will definitely be coming back to DOSA in the future (and bringing friends/family to try it).
author: joanne c.

description: This food here is so delicious.. I had the Kheema dosa and mini uttapams they are really too good.. I definitely recommend to try these
author: Hemanth A.

description: Expensive and the taste is not up to my expectation, it's more like North Indian food not South Indian food. I tried dosa and sambar, sambar tasted like what I, an amateur, cook at home.
author: Devan K.

description:
Good Food , Good ambiance and Great Service!

Tried the Vada pav. Loved it. Especially with the extra ghee(clarified butter) and gunpowder( spice mix) it comes along with. Tried the Duck appetizer. Very nice!! a little on the spicy side I must say.

For mains we had the basil dosa and the prawn curry. Both were really nice. We got the paratha as a side (2 pcs/ portion).

Overall I would definitely recommend it should you want to experience a fancier south Indian food faire... else there are other places around the bay where you can find similar food at a way cheaper price.
author: Insiya N.

description: I believe this place is over rated. The bar is well stocked and the bullet bourbon old fashioned was prepared very well. However the ambience is not very warm and cosy. The menu is interesting and has a wide range but it leans towards the over doing side a bit more than real content. I recommend the scallops but they are fairly spicy.
author: Khash S.

description: Food is good but not amazing. The price is pretty high, but may be because of its location. The service is not bad, but we had to sit pretty close to another couple, therefore had no privacy while talking and also had to shout out loud....Wasn't not an amazing experience.
author: Pratyay M.

description:
The strange flavors that I engulfed this evening were absolutely terrible. But the 165 price tag made it even worse. The chicken curry was the only savior out of the entire meal and it was a 4 out of 10. Even the water tasted funny.  

Maybe the Persians were cooking the Indian.
author: Robert A.

description:
Absolutely love it. Coming from a South Indian, it's a compliment when I say I love the dosas here. 
The dahi vada is really delicious and looks interesting. 
The drinks are good too. 
I like this location more because it's pretty big and spacious compared to the one on Valencia.
author: Rohini A.

description:
YES YES YES!

I cannot rave about DOSA enough!! I was so excited to check out DOSA for its fresh take on indian fare and beautiful interior. I made reservations via Opentable and we were seated in a relatively short time. They have an upstairs dining area as well. We were seated downstairs in the corner, which was great because we were actually able to have a conversation.

We ordered the Hyderbadi lamb chops which were to die for!! As well as the truffle dosa. Both were delicious and met my expectations. DOSA is also known for its craft cocktails. I opted for a Spanish wine with my lamb, but my friend really enjoyed the ginger ante.

I can't wait to come back!!
author: Shana B.

description:
The dishes we had at Dosa were innovative and beautifully presented. The coconut corn soup had delicious, subtle flavors, and the sweet potato dosa was an awesome twist on a classic. The flavor and spicing of the sambar and coconut chutney were spot on. 

The atmosphere and service were also great. We were seated immediately at the communal table at 6PM on a Saturday, although the restaurant quickly filled up by 6:30PM. The service was lightning quick.
author: Vijay N.

description:
Sadly, I would not recommend Dosa on Fillmore to anyone for their Diwali celebration. I generally love Dosa, especially this location, so was excited to visit for Diwali with my husband for a nice, pre fixe dinner and a few cocktails. I haven't been in several months, so I'm not sure if the decline in quality is broader than just this event. The summary is that the service was slow/rude and the food did not seem as fresh as it should have been.

What went wrong:
- Running behind on reservations, we had an 8:30pm table but were seated at 9:15pm
- After delivering our cocktails, I asked the waiter to snap a quick photo from my phone. He said, "Sure, I'll just be right back" but then proceeded to enter an order in the computer and wait on other tables right in front of us - he never returned for the photo!
- There was too long of a wait between the courses of the pre fixe menu, and many of the items delivered were luke warm and seemed like they had been sitting out for some time
- There are only 3 choices of 2 items each on the pre fixe menu, yet one of them was incorrectly delivered to our table initially
- We asked a server to pack two of our dishes and take away the rest - he stacked both the dirty dishes and the dishes to pack all in one go! While I understand that he would use a different spoon to empty the leftovers into plastic containers, it's still gross to stack them along with the dishes that you're going to discard. This was unprofessional and I would have preferred he take the dirty dishes and the leftovers separately
- The worst part was when the server came back with our doggie bag - one of the curries was spilling out of its container! He took it back, replaced the bag and wiped down the container - but it was clear he didn't take care to replace the container altogether, as you could tell the curry was still spilling out

What went right:
- I have to say the cocktails were amazing. We ordered 4 in total and I'd highly recommend 3 of them: Steph Curry, King Khan and Peony were all yummy
author: Ketki W.

description: Dosa on Fillmore is very good but also very spicy.  But the staff is ready to have plenty of water on hand at your table.  The bartender was very nice and recommended the Peony cocktail, which was amazing!  I had the Lemon Chili scallops and the lamb chops were delicious.  My friend had the Red beet and cumin soup and the Uttapam Muscovy Duck, wonderful as well.  Definitely would recommend this restaurant if your on Fillmore Street.
author: Karen W.

description: My go-to Indian restaurant in the city when I'm looking for good South Indian food (ie. Dosa, sambar, chutney). They have a great cocktail menu too.
author: Shilps S.

description: The service is really slow and the food arrives cold. The flavor are not that great either. Would not recommend this place if it's your first time eating Dosa or if you are craving Indian food!
author: Ridhi S.

description: Tasty food, awesome presentation, friendly staff. Great for team lunches and party gatherings.
author: Kamal G.

description:
My boyfriend is south Indian, my best friend is Indian, and her date is British/ Sri Lankan. When all three of them love the food, you know it's legit. (I kinda knew it before. This just confirms it)

And SO affordable (it was my friend's birthday and with 3 of us covering dinner for 4, it came out to only $27 before tax)! Plus the service is great, the upstairs is a little more private and there are a few on the wait staff always keeping an eye on the tables and making sure the water is filled, your questions are answered, etc. 

Last time I came I got cocktails as well and they were delicious. This time we got:

* Vada Pav - 4 stars
Spiced-potato patty, chutneys, caramelized onions & "gunpowder"- ground chiles & lentils (1 for $6, 2 for $10)
Really well done, really spicy, and apparently its rare in Indian-American restaurants for them to split the "gunpowder" chile and ghee and let you mix them to your liking. The potato patty was fantastic, but the bread, while it had a good buttery subtle crunch, was just a tiny bit on the stale side (only reason this wasn't 5 stars).

* Channa Bhatura - 5 stars
Chickpea (garbanzo) masala served with an oversized, soft, puffy wheat bread or vegan poori ($15)
Love getting this at a table. The bread is the size of a pillow and always impressive when its brought to the table. The chickpeas are cooked to PERFECTION, any less and they would've been too hard, any more and they would've been too starchy. Strong and wonderful flavor as well.

* Uttapam - 4 stars
(Slightly thicker, pancake-style variation of the Dosa. Each Uttapam is also served with fresh fresh coconut & tomato chutneys  coconut & tomato chutneys and  sambar  sambar)
Topped with onion, tomatoes & green chiles ($11.5)
Really liked the tomato & onion one - the tomato gives it a nice tangy kick. The pancake, while soft and spongy and delicious, is just a little bit on the oily side though.

* Dosa - 5 stars
(Savory rice and lentil crepe, all served with fresh served with fresh coconut  coconut & tomato chutneys  tomato chutneys and sambar sambar, a flavorful lentil dipping soup made with vegetables and spices. Masala described below is a traditional filling of spiced mashed potatoes)
* Spicy basil - Masala dosa with a chutney of fresh basil, cashew nuts, ginger, shallots, curry leaves & chiles ($12)
* Spicy mung masala - Mung lentil dosa ('pesarattu')  with green chiles, chopped onions, cilantro and spiced potatoes ($12)
Both the spicy basil and mung were amazing. As thin as the dosa is, it still manages to have a soft interior with a slight crunch to the outside. The masala is great as always, and the basil wasn't too overpowering (we were afraid it would taste too Italian).

* Rasmalai - 5 stars
Sweet cheese patties, cream, cardamom, rose water ($6)
Love everything, from the toasted pistachio crumbles to the cardamom infused rose water to the chewy cheese patties.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Very bad restaurant they don't let you to finish your meal and they take your plate so you leave early because they have people waiting. Our dinner took exactly 40 minutes because they were pushing us to eat and leave. I won't recommend this restaurant to anyone. If you want to enjoy your family dinner this is definitely not the place.
author: Rubina H.

description:
The best dosa I ever had in US. 
I had dosa in most of the restaurants in San Jose, Dallas and New Jersey locations. But this place beats all other restaurants in it's taste, ambience, authenticity. 
The main food items to try here : 
1) Dahi Vada: very delicious and beautifully presented 
2) Lamb kheema dosa
3) Chilly garlic uttappam 
4) Vada Pav
5) masala dosa
author: Chetan B.

description:
Why Dosa's IS a 5-star place:

When you are emotionally overcome with deep sadness upon taking the last bite of your meal... you know you've eaten something special. I ordered the paneer and peas dosa. And it was gastronomical art. Accompanied with sambar and both a tomato and coconut chutney (I believe the coconut had cilantro in it - and I'm one of those people who LOATHE cilantro, but in this? It was totally acceptable!), my heart physically ached upon taking that final bite. Goodbye, beautiful meal, thank you for existing!

And yes, as the menu suggested, I totally used my fingers to eat... and classy restaurants that let me play with my food? INSTA-FIVE STAR.

The servers were incredibly informed about the components of each dish. I appreciated how, in a totally non-pretentious way, that explained their concept, what went best with what, why things were made a certain way, etc. And, I was a little seduced by the atmosphere in general - the decor was uber tasteful and classy, the lighting was romantically low, the background music was house/techno, and the clientele was all over the map. I'm one of those people who appreciate when four things that don't necessarily organically go together (fancyschmancy interior design, sexy time lighting, music that I want to rave to, and people I could either be having a business meeting or a bachelorette party with) do. Because in this instance, it totally works!

However, there are two reasons why Dosa's ISN'T getting 5-stars from me (feel free to stop reading here if you want, because they really are "As good as it gets!", except for...)

Reason #1, "Space Invaders Are No Bueno With Me" - Maybe it's because physically I'm a tiny chick, but people often associate my stature with age. Being little =/= being young. And when you're "young" it's okay to have your personal space invaded (or so is the mindset of many adults). That being said, the waitstaff at Dosa's definitely invaded my personal space every go-around with the plates (something I didn't notice them doing with other people). They would stand in back of me, reach around my torso/face with two arms to lift or place plates over my head. Again, something that probably wouldn't even register on other folk's radars, but it did on mine. And...

Reason #2, "Petty, Petty Pie Princess" - When I found out we were going to Dosa's, I did what any sane yelper does - I looked up their menu. The very first thing that caught my eye was some banana goat cheese pie thing. SOLD. That was the single thing I look forward to eating. When it came time for dessert, though, guess what wasn't on the menu? Mhmm, the banana goat cheese pie. We asked the server if they still carried it. "I'm sorry, we don't. But it was SOOOOOOO good. Like... seriously, so, so, so good. It's really too bad we don't carry it anymore," was her response. I don't want to hear how delicious something I can't have is, so the appropriate response - in my obviously humble opinion - would have been: a) "I'm sorry, we don't," (which is to the point without telling me whether it was good or not leaving me opinion-less and not dessert h'angry) or, b) "Not anymore. It wasn't that good anyway," with a wink and a playful smile (which is more fun and less braggy).

In the end... my advice? Go to Dosa's. Eat then weep at how gorgeous your meal was.

(Then weep some more because of a dessert you can't have.)
author: Steff D.

description:
I usually follow the Spice Route to Dosa Valencia, but Dosa Fillmore is a good place to alight, much like the Cape of Good Hope. Liquor=good hope.

Spice Route cocktails feature some new world wonders-lime, curried nectar, allspice, mango juice, jackfruit! After one cocktail, you'll need the feast to come.

While variety may be the spice of life, the paper masala dosa is the bread and butter of Dosa-sans butter. I love how it looms menacingly off of the plate, and with each bite of crispy dosa, potato, lentil, and cashew it becomes somewhat more contained. Usually I'm full by the time it reaches the confines of the plate, but I keep on going because it is part of the journey.

To ensure that you have adequate provisions for the voyage ahead, you must order the South Indian Moons uttapam-five savory pancakes selected by the chef, accompanied by chutneys and sambar.

I've veered off my beaten path on a few occasions. The Hyderabadi Chicken Biryani is a basmati rice bowl of tender chicken with Indian aromatics, and the masala dosa is a triangular pocket of potatoes, onions, and cashews. Both worthy excursions from the uttapam-paper masala route that I've carved out for myself.

Even though Dosa Valenica is obtaining a liquor license soon, I think I'll voyage here more often. The interior is so beautiful, the space so expansive, and the location perfect for a pre or post-Kabuki theater meal.
author: Joanna M.

description: I'll be blunt: Sitting next to some one racially different, served by the same individual and served a bit differently made it a bitter experience. I may just be paranoid being new to SFO. The food is great, I had Masala dose, idli and sambhar! Not too expensive for SF. Conveniently located, there is a Safe way parking about 2 blocks away. I am hoping the staff can be more welcoming in the future!
author: Doc R.

description: Stopped in for a quick drink.   Staff were professional ad kind.   Enjoyed a Steph Curry at the bar which was a delightful mix of bourbon and curry infused syrup.   Really good.   Will return for the food, which I can't wait for!
author: Max K.

description:
Now I have been to both Dosa's. BOTH are equally delicious.

I have been in love with Indian food for a VERY long time. I have NEVER had this kind of Indian food. I has the Masala Dosa which is a crepe like crust filled with masala potatoes served with many dipping sauces and soup. EVERY PART OF MY MEAL WAS DELICIOUS! I highly recommend this restuarnt if you love Indian spices and sauce! 

Dosa, I will frequent you often!
author: Brooklyn N.

description:
1* for service, 4* for food. Since I am weighing food more than the service for my dining experience, summing up with 3*.

I did not have reservation, was told about 30 mins wait. They entered my info incorrectly in their system, I had to wait almost an hour. Food took another 40 mins to come after we placed order and check took 15 mins to come after request. Nonody cared about the time we wasted. All in all, we wasted more than 2 hours for a decent dosa and not-so-great dahi vada. 

Would only come back on weekdays with reservation.
author: LivelyLajja M.

description:
On my visit to the bay, my good friend and his lovely girlfriend took me and my lady to this place. Apparently this has been their go-to place for Indian cuisine and it just so happened to be the last day for Dine About Town! Lucky us!

_what I ordered:
- Kale Pakora:: I'm not the biggest fan of kale but this salad tasted fresh with subtle flavors. It was light and delicious. 
- Lamb 'Keema' Dosa:: I have never had dosa before but I LOVE it! It was served with (3) different condiments varying on the spectrum of spice: coconut chutney, tomato chutney, and sambar. I believe that is the order from mildest to spiciest. If you are sensitive to spiciness, ask for the spiel on each (there is one gentleman that does an exquisite job at explaining it; it's theatrical!).
- Chicken Xacuti:: the chicken would literally fall off of the bone. it was perfect.

_atmosphere/service:
This is a very elegant, nice sit-down restaurant. The interior was very clean with very high ceilings and large-scale art to add to the ambiance.

_parking:
There's a parking structure adjacent to the restaurant. I'm not sure what the rates are because my friend covered it (thanks, Alex!).
author: Natsuki M.

description: Excellent location, formal dining decor and great flavors of traditional Indian with a twist. Whether you are South Indian and eat dosa on regularly or if you are trying dosa for the first time, this restaurant will not disappoint your palette. It's just unique!
author: Kiran A.

description: Dosa continues to be a good place to visit. Lunch menu was shorter compared to the dinner options but quality and service continues to be better.
author: Suresh S.

description:
Pros:
- delicious dosa and uttapan (with Americanized fillings)
- friendly staff and short wait for table

Cons:
- a tad pricey for dosa
- I don't have much to say (doesn't that in itself say a lot)

Bottom line: I will be back with my dosa-obsessed friend, but if you want more reasonably priced South Indian food, try Vik's in Berkeley
author: Jiann M.

description:
While I wrote reviews on yelp usually  for extremely bad customer service, first time I  am writing a review for customer service beyond excellence 

I went with my parents who were visitors from India. Loved the chennai chicken as appetizer my Rava masala dosa and my dad's paneer dosa. My mom who is visiting from India, so might have different expectations, did not like roasted garlic dosa. Daniel Dowell, operations manager, took it off  the bill and even insisted to try a free Pav bajji ,which is their popular dish, on the house as he did not want to see my mom leaving hungry, the Pav bajji was pretty good which she liked it. My mom has a dietician education background in Dietetics and can be a picky eater and lived mostly in India , so I was really pleasantly surprised that she liked food here

It is customer service like this one that's what makes dining experience endearing.
Superb customer service. Epic. Daniel dowdell is the best host you can have. So patient and so hospitable and was all ears to what my mom had to say
author: Sandeep G.

description: Great cocktails, great food. Just came here for some appetizers with my co-workers, but all of their food is good and the cocktails are delicious.
author: Rosy H.

description: Great food! My husband, his parents and I came here for lunch on a Saturday. We were seated immediately and were really looking fwd to some good food. We weren't disappointed. We ordered some vada pav, pani puri for appetizers. We also got their summer uthappam, onion rava, paper masala and corn/Panneer kofta with coconut curry. Everything was really good. They did mess up our order but fixed it when we questioned them. One server didn't acknowledge the mistake but another one quickly came by and said they would fix it. Another minor point is they were out of mango lassi!!! So one star removed for these two minor issues.
author: Harini R.

description: I really really wanted to love this place. The decor is fantastic and the service is really top rate. However problem was that almost everything we got was so over-spiced that it just tore your mouth up. Example we had the scallops which were in a coconut curry sauce and they were so hot that you couldn't even taste anything except your burning mouth flesh. We also have the famous chicken appetizer which was too hot for me. I eat a lot of  Indian food and I don't mind spicy food and my wife likes even hotter food than I do but we just weren't able to hack this food. We did have a really good salad with cranberries and citrus that I could recommend. The drinks are also good  Also we had a dosa that was fine but for the price we could get a better one for 7 Bucks at our normal Indian restaurant. So too bad probably won't ever go back there but if you love super nuclear hot food this is a place for you
author: Alexis A.

description: Always delicious! Would eat here once a week if possible. Love the many flavors and always well-prepared Indian fare. Tried the pistachio fudge for dessert for the first time - rich and delicious.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
Environment: Fun and hip. 
Drinks: Delicious...expensive but delicious.
Food: SO SPICY. Honestly, I don't have a high spice tolerance but my boyfriend does and even he had to stop eating his food. We honestly didn't even want to pack it to bring it home because it was too spicy.
Also, and this is my lack of cultural awareness, I didn't realize that South Indian food does not have naan. :( Sad day.
Service: Great. Super friendly. But it always kind of sucks when the waiter's switch in the middle of the dinner and you get the feeling that they are telling you to pay now so you can tip them. #awkward
author: Julianna I.

description:
I came here last Friday for their Dine About Town menu. Made reservations, showed up on time, made to wait for 30 minutes while plenty of others that came after were sat first. 

No big deal, it's Friday night, I'm sure they had earlier reservations or something.

Anyway, onto the food. Phenomenal.  I was expecting expensive "organic" butter chicken but I was pleasantly surprised.

I got the seafood soup for a starter. A heaping helping of the soup, that, while very sour and off putting at first, really grows on you. I slurped up every drop. The scallop, expertly cooked, the fish? Subtle and flakey. 

Onto the Dosa. I had no idea it was named after a type of food, cool.  Tasted like a crepe with potato filling, nothing crazy, but the dipping sauces they gave were great. I really enjoyed the minty one.

Finally the mains. The lamb course was delicious, but my girlfriend's vegetarian one was even better.  Sorry I don't recall the names.  The curry was flavorful without being too spicy. Complex and robust. Too bad we were so stuffed to really enjoy it.

I'll be back for sure.
author: Tu T.

description: Had good expectations but food & wine only average. Dour server. Sloppy looking hosting staff.
author: Robert B.

description:
Had the halibut last night. It was a special and so many delicious veggies and coconut rice. I get the rasam soup every time I go. Get it if you like spicy things. Rasam means fire broth. 

Tips- 
happy hour goes til 7! 
Get a reservation unless you don't mind waiting for a seat at the bar
author: Lark M.

description:
We went here last night and were shocked when we saw how busy it was on a Tuesday night. Thankfully, we made reservations (which I recommend). After trying the food, it completely made sense as to why this place would be packed on a random weeknight. The food was really tasty and the service was great! There is so much variety on the menu and I really don't think you could go wrong with any of the appetizers. 

We tried a variety of Dosa's and appetizers. The Chennai Chicken was by far my favorite and we couldn't get enough of the Idli fries  - what a great idea! The Masala Dosa was nice and crispy and perfectly made and the portions were pretty big.

Our waitress was attentive and gave us some great recommendations after asking us a few questions on what type of flavors and foods we like. Definitely coming back here again!
author: Nehal P.

description: The best Indian food I have had yet in the USA! The dahi rice was actually better than what I get in my hometown back in India ! Would love to visit again!
author: Neha P.

description:
Enjoyed a delectable lunch with awesome company, courtesy of my boyfriend =D

Dosa has been on my bookmarks for awhile now, and we finally got our butts over here to try it out. After checking the menu out online I figured it would be better to go for lunch (to spare our wallets a bit), and we didn't have to fight the crowds to get a table so it was win-win. 

We arrived when they opened at 11:30 and were seated immediately. The interior is very large and floridly decorated, but it's tasteful and interesting (definitely eye catching). The service is impeccable; our waiter was very nice, attentive and even answered my random questions when it came to identifying items of my thali. 

The BF ordered the Chennai Chicken as an appetizer, then the Prawn Frankie for his meal, while I ordered the vegetarian thali. First off: ORDER THE CHENNAI CHICKEN. This was the most perfectly cooked, tender chicken I have ever consumed, and it was coated in a combination of spices that enveloped your mouth in such a satisfying way. As if it couldn't get any better, they add a side of cucumber yogurt that you can dip your chicken it, which calms the spices and makes it even better!! That sauce was just as yummy as the chicken, and both my BF and I resorted to using a spoon to scrape the last remnants out of the cup ;)

The prawn Frankie looks like a wrap but it's filled with delicious shrimp and it's quite filling. As for my thali, when I received it I freaked out a bit because it was so gigantic! There were at least 10 little individual cups on this tray bigger than my head, and in the center were rice, and two kinds of bread. I couldn't name everything I had if I tried but I remember there was saffron rice, basmati rice, cucumber yogurt, veggies, a pickled vegetable of some sort, lentils, a spicy soup, a rice puff with ghee (tasted cheesy to me), and veggie curry among other things. There was so much variety but I was able to taste so many things for a reasonable price. LEGIT.

Overall this was a great dining experience. I would definitely come back, although the prices for dinner are a bit steep... then again they have a lot more entree options on the dinner menu so I bet it's worth it! Gotta come back and try the chai tea as well =)
author: Sam F.

description: I love this place! It's very different and authentic! When family and friends come visit us from Brazil we love taking them there! The Paper Masala is delicious even plain! And the chutneys are amazing! I am not a big fan of spicy food, so I get the Mango Lassi and it's delicious!!
author: Yael C.

description: I have no idea how a South Indian restaurant run by a non-indian comes out to be so close to perfection. Crisp dosas and their crispy fried idlis are so tasty! Yummmm!
author: Aswin V.

description: Great experience. Dosa always satisfies. We prefer the Fillmore location for elbow room and ambience. We enjoyed the goat cheese salad, dahi vada, masala, dosa, and lamb with dosa. Yum. We miss the Brussels sprouts but understand it is a fall dish. As people fairly new to Indian food, we appreciated Kevin, the server, was knowledgeable and efficient.
author: Jessica D.

description:
After my 3rd time here, I'd say focus on the small plates and the specialty cocktails. Don't expect an intimate setting but some of the music (loud) is pretty great. 
I love their presentation of the mango dessert and small plates. I'm def going back because for $104 I got 3 small plates, 3 cocktails, a dessert and a small, sweet Late Harvest Zinfandel! I felt stuffed!
author: Kevin F.

description:
We were only here for happy hour (before state bird) but I really want to eat here someday! It's like.. I love boyf on any given Sunday, cuddling on the couch or whatever, but wedding boyf in a suit is like whoa. Likewise, I love Indian food, so dressed-up Indian food is gonna blow my mind, right?

Anywayyyy my gf and I both had a margarita and a red off the HH menu each. Bartender said there were 2 shots in each margarita, which would have been nice to know before I ordered my second drink. Needless to say, we were both pretty drunk at dinner. PS the drinks were quite good :) Nice ambiance too, the place was surprisingly uncrowded and we were able to snag the last couple seats at the bar.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Great restaurant with very nice servers.
Our waiter explained the menu very kindly and easily and all dishes were very good.
Only one reason that I took one star away for rating is that overall the food was a little bit salty to me - it can be less salty while maintaining good taste still.
author: CHANGHEE K.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Dosa's flavors and gorgeous food. However, Dosa has a special "allergy menu" that's something of a problem. To me, being someone with food allergies (I'm celiac with additional food allergies) an "allergy menu" implies that the wait and kitchen staff are conscientious about the needs of those of us with food allergies. If you have a gluten-free menu, that means the food has to be prepared and cooked separate from other food. I've had many wonderful meals at Dosa and then been sick on my way home and for the rest of the night even though what I ordered supposedly didn't have anything I'm allergic to. My guess is that food is getting cross-contaminated--most likely when it's being cooked. 

Dosa should either get rid of their allergy menu so that those of us with allergies know that the food isn't safe or they should commit to insuring their "gluten-free" menu is actually gluten free and not getting cross-contaminated. There are restaurants in SF that meet the needs of those of us with real food allergies without making us feel like we're being high maintenance or asking too much: Nopalito has tons of gluten-free items and (at least on Broderick) is super careful about cross contamination. Tacolicious will cook food in a separate pan (not on the regular grill) for those who react to cross-contamination. And Delfina and Al's Place are also great at dealing with allergies and and making diner's with allergies not feel like pariahs or assholes. I've always wanted to believe that Dosa was in that camp but time and time again I've ended up sick after a really expensive dinner.

Oh, and their gluten-free dosa chips--at least at the Fillmore location (I'm not 100% about Valencia) get cross-contaminated after a certain time in the evening.
